Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivania es una mujer trabajadora y con mucho deseos de poder terminar de construir su casa, tiene 39 años de edad, procreo tres hijos los cuales los tres cursan sus estudios, su esposo es contador pero esta desempleado y solo con la pequeña pulpería sean estado ayudando, pero se ha descapitalizado, es por eso con este financiamiento lograra invertirle en: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, leche, lácteos, pollo, golosinas, gaseosas y poder aumentar las venta como sus ganancias para poder subsistir y poder seguir apoyando a su esposo que espera que pronto logre ubicarse en otro empleo. Ya que son tres hijos los cuales hay que apoyar para que logren una buena educación. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que como muchas familias Nicaragüenses podemos a salir adelante cuando se nos presenta la crisis económica del desempleo, u otra crisis.
texts.en:
Ivania is a hard-working woman who dreams of finishing construction on her house. She is 39 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is an accountant by trade, but he is currently unemployed, so her small grocery store is their family's only source of income. Her business is currently understocked, however, so this loan will allow her to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, chicken, candy and soda. She will then be able to sell more merchandise and earn more in profits so that she can sustain her family and support her husband while he finds another job. She has to support her three children so that they can get a good education. She is thankful to Afodenic for supporting many Nicaraguan families like hers through the current economic/unemployment crisis as well as through other past and future crises.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, chicken, candy and soda in order to offer a wider variety of merchandise and sell more items

loans.name: Lizbeth Rocio

texts.es:
Lisbeth Rocio H. P. de 27 años de edad vive en casa de su tìa desde hace 3 años, ella no tiene padres y por ello se vino a Ica junto con su familiar. 
Vive en Valle Hermoso – Subtanjalla, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Toledo - Cercado de Ica. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y tuberculos desde hace 2 años y medio.
La cliente se encuentra con 5 meses de gestación pero no vive con el padre de su hijo por motivos personales. Es bien trabajadora, goza de buenas referencias de los vecinos y de parte de sus compañeros de trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que desea mejorar sus ventas para obtener un mejor ingreso que le permita ahorrar para la venida de su bebé.
texts.en:
Lisbeth Rocio H. P., 27, has lived in her aunt’s house for the last three years. She does not have parents, so she came to Ica together with her relative. She lives in Valle Hermoso – Subtanjalla. Her business is located in the Toledo market in the area surrounding Ica. She has been selling groceries and tubers for two and a half years. She is five months pregnant, but she does not live with the father of her child for personal reasons. She is a hard-worker, and she has good references from her neighbors and colleagues at work. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business. She wants to improve her sales in order to get better earnings. This will allow her to save for the arrival of her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has worked as a hairdresser in her home since 2005. She receives clients in her house, where she has prepared a special room for this purpose. She is known by her village neighbors. She is 23 years old and married with a newborn baby. 

Today, Maria is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy beauty products and hair accessories needed to attract more clients and earn a good income to help her family.

loans.use: Buy beauty products and hair accessories

loans.name: Bolotova Rayma's Group

texts.ru:
Болотова Райма, является лидером данной группы.Ей 53 года, но все еще она активная бизнесвумен. Райма замужем, воспитывает единственную дочь. Ее дочери 20 лет, она студентка 3 курса строительного университета. Учится в столице Кыргызстана, в Бишкеке. Супруг пенсионер, и все свое время ухаживает за животными. Семья клиента занимается животноводством,  у них свое хозяйство состоящее из 5 КРС и 10 МРС. Кредит будет использован для закупа 1 коровы для откорма и последующей реализации. Как и большинство людей, она очень усердно работает, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни ее семьи. 

Омурбеку 45 лет. Он женат, имеет трех дочерей. Все дочери учаться в школе. Супруга домохозяйка. Сам Омурбек также занимается животноводством на протяжении последних 16 лет. Кредит будет использован для закупа 1 теленка. Стоит отметить, что до этого он никогда не работал с заемными средствами. Средняя прибыль в месяц равна 75 долларам.
 
Акин 55 лет, она замужем. У нее 1 сын. Супруг пенсионер, активно участвует в семейном бизнесе (животноводство), а также вместе с сыном дома изготавливают деревянные окна, столы, стулья и прочие. Она является казначеем группы и ответственна за собирание ежемесячной выплаты и погашения ее в Мол Булак Финанс. Кредит будет использован для закупа 2 голов КРС. 

Нурзат 30 лет, она замужем. У нее дочь и сын, оба детей дошкольного возраста. Супруг работает таксистом. Нурзат имеет свой собственный магазин по продаже продуктов питания. В этом бизнесе она три года. Кредит будет использован для увеличения товарооборота в магазине.

Гулбаре  55 лет. Она вдова. У нее семеро детей, самому старшему уже 37 лет, а младшему 13.  Старшие две дети на заработках в России. У нее есть собственное хозяйство, где она выращивает МРС и КРС, а также на земельном наделе выращивает картошку. Кредит будет использован для весенних полевых работ.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Rayma B. is the leader of this group. She is 53 years old, but still an active businesswoman. Rayma is married and is raising her only daughter. Her daughter is 20 years old. She is a 3rd year student at a construction university. She is studying in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. Rayma’s husband is retired and spends all of his time taking care of animals. The client’s family is involved in animal husbandry and has a household consisting of 5 cattle and 10 small livestock. The loan will be used for the purchase of 1 cow for raising and subsequent sale. Just like many people, Rayma works diligently in order to improve her family’s quality of life. Omurbek is 45 years old. He is married and has three daughters. All of the daughters are in school. His wife is a homemaker. Omurbek has also been involved in animal husbandry for the last 16 years. He will use this loan to purchase one calf. It is relevant to note that he never worked with borrowed funds. His average monthly profit equals 75 dollars. Akin is 55 years old. She is married and has 1 son. Her husband is retired and actively involved in the family business (animal husbandry). He and his son also make wood window frames, tables, chairs and the like at home. Akin is the treasurer of the group and is responsible for collecting monthly payments and repaying loans with Mol Bulak Finance. The loan will be used for the purchase of two cows. Nurzat is 30 years old. She is married and has a daughter and a son, both of whom are of pre-school age. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Nurzat owns a food products store. She has been in this business for three years. The loan will be used for increasing product turnover in the store. Gulbara is 55 years old. She is a widow and has seven children. The oldest is already 37 years old, and the youngest is 13. Two of her oldest children are working in Russia. Gulbara has her own household, where she raises small livestock and cattle. She also has a plot of land, where she grows potatoes. The loan will be used for the spring field work.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir is married and has a five-year-old son. His wife has a disability status. He is a private businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk. He runs a transportation service business. Volodimir offers taxi and delivery services all over the territory of Ukraine. He has been working in this industry for five years. Presently, he has about 5,000 Grivnyas of monthly income.  

Volodimir is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnya loan to do major repairs on his car engine. His car runs on methane-rich gas. These repairs will improve the efficiency of his vehicle and facilitate his work as a result. Moreover, generated income will help him finish construction of his private house. This business is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: To do major engine repairs

loans.name: Cecília

texts.pt:
Cecília J. T. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 23 e 17 anos de idade, os dois vão a escola. Fez somente 7 ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor monetário e produtos alimentares.
Saiu de Boane para a cidade da Matola após o seu casamento. Tem um negócio próprio e dona do mesmo há mais de 18 anos. Trabalha sozinha, as vezes tem tido auxílio das filhas, vende mais camas de madeira, mesas e estantes onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas caseiras e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus clientes que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (malas de madeira, camas, mesas, estantes e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este credito também para poder aceder a outros. No futuro deseja solicitar outros empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e construir um estabelecimento onde irá desenvolver o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Cecília J. T. was born in the district of Boane, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 42 years old, and a widow and mother of two children, 23 and 17 years of age. Both children attend school. She only went through the 7th grade, and wasn't able to continue because of her family's difficult financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her sons, and also supports her mother by sending her money and food. She left Boane for the city of Matola after she got married. She's owned her own business for more than 18 years. She works on her own, sometimes with her daughters' help, and sells wooden beds, tables, and bookshelves. She earns 12,000 meticals per month, which she uses to cover household expenses, and is even able to save some in her bank account. She's never received loans from other banks. She learned about Hvuluku through her customers who are alsoHvuluku clients. This is her second loan, in the value of 16,000 meticals, which she intends to use to purchase materials (wooden trunks, beds, tables, bookshelves, etc.) to increase her stock. She also used the previous loan of 10,000 meticals for this purpose. She's committed to paying this loan off on time so that in the future she'll be eligible for others. She'd like to request other loans to finish off her residence and build a structure from which to run her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia es soltera, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace cinco años, ella vive sola en el barrio Cupesi ya que ahi se encuentra  su tienda donde vende  todos los productos de primera necesidad es una tienda muy surtida ya que tiene lo necesario pero ella necesita ampliar su negocio y con el dinero del credito la Sra. Silvia comprara mas mercaderia para asi tener mejores ingresos y  llegar al objetivo que se propuso. La señora silvia trabaja dia a dia con mucho esfuerso ya que su deseo es tener su casa propia y el poder terminar sus estudios de primaria ya que la Sra. Sivia recien aprendio a leer y escribir fue duro para ella pero tiene muchos deseos de superacion y ganas de seguir adelante asi mejorar su calidad de vida, es una persona responsable y trabajadora desde muy pequeña la Sra Silvia trabajo Ya que quedo huerfana de Padre y tubo que salir a buscar trabajo para ayudar a los gastos de su familia.

La Sra. Silvia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia is single, and she has been selling groceries for 5 years; she lives alone in the neighborhood of Cupesi, which is also where her store is located. In her store, she offers all basic necessity products; her store is well stocked but she needs to expand her business. With the money from the loan, she will buy more merchandise in order to have a better income and fulfill her planned objective. Mrs. Silvia works hard every day since her wish is to have her own house and finish her primary school studies; she recently learned to read and write. It was difficult for her, but she really wants to get ahead in life and continue forward in order to improve her quality of life. She worked from a very young age, since her father died and she had to find work to help pay for household expenditures. Mrs. Silvia is very grateful with Emprender and Kiva for their trust in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora H. de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (una zona muy apartada de la ciudad), su casa es de cemento y no cuenta con servicios básicos. Esta separada de su esposo pero tiene 1 hijo de 16 años. 

Dora a los 34 años tenia una panadería pero por el sector por donde vive no había mucha acogida para ese negocio decidió invertir lo que le quedaba de sus ahorros en víveres para una tienda. 

En la actualidad trabaja todos los días en su tienda vendiendo el arroz en quintal a $ 32.00, el quintal de azúcar a $ 40.00. Una de las dificultades es la falta de energía que tiene en su casa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, harina, azúcar para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y que su tienda sea una de las mejores en su sector.
texts.en:
Dora H., age 49, lives in the outskirts of the city in Paraíso de Guayaquil (an area very isolated from the city). Her house if made of concrete, and it does not have basic services. She is separated from her husband, but she has a 16 year old son. When Dora was 34 she had a bakery, but it was not well received in the area where she lives. She decided to invest what was left of her savings in supplies for a store. She currently works everyday in her store. She sells rice for $32.00 per “quintal” (100 pounds) and sugar for $40.00 per quintal. One of the difficulties is there is no electricity in her house. She will use the loan to buy rice, flour, and sugar for her store. In the future she wants to finish building her house. She also wants her store to be one of the best in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Balu

texts.en: This is Balu S., she is 36 years old, and married with two children. One of her children is in college and the other is in primary school. Her husband is a pastor who supports the family financially. Balu has a provision store where she sells drinks, biscuits, palm oil, groundnut oil, sweets, milk and many other good things for human consumption. She has taken two previous loans from LAPO,SL which she used for the expansion of her store and now seeks a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to enable her to fill her store.

loans.use: To buy provisions for sale.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina de 51 años de edad es soltera, vive en el muncipio de Juigalpa, en su casa habita su unica hija  junto a su esposo y su nietecita, la hija trabaja en la UNAN y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Ernestina trabaja para el MINED en la Escuela Normal desde hace 24 años como conserje.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, reparando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado antes que comiencen las lluvias y parte de la madera de su casa que esta deteriorada.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para que su nietecita crezca en un ambiente agradable
texts.en:
Ernestina is 51 years old and single. She lives in the Juigalpa municipality. She lives with her only daughter, her husband, and her little granddaughter in her house. Her daughter works at UNAN (National Autonomous University of Nicaragua) and helps with the household expenses. Ernestina has worked for MINED (Ministry of Education) in the Normal School for 24 years as a janitor. She is requesting her third loan to improve her house. She will repair the roof, which is in a bad state, before the rains start. Part of the wood of her house has deteriorated. Her biggest dream is to be able to have better conditions in her house so that her little granddaughter can grow up in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build hygienic services

loans.name: Merida

texts.es: Mérida tiene  46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en una casa alquilada. Hace mas D. un año decidió vender ropa usada, que es adquirida en la ciudad D. Lima y en ocasiones lo consigue en su misma ciudad. Su rutina diaria es salir a vender durante las mañanas la mercadería que tiene a la clientela que transita cerca D. su puesto. Procura siempre D. ofrecer prendas en buen estado, que le permitan una venta segura. Su trabajo es muy gratificante, puesto que son muchas las personas que no tiene la oportunidad D. conseguir un prenda nueva, además su esposo la ayuda en el negocio, consiguiendo más ropa que vender. Por tal motivo desea conseguir abasteciéndose D. esta mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y por tanto promete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además confía que este aporte le será D. mucho beneficio para desarrollarse como comerciante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en prendas D. vestir para incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Merida is 46 and lives with her husband and 2 children in a rented home. Over a year ago she decided to sell used clothing, which she acquires in Lima and, sometimes, in her own city. Her daily routine consists of leaving in the morning to sell her merchandise to customers who pass by. She always offers clothing in good condition, and this ensures a good transaction. Her work is very gratifying; many people don't have the opportunity to buy new clothing. Merida's husband helps her with the business, collecting more clothing to sell. Merida wants to continue stocking more clothing in order to increase their income. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she promises to repay it on time. She is confident that this will be very beneficial to her development as a merchant. With the requested loan, she will buy more used clothing merchandise in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: This group of 8 people from Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province have selected Mrs. Ret M. as their village bank president. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan to support for different types of businesses.  Mrs. Ret M. herself is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows green onions for a living. Mrs. Ret M. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and green onion roots to support her farming crop. Mrs. Ret M. is widow with two children who both work as seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and green onion roots.

loans.name: Kossi Sényo

texts.fr:
Cet homme de 49 ans est très dynamique. Il est agent de sécurité au sein d’une société de gardiennage de la place. Pour optimiser ses revenus, il est conducteur de taxi moto.
Afin de se procurer une nouvelle moto pour sa propre exploitation, il sollicite ce crédit de WAGES.
Il est marié et père de 4 enfants et espère qu’avec cette nouvelle moto, il pourra leur offrir une meilleure éducation.
texts.en:
This 49 year old man is very dynamic. He is security agent with a company guarding the square. To optimize his income, he also drives a taxi motor bike. In order to get a new motor bike for his own exploitation, he requests this loan from WAGES. He is married and father of 4 children and hopes that with this new motor bike, he will be able to offer a better education to them.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el Benque Jamastran El Paraiso.
Juana se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia EMMI. la sra. Juana tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Doña Juana esta casada con el señor Oscar Martínez quien se dedica al comercio, sale a vender mercaderia en su carro, 
Juana y Oscar tienen 4 hijos de los cuales solamente depende uno de ellos.
Las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y pagar los estudios de su hijo.
Doña Juana no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio.

su meta es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, que su hijo se gradue de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs Juana V. is 45 years old and lives at Benque Jamastran El Paraiso. Juana makes a living selling general purpose products and owns a small general store called Pulperia EMMI. Juana has several years in this business. Mrs. Juana is married to Mr. Oscar Martínez who is a merchant, he sell products from his car. Juana and Oscar have 4 children, all of whom depend on them. The income from their businesses is used to cover their household expenses and the education of their children. Doña Juana does not have the capital to supply her business. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to provide a better quality of life for her family and for her son to complete his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, tortillas, bread, crackers, coffee, soaps, toilet paper, intant soups.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng Chhut is 34 years old and married to Mr. Thy who is 43. The couple lives with five children who are students. They work selling fresh fish that they catch from Tunle Sap Lake. They get up in the dark to go fishing and hurry to bring their fish to sell in the local market for daily profit. The family living conditions are not good because their house is cracked and leaks in a heavy rainfall. To help solve the problem, Chheng Chhut is applying for a loan in order to mend her old house.

loans.use: To mend her old house.

loans.name: Marjorine

texts.en:
Marjorine N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Marjorine has a business selling shoes, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Marjorine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Marjorine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for the family.  In the future, Marjorine hopes to own a big hotel.     

Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Gulbaira's Group

texts.en:
Gulbaira A. is the leader of this group. She is forty-three and married. She has four children: her sons are nineteen and fifteen, her daughters are eighteen and twelve. All her children go to school. Her husband is a construction worker. In addition to doing construction work, her husband also breeds cattle. Gulbaira is a worker at the local hospital. 

Twenty years ago, she spent 7,000 soms on the purchase of cattle for breeding. Since that time, she has significantly increased the size of her herd and makes 8,000 soms each month on cattle breeding. With the profits from cattle breeding, she will be able to pay tuition fees for their children at institutions of higher education. She is planning to save some money to pay for the higher education of her youngest children. To do this, she plans to help her husband increase number of cattle in order to increase her profits from cattle breeding. Therefore, she applies for a loan. She is planning to purchase additional cattle on the loan received. 

Group members:

- Nurzhamilia Z. is treasurer of the group. She is forty-eight and a widow. She has two daughters and a son. Her daughters are eleven and five years old. Her elder daughter goes to school and her younger daughter goes to kindergarten “Kelechek”. She sells convenience goods at her small shop. Three years ago, her friend suggested she start selling convenience goods because she already had a free place for a shop. So she started selling convenience goods with an initial investment of 60,000 soms. Now, she makes 20 000 soms by selling convenience goods. On the profits from her business, she was able to send her son to an Islamic institution in Pakistan. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase goods and increase her turnover. On the profits from her business, she is planning to expand her business and marry her elder son. 

- Sharshenaly A. is forty one and married. He has three sons. They are fifteen, thirteen and nine years old. All of them go to school. He is hairdresser. He has his own hairdressing salon. In 2000, he finished hairdresser courses and negotiated the rent of a room where he started providing hairdresser services. He has worked for ten years in his own hairdressing salon, which he opened with initial investment of 15,000 soms. Now he makes 8,000 soms monthly.  With the help of the profits from the business, he was able to buy cattle for 10,000 soms. He could increase the size of his cattle herd and he wants to go further. He wants to buy additional cattle for breeding. Therefore he is applying for a loan. With the profits from cattle breeding, he plans to buy a big house for his family, as well as a car. 

- Chynara A. is thirty-three and married. She has four children: her daughters are nine, six and one, and her son is eleven years old. Her elder son and daughter go to school and her youngest two daughters are at home. Her husband is a construction worker in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). When her husband decided to move to Bishkek in search of employment opportunities, she (upon the suggestion of a friend) decided to start selling convenience goods. She started two years ago with an initial investment of 35,000 soms. Now she makes 15,000 soms monthly. With the profits from her business, she bought furniture and household appliances for her house. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase additional goods and increase her turnover. Through the increase of her turnover, she will be able to increase her profits. In the near future, she is planning to finish construction of their new house and purchase additional new furniture for her new house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchasing cattle

loans.name: Dulia

texts.en: Dulia A. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Dulia is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Dulia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dulia has been engaged in farming for over 30 years. Dulia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dulia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dulia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Dulia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Courageous Men And Women Group

texts.en:
Rachel S. who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Courageous Men And Women. She is 35 years old married and has three children and the youngest is 1 year old. She is a college student. She describes herself as a kind and polite woman.

For 4 years she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, salt, tomatoes, onions etc. in Redlight Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 26,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, oil, pepper, salt, tomatoes, onions etc. Her goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, pepper, salt, tomatoes, onions etc

loans.name: Blanca Janeth

texts.es:
Blanca Janeth E. L. tiene 30 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 16, 11, y 2 anos. 
  
Blanca es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas en Babahoyo. Vende cada 6 meses después de la cosecha. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maiz y cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito, podría mejorar más sus cultivos. Su sueno es que sus hijos estudien o hacen algo en la vida. Dice que este ano ha sido más o menos con sus cultivos, y espera que la próxima cosecha sea mejor. 

Le gusta leer en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Blanca Janeth E. L., 30, lives in the Ecuadorean town of Chillanes.  She is married and has 3 children who are 13-, 11- and 2-years old.

Blanca is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos ("The Comfort of Having Friends") community bank, located about 20 minutes from San Jose del Tambo.  The group has 15 members, most of whom make a living growing cocoa or operating small businesses.

Blanca is a farmer.  She grows maize and cocoa.  She buys and sells in Babahoyo.  She sells every 6 months, after a harvest.  She will use this loan to buy seeds for growing maize and cocoa.  The loan will make it possible for her to improve her yields.  Her greatest hope is that her children can study and make something of their lives.  She says that her crop yields this year have been so-so and she hopes the next crop will be better.

Blanca likes to read in her spare time.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Mirna Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Mirna Cecilia G. V. es trabajadora Activa para el Colegio Público San Cayetano  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Secundaria tiene Veinte y cuatro  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mirna Cecilia G. V. is an active worker for the San Cayetano public school as a secondary school teacher.  She has worked for the school for 24 years.  She is currently married with one school-age son.  She has had six loans with CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy construction materials to expand and improver her home.  These CEPRODEL loans have benefited her greatly and in this way she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Selva

texts.es:
La señora Selva de 55 años de edad es comerciante, casada con el señor Silvio de 58 años de edad  docente jubilado, tienen un hijo varón estudiante de  Radiología. La  señora Selva  cuenta con local  comercial donde venden todo tipo de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, como remeras, pantalones, blusas para damas, lencerías y otros. Empezó gracias a la inversión realizada de parte del señor Silvio quien cuenta con buen salario.  Con mucho esfuerzo salieron adelante, ahora cuentan con un negocio prospero.
Solicita  a Fundación Paraguaya ayuda crediticia para la compra de más prendas de temporada como ser remeras, short, pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos, etc.
La Sra. Selva agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo brindado porque gracias a eso ella podrá seguir dando a sus clientes prendas de buena calidad y al mejor precio, y de esa forma mejorar cada día su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Selva, 55, is a merchant.  She’s married to Silvio, 58, who is a retired teacher.  They have a son studying Radiology.

Selva has a locale where she sells all kinds of clothes for women, men and children like: t-shirts, pants, women’s blouses, lingerie and others.  She started thanks to an investment by her husband who earns a good salary.  With much effort they got ahead and now have a prosperous business.

She is asking Fundación Paraguaya for a loan to buy more seasonal clothing like: t-shirts, shorts, pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

Selva thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help provided because thanks to it she’s been able to continue to provide good quality items at the best price to her customers thus daily improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shorts, infant wear, etc.

loans.name: Zolila Rosa

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Zoila es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, nos cuenta que le agrada mucho ya que le ha servido  para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 61 años de edad, tiene 8 hijos de una relación de unión libre que tuvo pero en la actualidad está separada ya 13 años, sus hijos ya todos son mayores de edad aunque dos de ellos viven aun en su casa.
 
Se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo, además de estos productos también vende dulces que los compra o se los mandan  de Santo Domingo y que a sus clientes les encantan. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 19h00, dice que su negocio lo tiene ya por varios años y que gracias a Dios  le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, aceite, detergentes y dulces. Sus sueños son tener una tienda mucho más grande y surtida, y tener salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Hard-Working Women) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious desserts and sweets which its residents make and they are known all over the country.

Zoila is a founding member of her community bank.  She tells us that she likes it a lot as it has helped her to get ahead in her business.  Zoila is 61 years old.  She has 8 children from her common-law marriage but she has been separated from her partner for 13 years.  Her children are all grown up although two of them still live at home.

Zoila is a saleswoman.  She has a grocery store where she sells not only groceries but also sweets which she buys or has sent from Santo Domingo.  Her customers love them.  She works every day from 6.30am to 7.00pm.  She says that she has had her business for several years and, thanks to God, it has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, tuna, oil, detergents and sweets.  Her dreams are to have a much bigger and better-stocked store and for herself and her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, oil, detergents and sweets

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 28 años, vive en la casa de su abuela en compañía de ella y de sus 3 hijos menores. Esta trabajadora mujer se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante. Desde hace 4 años, se desempeña como cobradora de un vehiculo de transporte público, muchas veces trabaja para su tío y otras para desconocidos, pero siempre realiza su labor con mucho empeño. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues obtiene buenas ganancias, aunque debe estar por largas horas en el trabajo cobrando por turnos enteros, desde las 3 de la tarde hasta la medianoche, pero deja encargados a sus niños con su abuela, quien los atiende como si fueran sus hijos. Aunque a veces se siente fatigada sigue adelante trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues como es separada, su ex esposo solo le alcanza algo de dinero, que muchas veces no le alcanza, de esta manera trabaja con mayor motivación. Y como es muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa y calzado, pues en otras épocas ella tenía su negocio de este rubro, pero lo debió cerrar por motivos de falta de capital. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luzmila tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de panetones, y juegos pirotécnicos, pues tiene varios pedidos, y de esta manera espera obtener considerables ganancias por campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Luzmila, twenty-eight, lives in her grandmother's house with her three young children and her grandmother.  Every day, this hardworking woman makes the effort to get ahead.  For the past four years she has been a conductor on a public transport vehicle.  Much of the time she works for her uncle, and other times she works for strangers, but she always puts a great deal of effort into her work.  She really likes her job because she makes a good income, although she does have to work long hours on full shifts, from 3PM until midnight, leaving the children in the care of her grandmother, who looks after them as though they were her own.

While Luzmila feels tired sometimes, she keeps on working so her children can get ahead. She's separated, and her ex-husband gives her only so much money, and sometimes none at all, so she's highly motivated to work.  Also, being an enterprising woman, she has future plans to open up a shoe and clothing store.  She had one in the past, but she had to close it due to lack of capital.

This will be Luzmila's first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time because she doesn't want lose face with the people who made possible the investment that has allowed her to continue working in search of progress.  She plans to invest her loan in panettones and fireworks, for which she has a number of orders, so she can earn a good sum for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy panettones and fireworks, for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Primo Isaac

texts.es:
El Sr Primo V. H. se encuentra casado, tiene 3 hijos, viven por la zona de la Maica Norte parada 7, zona rural de la provincia de Cochabamba.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito con ayuda de Kiva, le fue muy bien la primera vez el se encuentra muy agradecido por la ayuda recibida.
El Sr. Primo sigue trabajando en la producción de leche cruda, cuenta con 20 cabezas de ganado lechero. Toda la leche que logra producir se la entrega a la Planta Industrializadora de Leche PIL.  Es así que logra percibir un ingreso fijo por la venta de su producto.  Sus plantaciones propias de Alfalfa, le ayuda en los gastos de abastecimiento de forraje, además el excedente de alfalfa lo comercializa a sus vecinos.
 La Sra. Rosa, quien es su esposa, se encuentra enferma de los riñones, pero su enfermedad no le ha impedido acompañar a su esposo en las actividades diarias.
El sr. Primo esta muy agradecido por la ayuda recibida en la anterior oportunidad y demostrando siempre su responsabilidad en sus cancelaciones ha solicitado un nuevo crédito para la compra de forraje, con esta compra podrá abastecerse antes de las épocas de lluvia.
texts.en:
Mr. Primo V. H. is married and has three children.  They all live around the Maica Norte area, Stop 7, a rural zone of Cochabamba province.

This is the second time he’s requested a loan with help from Kiva.  He fared vary well the first time and he is grateful for the help received.

Primo continues producing raw milk; he has 20 head of dairy cattle.  All the milk he manages to produce is delivered to the PIL industrial milk processing plant.  This is how he manages to receive regular income for the sale of his product.  Having his own alfalfa fields helps his with forage costs and besides he sells any extra alfalfa to his neighbors.

Rosa, his wife, currently has kidney disease but her illness has not stopped her from accompanying her husband in his daily chores.

Primo is very grateful for the help received in the previous occasion and he always demonstrates his responsibility by repaying on time.  He has asked for a new loan to buy forage.  This purchase will make it possible for him to stock up prior to the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy cattle forage.

loans.name: Estrellas 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. la señora Maria del Rosario, una integrante del grupo D. Estrellas 1,que está ubicado en el estado D. Veracruz México.Se ven las 10 integrantes del grupo en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta D. lenceria, zapatos, y cosméticos por catálogo, inició hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra D. más producto para sus ventas. Sus ganancias van aumentando por la variedad que tiene en su pequeño negocio. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha y contenta por el prestamo. Tiene 45 años estudió hasta el bachillerato, es madre tiene 3 hijos; 2 mujeres y 1 varón. Quiere este crédito para la compra D. más producto para sus ventas. También espera obtener más ganancias y darles una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.Leticia P., es la presidenta del grupo tiene  42 años , estudio hasta secundaria, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa, que inicio hace 8 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra D. más ropa. el grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Mrs Maria del Rosario, a member of the Estrellas 1 ["Stars 1"] group. This group is located in the state of Veracruz, Mexico. The 10 group members are seen in the photo. Maria works selling lingerie, shoes and cosmetics through a catalogue. She started this five years ago. 
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more products for her sales. Her earnings are increasing because of the variety of stock in her small business. At the moment of requesting this loan, she feels satisfied and happy with it. 
She is 45 and studied up to a bachelor's degree. She is a mother of three children; 2 girls and one boy. She wants this loan for the purchase of more products for her sales. She also hopes to make more income and offer her family a better quality of life. 
Leticia P is the group president. She is 42 and studied until high school. She sells clothing, and started doing this 8 years ago. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more clothing. This group is maD. up of 11 members.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
42-year-old Daisy E. is from the town of San Francisco. She is married and has 4 children aged 21, 19, 17 and 15. To make a living, Daisy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like any other mother, Daisy only wants the best for her children. She does her best to keep her family happy and healthy.

Daisy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizers, medicines and seeds. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Daisy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicines and seeds

loans.name: Guidelyn

texts.en:
Guidelyn is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: buying  and selling livestock and a retail gasoline business. Her husband Randy, who is 30 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 5 and 7 years old. 

Guidelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Guidelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to pay for more funds for her business operations so that she could continue to save up for the future of her family and children's needs.This photo was taken after a center meeting.  Guidelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To funds her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to make more soap.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam H., age 43, earns a living by selling fish. She sells fish that she buys from other fishermen at a reasonable price. She currently earns an average of US$2.80 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. Her husband is 59 years old and he is highly skilled at building wooden houses. Nam H. is the mother of eight children, four of whom are single. The other four are married and live in their own houses. Three of her children are working at various occupations, and they contribute some of their income to help the family meet its daily expenses. Nam H. would like to ask for a loan to buy the carpenter’s plane machine for her husband to provide his business activity.

loans.use: To buy a planning machine for her husband to provide his business activity.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Las Pergoleras de Linares”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de empanadas, desde hace 8 años, su horario laboral es de lunes a viernes. Sus clientes son los comercios establecidos y particulares, que solicitan sus empanadas a pedido, sin embargo también vende en su domicilio. Los fines de semana, ella conduce un taxi colectivo como medio de transporte, desde hace 6 años y su horario laboral es por las noches. 
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas, todo lo que son ingredientes. 
Con éste préstamo comprará ingredientes para su producción de empanadas.
Su sueño es establecerse en un local con una amasandería. 
María vive junto a su hija de 21 años de edad y su nieto de 4 años. Su hija estudia Técnico en enfermería y su nieto cursa el pre kinder. Sus motivaciones son poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar económico.
María está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con su banco, ella se siente muy cómoda, ya que estas son muy amenas. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank "Las Pergoleras de Linares" in the city of Linares.  She has been making and selling empanadas for 8 years  and works Monday through Friday.  Her customers are the individual established businesses that order her empanadas, however, she also sells them from her house.  On weekend nights she drives a shared taxi and has been doing this for 6 years.  She buys her ingredients at the wholesale supermarket and will use the loan to buy ingredients to make empanadas. 

Her dream is to have a local with a bakery.  María lives with her daughter who is 21 years old and her grandson who is 4.  Her daughter is studying to be a nurse technician and her grandson goes to preschool.  She wants to be able to better provide for her family financially.  María is very happy and grateful for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza as she will be able to invest in her business.  María is very comfortable at her communal bank meetings since they are very entertaining.  

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the center of the country. In this area they have  developed their agricultural and wine production significantly, most notably their exports.  Their major crops are grains (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard and legumes) and fruits.  Linares is the leading province for rice production in Chile; in fact, 78% of the national rice production is in this province, especially in the town of Parral.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make empanadas.

loans.name: Eliberto

texts.es:
Eliberto tiene 33 años de edad y es separado. Vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos a cargo. Viven en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de La Victoria en el norte de Perú, el cual no cuenta con agua potable, solo energía eléctrica. La zona donde vive es pequeña y la actividad principal es la agricultura.

Eliberto se dedica a la fundición y producción de ollas. Cuenta con 06 años de experiencia en el rubro. Este negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Actualmente, su casa no está construida de buena material. Eliberto piensa construir su vivienda de material noble para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Eliberto cuenta con buenas referencias comerciales y crediticias. Es muy trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. Trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Eliberto is 33 years old and separated. He lives in his own house with his three children who are in his care. They live in the outlying urban zone of La Victoria district in northern Peru, where there is electricity but no potable water. The area where they live is small and mainly agricultural. Eliberto earns a living smelting and making pots and pans. He has 6 years' experience in this field, which generates very good income for him. He does his work in the area behind his home. 

Right now, his house is not built of good materials. Eliberto is thinking about building his home out of solid building materials so he can give his children a better quality of life. Therefore he thought it best to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Eliberto has good business and credit references. He is very industrious and devoted to his family, and he works hard to build a better life for them.

loans.use: to build his house from better materials

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 35 years old. She has 4 children. She is a hard working mother. Her husband is a driver. Jeannette is grateful that she makes good use of her profits. She owns and runs a small restaurant in which she sells cooked African dishes. Jeannette has been in this business for 1 year and 7 months and it has enabled her to meet her family's needs.

Jeannette is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for her restaurant. In the future, she plans to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy restaurant equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 24 years old and has a common-law husband. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Lourdes has a fish stall business in the Philippines. Ma. Lourdes has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Ma. Lourdes has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Ma. Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Delgerdalai

texts.en: Delgerdalai is 29 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is pregnant and his son, age 5, is in kindergarten. He manages a raw material trading business between the center of the province and the Chinese border. He sells a variety of metals such as copper, iron, zinc etc. He started his business in 2003 and has been able to stabilize it. He also operates a transportation business in his town. He needs to work hard in order to sustain his business, because it is the only source of income for his family. With his earnings he managed to buy a van to use in his business operation. He is a polite man who attributes his business success to his good accounting skills. He is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Narcisa Paulina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rosa De Guadalupe.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Narcisa, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y de 1 año, el mayor  estudian en escuela. El marido es controlador de autobús.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que siempre le gusta pensar en  su futuro y más en el futuro de sus hijos. Ella y su esposo quieren aprovechar que su papá tiene una finca la cual está desocupada,  ellos quieren ocupar este terreno que tiene mucho pasto para comenzar con la cría de vacas, con este crédito  piensan comprar una vaca parida para aprovechar la leche la cual les serviría para la venta y para su consumo y así ahorrar el gasto diario que ocasiona la compra de este alimento.

Lleva dos ciclos en el banco y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven para poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
 
Su sueño es ser una gran ganadera y tener algo para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en: The members of the communal lender Rosa De Guadalupe meet regularly in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province.  Narcisa is among them.  She is 27 and lives with her husband, who is a bus driver; they have two children, ages 8 and 1.  The oldest attends school.  In order to provide for her family's future, she plans to begin raising cows on vacant pasture land that her father owns but does not cultivate.  They are seeking this loan to buy a cow for milk production, so that they can sell milk as well as use this for household consumption.  Narcisa has received two former credits from the communal lender which have allowed her to complete several projects.  Her dream is to have a successful cattle farm and provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: 7 Chợ Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Lanh is 49 years old and married with two children. She lives without dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Lanh is the leader of a four-member group, the 5.1.7 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. For the past five years, Lanh has operated a retail business where she sells processed seafood. Her lack of business capital always causes her anxiety.

Lanh is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell and to invest in her business. This will be her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her profit, Lanh hopes to remodel her house and expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase processed seafood to sell

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy is a 40-year-old single mother of two children living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build a permanent house and diversify her business. Cissy deals in a cattle trade business. She got her initial capital of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from farming two years ago. Her major challenge is lack of enough capital to buy cattle, and her dream is to own a ranch. Cissy needs this loan to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Bockarie B.'s Group

texts.en:
These borrowers are secondary school teachers in Kenema city. The school was founded in September 2002 to improve education in the community. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the first loan that teachers of this school have recevied from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot let them do.

Bockarie is the leader of the group. Bockarie is thirty-three. He was born in a place call Koya. Bockarie is married and has two children – one in primary school and the other is not of school age. He has been in the teaching profession for nine years now. He has requested this loan to pay his mother’s medical bills and to buy some household items.

loans.use: to pay his mother’s medical bills and buy some household items

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Ей 53 года. Она разведена. У нее четверо детей. Ее сын занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Мукарам зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 3 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mukaram lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is 53 years old. She is divorced and has four children. Her son works as a day laborer in construction. Mukaram makes a living by breeding cattle. She breeds cattle for sale. She has been doing this for three years.  SHe is taking out a loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sayeramo

texts.ru: Сайёрамо проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 32 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более четырех лет она занимается торговлей у себя дома. В основном Сайёрамо продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды и обуви.
texts.en: Sayeramo lives in the town of Kulob. She is 32 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She has secondary education. She does business by selling from home for more than four years. Sayeramo mainly sells children's clothing. She is taking out the loan to buy children's clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 60 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales  y cerdo, hace más de quince años que tiene esta actividad, este negocio lo aprendió de una tía que se dedicaba a esta misma actividad, fue así que le enseño a concepción a ganarse ingresos para su hogar. El crédito es para la compra de cerdo, hojas, mecates, bolsas, papas, chile, arroz. Sueña con aumentar sus ventas cada día para generar más ingresos a sui hogar.
texts.en: Concepcion is 60 years old and her business is the sale of nacatamales (steamed corn dough wrapped in plantain leaves) and pork. She has been in business for more than fifteen years and she learned the business from an aunt of hers who had a similar business. This is how Concepcion learned to earn an income for her household. The loan will be used to purchase pork, plantain leaves, twine, plastic bags, potatoes, chili peppers, and rice. She dreams of increasing her sales to generate more income for her home.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat, plantain leaves, twine, plastic bags, potatoes, chili peppers, and rice.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a hard-working business woman aged 48. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been managing a greengrocery to bring up her family. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused on her business. She has also gained a lot of knowledge on business management through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy onions and oranges to sell.

loans.use: To buy onions and oranges to sell

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones is a 42-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail shop business for eight years. He acquired the initial capital from the savings of his salary as a teacher. His hardship is high commodity prices leading to low profits and his vision is to own a wholesale business, to have financial independence,  and to educate his children. Jones needs the loan facility to buy sugar and bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy sugar and bread for sale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena makes a living selling clothing, hair and body creams, different types of pampers and others items. She does her selling by moving from place to place, while also taking time out every day to manage her home. She completed high school and now is married and has two children.  She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to increase her profits so that she can pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 49-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. Her husband earns an income working as a security guard. Nga runs a general  store, which she has done for over ten years. 

Nga would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings for repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy basic goods, such as foods and beverages, in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 46 años de edad, reside junto con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la gran actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace muchos años Daniel se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sombreros, el material  que utiliza es la palma, una actividad que sus padres le enseñaron y a ido pasando de generación en generación,  cuenta con su propia clientela, también realiza sombreros a pedidos, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar su necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar materiales para seguir elaborando sus sombreros y cumplir con los pedidos que le han solicitado, por el buen trabajo que realiza sus ventas se han incrementado, lo que le permitirá que sus ganancias aumenten para  pagar su crédito otorgado y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel, 46, lives along with his wife and children in his own house, with water and electricity, in the urban area of the Bambamarca district in the department of Cajamarca.

Daniel has been making and selling hats for many years.  The material he uses is palm leaf, work that his parents taught him and that has been passed down from generation to generation.  He has his own customers and also makes hats on request.  With the earnings he makes, he will be able to pay for his daily household necessities.

He has requested a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy materials to continue making his hats and fill the orders that have been requested.  His sales have increased because of the good work he does.  This will allow him to make more income to pay back his loan and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to continue making his hats

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 32-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the motorcycle business for the last three years and faces the hardship of seasonal weather and high fuel prices. He has to take 70% of his earnings to his boss at the end of the week which limits his income. His personal dream is to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business dream is to buy land and grow crops to sell. Michael needs this loan to buy his own motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Poninate

texts.en:
Poninate is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Poninate has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which prepares hot Ugandan meals for local customers.

To help expand her business, Poninate has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more ingredients and a sauce pan, and will help Poninate to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Poninate hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Poninate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Poninate's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and a sauce pan.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд молодой перспективный парень. Он женат и у них на воспитании один ребенок. Жена работает швеёй. Он сам на протяжении пяти лет занимается купле продажей мужской одежды и обуви. С наступлением зимы все переходят на зимнюю одежду, поэтому он хочет получить займ в размере 1900$ США для пополнения ассортимента зимними товарами. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и ждет одобрения займа. Ведь скоро Новый год и все хотят купить что-то новое. Спасибо тем, кто поддержит его и даст возможность расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Mahmud is a young and promising man.  He is married and is raising one child.  Mahmud's wife works as a seamstress.  He has been involved in buying and selling men's clothing and shoes for five years. With the onset of winter, everyone transitions to winter clothing, and this is why he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1906 to purchase winter merchandise.  Mahmud hopes to get your support and awaits loan approval.  New Year's is coming up soon, and everyone wants to buy something new.  Thank you to those, who support him and provide him with an opportunity to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Aysara

texts.ru: Айсара проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Айсара занимается торговлей детской одежды и женской обуви. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Aysara lives in the Pyandj region. She is 52 years old, married, and has two children. Aysara sells children's clothing and women's footwear. She has been engaged in this activity for 12 years. She is taking the loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: To buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old and married to Joseph.

She has run a general store for the last 4 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000.  She is applying for her first loan of Kes 10,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan  to purchase more household items for sale and open up another shop to sell the same.

loans.use: to purchase more household items for sale.

loans.name: David Alonso

texts.es: El señor David Alonso a los 43 años de edad se dedica a la fabricación y reparación de muebles en madera, con lo que consigue el sustento propio y el de su hija de 16 años quien esta a su cargo puesto que se encuentra separado de la madre. Debido a la inestabilidad del sector y los altibajos de sus ingresos, el señor David Alonso se vió en la necesidad de capacitarse en mantenimiento y reparación de lavadoras como actividad alterna que le permite generar otros ingresos. Para cumplir con la producción de un lote de botiquines, requiere de la compra de la materia prima e implementos de trabajo, que le permitan cumplir el sueño de que su negocio crezca y se consolide en el sector.
texts.en:
David Alonso, 43 years old, makes and repairs wooden furniture. In this manner, he supports himself and his 16-year-old daughter, who is in his charge because she is separated from her mother. Due to the instability of the sector and his income fluctuations, David Alonso has been forced to obtain training in the maintenance and repair of washing machines as an alternative activity, permitting him to generate additional income.

To fill an order for medicine cabinets, he needs to buy primary materials and work tools, which will permit him to realize his dream of seeing his business grow and consolidating his position in the sector.

loans.use: to buy primary materials and work tools for his various trades.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi is married and has 5 children. For six years she has been a petty trader, selling groceries, tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs, and other food items in Mbem near Abura. Her husband is a farmer. Asi uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. Asi will use the loan to purchase variety of groceries and other food items to satisfy her customers. With the new profits, Asi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and other food items to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Kuinyunyi B Group

texts.en:
Kuinyunyi B is a Nuru International group of two farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire knowledge and skills in improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Kuinyunyi B collectively guarantee the loan.

Samson (pictured with the hand raised) is a representative of the group. He is 29 years old and is married with four children, three of whom go to school. He has been a member of this group since 2012. The Kiva loan in this coming season will enable him obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer which he believes will increase his farm yields. Samson, just like other members of his group, will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre, and sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. He will obtain food for his household as well as sell the surplus and contribute to the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lillian wants to buy 5 bags of charcoal and 3 bags of potatoes

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: In May of 2002 Matluba Aziziova and her sister started their small business of sewing female dresses and selling them. They had a small assortment and turnover of the business was slow. Her sister was mainly engaged in sewing and she was selling those dresses at “Chorshanbe” market. Together they earned about 175 dollars per month. Matluba wished to expand the  assortment and instead of buying fabric from other traders bring the fabric  herself from Uzbekistan and Kyrgystan. She wants to bring fabric both for sale and for her sister to produce dresses and that way to decrease the cost of each dress. Together with her colleagues she will travel to wholesale markets by bus. It usually takes between 1 to 5 days for one trip depending on the location.

loans.use: Retail trade of female dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchasing wood and manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Sowlamélé

texts.fr:
Sowlamélé S. was born in 1960 and is the mother of nine. Despite her age, she still works making coconut oil, a trade she learned from her mother at a young age. With her thirty years of experience, she has earned a reputation for the special way she makes oil and customers seek out her oil especially. Faced with such demand, she needs money to purchase more coconuts and so she is asking for a loan of $800. In boosting production, she will keep her customers satisfied and provide for the needs of her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madame S. Sowlamélé est née en 1960. Aujourd'hui, elle est mère de neuf (9) enfants. Bien que âgée, la production de l'huile de coco reste son activité. Ce métier, elle l'a hérité de sa mère depuis son jeune âge. Plus de 30 ans déjà, elle possède une expérience qui lui permet de préparer autrement son huile et attirer plus de clientèle. Très compétitive sur le marché, l'huile de coco de Madame S. est très sollicitée par les consommateurs. Vu le niveau toujours croissante de la demande, elle nécessite des fonds pour acheter assez de coco.
