Marcelina plans to invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested in buying manure to preserve the quality of her products.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve her crops

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes G. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 51 years old. Lourdes is married. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lourdes wants to be able to help her family financially, so she does her best to do so.

Lourdes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 52-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a ready-to-wear clothing business. She lives in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Rosita is  borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Simona De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Simona es mujer trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, casada, con el apoyo de su esposo.
Su trabajo que realiza desde hace más de veinte años es el lavado y planchado domiciliar, comenzando con necesidad de poder obtener ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
Por medio de financiamiento ha logrado hacer mejora  a su vivienda, lo que para su familia ha sido de mucha satisfacción. Con el crédito anterior comenzó un muro en la parte de enfrente, ahora quiere levantar pared en la parte de alado de su terreno y así pode cerrar toda su propiedad, para mejor cuido de sus hijos. Y que solo por medio de Afodenic lo esta obteniendo.
texts.en:
Simona is a hardworking woman, the mother of two children, and she is married. She has her husband's support. The business she has had over the past twenty years has been private laundry services. She started out when she saw a need to obtain an income to support her family. 

Through the use of loans she has been able to improve her house, a project that has been very satisfactory for her family. With the previous loan she started a front wall and now she wants to build the side wall to her land. She will be closing off the entire property and it will be a benefit to her children's care. And it is only through Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) that this has been possible.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta W., 33 years old, is from Murumba. She is married to Erick and they have three children aged 9, 7 and 5 years old.

Redempta has been selling fish for the past year. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a client. Redempta will use the loan to buy more fish to add to her stock. Her monthly income is KES 1,700 and she hopes that this will rise. The profits from the loan proceeds will be used to pay school fees for Redempta's children. She hopes to be able to open up another fish stall soon.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy, de 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sergio de 46 años y su querido hijo Geremi de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La panadería “La Estancia” de la ciudad de Tarma, es el lugar donde Edy trabaja todos los días, con mucha habilidad decora los pasteles que serán puestos a la venta, ya que tiene mucha creatividad y buen pulso para adornar las tortas. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también tiene una piñateria, la cual a dejado un poco de lado, por falta de materiales para la elaboración de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar los pasteles, ya que se divierte mucho haciéndolo, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cumplir con todos los pedidos que hacen a la panadería. Con el tiempo, espera poder mejorar su piñateria, para así sacar adelante su negocio propio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales, para implementar mejor su piñateria.
texts.en:
Edy is 32 years old.  She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 46 year-old Sergio, and her beloved son, 11 year-old Gerimi, who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

'La Estancia' bakery in the city of Tarma is where Edy works every day.  With a lot of skill she decorates the cakes that will be put on sale since she has a lot of creativity and a good hand for decorating cakes.  In addition to this business, she also has a piñateria (piñata business) which she has left a little to one side because of a lack of materials to make her products.

What Edy most likes about her work is decorating the cakes since she really has fun doing it.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to fill all the orders that they make at the bakery.  Over time, she hopes to be able to improve her piñateria so that she can make progress in her own business.

This is Edy's second loan with MFP and she knows that she has to be punctual in making her repayments if she wants to access another loan in the future.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank which means that she is very well respected by her fellow bank members.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy materials to better stock her piñateria.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her business selling party supplies

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 53-year-old accomplished and hard-working woman from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She lives in a small house in the outlying 'ger' districts of the city with her husband. Her husband is retired. They have two daughters, aged 30 and 32. Their daughters live apart from them. 

Altantsetseg  started running a children’s clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, in 2000. At the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand.

However, in 2001, Altantsetseg had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. As a result of her hard work, today she has 1,600,000 MNT in her working capital and she sells children’s clothes. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). With this loan, she wants to purchase children’s clothes for spring to resell. She wants to expand her business with this loan and then to be able to improve her four grand-nieces' education.

loans.use: To purchase children’s clothes for spring to resell.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is from the village of Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is 25 years old, married and has two infant children. To make a living, Lorie runs a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling food in the local community.

Lorie has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. Lorie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. 

Lorie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP with which she will purchase a variety of products such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, etc. for her retail store. This will be the second loan taken out by Emily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, etc. for her retail store.

loans.name: Fedelita

texts.en: Fedelita is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Fedelita is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed for her pigs. Fedelita has been raising pigs for 14 years and earns additional income from a sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream, which is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is from the village of Malinao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 51 years old, is separated from her spouse and has one adult child. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling junk food, bananas, charcoal and coconut wine in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional junk food, charcoal and bananas. This will be the seventh loan that Rosie has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional junk food, charcoal and bananas

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su hija en casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz que se encuentra en la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la alta actividad comercial que existe de productos al por mayor y menor, y en las zonas aledañas se desarrolla la agricultura y ganadería.

Rosa labora prestando servicios de enfermería en un hospital de la zona, actividad que ejerce desde hace 5 años, pero a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para realizar unas mejoras en la infraestructura de su casa, el crédito otorgado lo cubrirá con el salario que recibe en su trabajo y también solventará sus gastos diarios.

Rosa es una persona trabajadora que con esfuerzo y empeño a sabido salir adelante y lo único que quiere es brindarle lo mejor y más comodidades a su hija.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her daughter in her parents' home which receives water and electricity services.  The house is located in José Leonardo Ortíz district, in Chiclayo province.  This area is noted for the high level of commercial activity that exists, with people selling products both wholesale and retail.  In neighboring areas, people work in farming and livestock raising.

Rosa works as a nurse in a hospital in her area.  She has been in this line of work for five years.  She has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to carry out some improvements to the infrastructure of her home.   She will repay her loan with the salary that she receives from her job which she will also use to cover her daily expenses.

Rosa is a hard-working person who, through her effort and determination, has known how to get ahead.  The only thing that she wants is to provide her daughter with the best and with more comforts in life.

loans.use: to make some improvements to the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy baking supplies like eggs, shortening, flour, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Lesbia Danubia

texts.es: Doña Lesbia Danubia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y reside en la Colonia Porvenir Norte. Desde muy pequeña ayudaba a su madre a atender una pequeña pulperia que funcionaba en su casa de habitacion. Actualmente ella tiene su propia pulperia la cual esta bien surtida de todo tipo de productos comestibles, de uso personal, y para el aseo del hogar. Su esposo le ayuda a atender el negocio y su ventaja es que no tiene competencia porque vive en una colonia pequeña a las afueras de la ciudad, asi que todos sus vecinos van a su pulperia a comprar. Con el prestamo solicitado podrá surtir su negocio y con las ganancias obtenidas tendrá un ingreso para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ser madre pero por desgracia no tiene la posibilidad de serlo, asi que si Dios se lo permite adoptará a un pequeño para darle todo su cariño y amor. Su meta es convertir su pulperia en un mini-mercadito. Desde hace tres años trabaja con FAMA y es una de las mejores clientes de la Organizacion.
texts.en: Lesbia Danubia is 43 years old, married, and she lives in Colonia Porvenir Norte. Since she was very young she helped her mother attend the small grocery store that was installed in her house. Currently she has her own grocery store and it is well stock with all types of food products, personal hygiene products, and household cleaning products. Her husband helps her to attend the business. Their advantage is that there is no competition because they live in a small community in the outskirts of the city. All of her neighbors visit her store to purchase. With the requested loan she will be able to stock her business and with the profits she obtains she will have an income with which to support her family. Her greatest longing is to be a mother but unfortunately she is unable to become one. So if God permits it she will adopt a little one to give all of her care and love. Her goal is to convert her grocery store into a mini market. She has been with FAMA (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three years and she is one of the best members of the organization.

loans.use: to purchase general grocery store merchandise

loans.name: Duclida

texts.es:
Duclida es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos aún estudiando.  Cuenta con educación superior.
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, plastiqueria y venta de gas.  Su primer crédito fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles,  la señora invertirá en la compra de ocho balones de gas y comprará más productos para su tienda de plastiquería.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien es profesor.
Su sueño es tener su depósito de gas que le permita la venta al por mayor, de esa manera tendría más ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la organización.
texts.en:
Ducilda is a member of the “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) communal bank located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 44 years old, married and has two children who are still in school.  She completed higher education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last two years.  She sells groceries, plastic ware and gas.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her store.

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 8 gas tanks and she will also buy more plastic ware for the store.  Her children and her husband, who is a teacher, help her with the business.

Her dream is to have her own gas depot so that she can sell it at wholesale thus having more profits.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan and the organization.

loans.use: to buy 8 gas tanks and plastic items.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 32 years old and single. He has been a carpenter for sixteen years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy timber, nails and a hack saw which will increase his income.

With the anticipated profit from his business he will buy a piece of land and build his house. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pick up for transporting his furniture to far markets.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails and a hack saw to increase his income

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. 

Romulo has a shop that sells a variety of vegetables & spices. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables & spices for resale. 

Romulo is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Romulo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices for resale

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha Elena tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, vive con el padre, esposo y con el hijo de 10 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rumipamba Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes a a 20 minutos de la institución, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y crianza de animales.

Martha Elena se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de animales etc. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado del Cantón Chillanes cada fin de semana.
 
Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza para mantener en perfectas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos a un precio mejor y para coprar la comida para los animmales que cría.

 El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas a los sembríos de maíz, la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. 

El sueño de Martha es poder aportar económicamente para que su hijo culmine los estudios y llegar a hacer profecional. Es una mujer Honrada, paciente, trabajadora  le gusta las fiestas en especial el Carnaval y pasear con la familia por quye son muy unidos.
texts.en:
Martha Elena is 30 years old. She is married, and lives with her father, husband and 10-year-old son in the Chillanes Canton, in the Bolívar Province. 

The Communal Bank SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS is located in the Rumipamba District, which is part of the Chillanes Canton.  Chillanes is 20 minutes away from the bank's location.  The members of this group work in agriculture, mainly in growing corn and raising livestock.

Martha Elena works growing corn, raising livestock, etc.  She buys and sells her products every weekend at the market of the Chillanes Canton.

She is asking for the loan to buy manure, seeds, agricultural supplies, fertilizers, urea, and weedkillers to keep the crops in perfect condition so as to be able to sell them later at a good price.  She will also buy food for the animals she raises.

The loan will help her meet her financial needs and improve her agricultural activities.  She faces challenges such as pests in the corn plants, the drop in prices for the products she sells, and also dealing with the middle-men.

Martha's dream is to be able to contribute financially so that her son can finish his education and became a professional.  

Martha is a respected woman, who is patient and hard-working.  She enjoys the festivals, especially Carnaval, and going for walks with her family as they are very close.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, agricultural supplies, fertilizers, urea, weedkillers, and to buy food for the animals she raises.

loans.name: Eduardo Reginaldo

texts.es:
Eduardo, se dedica a la jardinería, siembra de cultivo agrícola, él vive con su hija y nieto, su trabajo es la jardinería, siembra de plantas ornamentales, y mantenimiento de jardines en las casas particulares y empresas, dándoles diferentes formas decorativas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una moto cierra,   ya que esta es su principal herramienta para ofrecer a los clientes el servicio de la jardinería, esta compra será muy provechosa para Eduardo ya que podrá continuar con su oficio.
El propósito de él es ayudar a su hija y nieto, cubriendo las necesidades más urgentes del hogar.
texts.en:
Eduardo works as a gardener and also grows crops.  He lives with his daughter and grandson. He plants ornamental plants, and maintains gardens for private homes and businesses, giving them different decorative shapes.

At this time, he is applying for a loan to buy a power saw, as this is the main tool he uses in providing gardening services to his customers. This purchase will be very beneficial for Eduardo, as he will be able to keep doing his trade. His purpose is to help his daughter and grandson, and cover the basic household necessities.

loans.use: To buy a power saw, in order to offer gardening services.

loans.name: Sabren

texts.en:
Sabren is a 28-year-old single woman from Al Hashmi, Amman.

Sabren is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase a new sewing machine to be added to her old ones so that she can meet the increased demand.

Sabren is looking to open her own shop and purchase a house.

The woman in the picture is Sabren's sister.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 29-year-old married man and father of 2 children. He has been manufacturing floor tiles and mosaic tiles for 10 years. He is well known in his region because of his high-quality products and speciA. prices. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to buy necessary machinery for his business.

Hassan is a hardworking man who seeks perfection in his work. This is his first time requesting a loan, and he hopes it will be with a positive effect on both the sociA. and financiA. sectors. He will also do necessary work on his house before the winter season to keep his family living under healthy conditions.

loans.use: To buy needed machinery for his business

loans.name: Na'ema

texts.en:
Na'ema is a 62-year-old woman.  She is married and has four sons and four daughters, all of them are married except one of her sons, who is employed and has a decent salary. 

Na'ema wants to open a small entertainment business by purchasing a number of computers to open a store for customers who like to play computer games.  But, the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN. When Na'ema gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a number of computers she needs to open the business.  This will enable her to open her business successfully and have many customers who enjoy playing computer games, which will lead to improving her income and better life conditions.   

Na'ema is photographed in the FATEN branch with her son Shareef.

loans.use: buy computers

loans.name: Clara Judith

texts.es:
Clara tiene 23 años D. edad, esta separada D. su compañero D. vida con dos hijos.

Ella se dedica a trabajar desD. hace un año, en una tortillería, ganando $3.00 dólares diarios, desD. las 6:00 D. la mañana hasta las 12:00 del mediodía. Después, sale a vender pan dulce D. casa en casa. Clara viaja tres veces por semana durante treinta minutos, a una ciudad del oriente del país a comprar el pan dulce.

Clara solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar cerdos y destazarlos, luego, salir a vender la casa D. casa en casa. Este era el negocio que su abuela le enseño desD. niña; también, invertirá en la compra D. mayor variedad D. pan dulce, porque por falta D. dinero no ofrece variedad D. pan dulce.

D. esta manera, clara tendrá su propio negocio, y comprara a mejor precio el pan dulce, ya que cuando compra poquito lo adquiere a mayor precio. A demás, se satisfará la demanda D. sus clientes y recibirá mejores ingresos. Los cuales le servirán para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos.

Ella ahorrara, para construirles una casa a sus hijos, ya que están viviendo en casa D. su abuela.
texts.en:
Clara is 23 years old and is separated from her life companion with two children. 

For a year now she has devoted herself to working at a tortilla shop, earning $3.00 dollars a day, from 6 a.m. until 12 noon. Afterwards she goes out to sell pastries door-to-door. Clara travels for thirty minutes three times a week to a city in the eastern part of the country to purchase the pastries. 

Clara is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo in order to purchase pigs and butcher them, then to go out and sell the meat door-to-door. This was the business her grandmother taught her when she was a child. She will also invest in the purchase of a greater variety of pastries, because owing to a lack of money she does not offer a variety of pastries. 

In this way Clara will have her own business, and will purchase the pastries at a better price, since when she buys in small amounts it carries a higher price. Furthermore she will satisfy her customers' demand, and bring in a better income, which will help her improve her children's quality of life. 

She will save in order to build a house for her children, since they are living in her grandmother's house.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and butcher them, and also to purchase a greater variety of pastries.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel's desire is to have a good relationship with her family and to always have faith in our almighty God. Maribel is 22 years old, married, and proud to share that at her age she already has one child. Maribel and her husband work hard to give her child a better future.

Maribel’s husband is a farmer. Aside from farming, Maribel manages a livestock business raising hogs, which serves as an additional source of income for the family. Maribel started this type of business as she knows that it will be a big help to sustain the needs of her family through the profit she earns.

With regards to her livestock business, Maribel is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs. She believes that the loan will be a big contribution to help her maintain her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs.

loans.name: Abdumachid

texts.ru: Абдумачид примерный семьянин, отец двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он предоставляет услуги такси на протяжении семи лет. Этот бизнес востребован и он имеет хорошие доходы. Вся полученная выручка уходит на содержание семьи. Он хочет дать своим детям хорошее образование. С наступлением зимы следует отремонтировать машину и подготовить к зиме. Он запрашивает займ для ремонта и покупки шин для автомашины. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку. Спасибо.
texts.en: Abdumachid is an exemplary family man, the father of two children. His wife is a homemaker. He has provided taxi service for the past seven years. His services are in high demand and he earns a good income. All of his proceeds go to providing for his family. He would like to provide a good education for his children. With the upcoming winter, he should repair and winterize his car. He is requesting a loan for repairs and purchasing tires for his car. He looks forward to your help and support. Thank you.

loans.use: buy tires and repair his car

loans.name: Colonel

texts.en: Colonel is a 30-year-old, hardworking man with 8 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been farming for the past 10 years and with the income earned, he has been able to buy land and expand his gardens. He has the challenge of seasonal weather. His dream is to buy land and grow more crops. Colonel needs the loan to pay workers who are weeding his gardens.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his gardens

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been running a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Yar has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, rice, and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are currently in school. For the past eight years, Jane has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize and beans for resale and will help Jane to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. 

Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías de 22 años de edad, es un joven soltero y vive con sus padres en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Elías se dedica a la agricultura. Cuando fue niño sus padres le enseñaron sobre esta actividad y fiel a sus enseñanzas, ahora él trabaja la tierra. En sus 2 parcelas de terrenos propios siembra café y plátanos. Sus productos los comercializa en las ciudades de Yurinaki y Pichanaki. Hasta esos lugares llegan los compradores para adquirir café bueno y plátanos sanos y carnosos.
Elías es consiente que también necesita estudiar alguna carrera técnica, no descarta la idea de hacerlo realidad. Mientras tanto continuará con su labor, para eso requiere el apoyo de sus hermanos ó contrata jornaleros a quienes paga diariamente. Una de sus metas es construir su casa propia, para cuando tenga su propia familia. Sería la primera vez que Elías recibiría un préstamo de MFP, por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es su reciente banco comunal, siente que en grupo sus logros serán mayores. Elías necesita 4 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para su cafetal. Gastará alrededor de 450 soles. Lo restante lo invertirá en el pago de los jornaleros para la limpieza de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Elías is 22 years old. He is a young, single man who lives with his parents in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in the province of  Chanchamayo. Elías works in agriculture. When he was a child, his parents taught him about this activity, and faithful to his learning, he now works the earth. On his two parcels of his own land, he grows coffee and plantains. He sells his products in the cities of Yurinaki and Pichanaki. Buyers go to those places to acquire good coffee and healthy, fleshy plantains.

Elias is aware that he also needs to study some sort of technical trade and he is not discarding the idea of making this reality. Meanwhile, he will continue his work, and for that he needs his brothers' support, or he will hire laborers whom he has to pay daily. One of his goals is to build his own house, for when he has his own family. This will be the first time he has received a loan from MFPm and that is why he firmly states that he will make his payments on time. “Los Productores Yaneshas” is his new communal bank. He feels that in a group, he will have grater achievements. Elías needs 4 bags of organic fertilizer for his coffee crop. He will spend around 450 soles. The rest he will invest in paying the laborers to clear his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 40-year-old hardworking lady with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent house.

She has been a retailer for the last three years after using her salary savings as capital, and she has continued to grow her business. She is facing hardships of price fluctuations and inflation. However, she has dreams of buying land to grow crops, expanding her business to new areas and moving her business to a permanent location.

Joy needs a loan to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.en:
Deyanira is a very young woman; she has 2 small children of 2 and 7 years old. She says that the most beautiful thing in her life is her family and sees how her children grow up. She started her business 4 years ago because she had the necessity to cover her family expenses. Deyanira\\\'s husband works as employee in a private company and he earns a minimum salary. She is working on shoes by catalogue sales for that reason now she is an important part of her family’s economy.

Deyanira says that her sales are increasing because every day every one around her clients has been knowing her and the best thing of her job allows her to have time to assist her children and her home. Deyanira requires a loan of $275 USD to purchase merchandise because she says that this Christmas season is the best season to increase her sales.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Deyanira es una mujer muy joven, tiene 2 hijos muy pequeños de 2 y 7 años de edad. Ella dice que lo mas bonito que tiene en su vida es su familia y por sobre todo ver a sus hijos crecer. Inicio su negocio hace 4 años ante la necesidad de cubrir los gastos del hogar, ya que el esposo de Deyanira trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada y tiene un salario mínimo. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo por lo que desde entonces forma parte importante en la economía de su familia.

Deyanira cuenta que las ventas siguen aumentando debido a que cada día se va dando a conocer entre sus clientes y lo mejor de su trabajo le permite tener tiempo para atender a sus hijos y su hogar. Deyanira requiere de un préstamo de $275 USD para la compra de mercancía porque dice que esta temporada navideña es la mejor para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her clothing business

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Miss Em is 38 years old and Minh, her husband, is 41. They have 4 children between ages 13 and 2 who are going to school. They have about 1 ha of cashew nut trees. However, the land is very poor and they also have no capital to buy fertilizer for the cashew nut trees so they only harvest 300 kg of cashew nuts. The income from the cashew nut trees is low at $150 for this year.

Miss Em sells vegetables at the local market. Selling vegetables is important for her family to increase their income about $1/person/month. Miss Em wants to get a loan of $75 to sell vegetables and to buy fertilizer. She promises to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: sell vegetables and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ayolah

texts.en:
Born in 1973, J. is one of two wives and mother of six children. Hardship following the death of her husband in 2003, a motor accident she had on the Bamenda Bambui road, and food insufficiency are her sources of motivation and determination. Committed in changing her family situation she took her first loan in 2006 and started a small medicine store. She succeeded in providing her community with First Aid services with non-prescription drugs.

Given a loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock by buying more medicine. She also plans to start a puff-puff and firewood business. Puff-puff is made out of wheat flour. They are table tennis-size balls fried in deep oil. This delicious food is often served with beans, porridge and tea. Primary schoolers enjoys puff-puff mostly as snacks. Firewood and puff-puff are in great demand on a daily basis. She plans to repay the loan over a period of 15 months. Loan repayment will commence a month after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Medicine store

loans.name: Rukkaya

texts.en: I have six children. Five of them attend school and the youngest will also attend when he is old enough. My husband and I sell ginger and garlic in the local market. With the arrival of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan and Eid right around the corner, we would like to set up a fruit stall along with our current business, because the sale of fruits significantly increases during this month. We hope to make a sizeable profit out of this venture. We need a loan of $200 to set up the fruit stall and gather some stock of ginger and garlic as it is cheap this season.

loans.use: To set up a fruit stall

loans.name: Osa’S

texts.en: Osa’s O. is 24 years old, is still single, and lives in Benin City. She is a professional hair dresser who studied the business for a year and six months, after which she started her own salon in 2006. The loan amount of $250 will go a long way to improve her business; she will be able to buy more weavons, hair creams, relaxers, and drinks for sale, as well as an additional dryer. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy weavons, hair creams, relaxers, and a dryer

loans.name: Flor María

texts.en:
Flor María is a true businesswoman. Today she owns and runs two stores specializing in beverages, but it took an impressive amount of dedication and initiative to accomplish what she has. Four years ago, Flor María had a small stand selling prepared meals in one of the local markets in Ayacucho, Perú. It was a difficult way to make a living, as the flow of customers was often unreliable due to extremely high rates of competition. In order to improve her economic situation she decided to make a change and open a store specializing in beverages. She supplies all types of sodas and juices, but her big seller is the “cerveza.” Little by little, Flor María store grew and attracted more customers and she was eventually able to open a second store. 

Today, Flor María has hired two “señoritas” who take care of all the sales and customer service, while Flor María handles all the administrative duties for the two stores. She builds relationships with her suppliers, watches her product flow carefully to decide what should be stocked, and everything else that goes along with running a small business. It’s hard work and she always seems to have a million things on her to-do list, but she loves her job.

Flor María’s next goal is to open a third store in Ayacucho. She is an obviously ambitious woman who is constantly looking for ways to bring her business to the next level. This is why she loves her village bank. It has taught her responsibility, punctuality, and how to save money in the bank where it accumulates interest. Moreover, Flor María loves her bank because through it she has made valuable lifelong friendships that serve as a distraction from the difficulties of everyday life. Flor María is requesting a loan of $350. All of this money will be reinvested into her beverage business, with the majority going towards the purchase of spirits, as they are the most popular and the most expensive product she supplies.

loans.use: To purchase spirits, which are both popular and expensive

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is 40 years old. Her current business is selling old or used clothes. She intends to build a house and a shop from the business profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Berha's Group

texts.en:
Bertha, Francisca, and Dora have been part of the community bank “Suni” for 5, 2, and 12 years respectively. In that time they have learned how to save, how to use their money more effectively, and how to be responsible. In addition they learned how to avoid domestic violence and how to more effectively prevent sickness. They like the community bank because it is simple. At other banks you have to wait a long time and fill out many forms.

Bertha is 30 years old. She is a single mother and has one six-year-old child. Her neighbor invited her to join the bank, and she started with just a $50 loan. At this time she sold vegetables at several regional markets. Now, with the help of the community bank, she owns a clothing store, and has been able to build a house.

Francisca is sixty years old. She is a widow and has eight adult children. Francisca never learned to read, and has been working all of her life. She grows potatoes in the region of Ayacucho, and with a van she was able to purchase with a bank loan, she transports them to the jungle eight hours away.

Dora is thirty-three. She lives with her partner and two children. She joined the bank twelve years ago when it was just starting out with $2 to her name. At the time she sold candies on one of the streets of Ayacucho. Since then she has been able to buy a house and start a new, and more profitable business, selling clothing.

Bertha, Francisca, and Dora need loans of 600, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying clothing, and raising potatoes.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Bertha, Francisca, and Dora plan to use their savings to put a second floor on their home, buying another field, and adding a roof to their home. Their dreams are to finish building their home, not have to travel to Lima as frequently, and to see their children happy and healthy.

loans.use: Bertha, Francisca, and Dora need loans of 600, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying clothing, and raising potatoes.

loans.name: Kibibi's Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Kibibi S., age 47, is married and has six children (ages 30, 27, 18, 14, 12 and 6). She has a hardware business which she began 8 years ago. She works from 8am to 6pm daily making a monthly profit of about US$171.

In the past, Kibibi has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She hopes for a new loan to increase her capital. Kibibi will share this loan with her subgroup members selling timber wood, bricks, hardware and charcoal.

In the picture, Kibibi is in the middle of the back row.

loans.use: To buy more building materials for her business

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
This committee pertains to a group of entrepreneurial women in the city of Minga Guazú, a city a few minutes for the city of Este where one of the largest offices of Fundación Paraguaya is located. There are already various groups of women taking loans in this area, and it was through these committees that the women in this group were able to find out about Fundación Paraguaya.

This particular group is made up of 17 women and is called Divina Misericordia (Divine Compassion). All of these women have unique skills which help them to generate larger incomes for their families. Their husbands work but the money that they earn is not enough to support their families. Among the diverse business activities that these women are involved are clothing sales, cosmetics, beauty shops, pantries, dress shops, and the sales of various food items.

This program committee of entrepreneurial women is developing through the help of Fundación Paraguaya, which allows these women to take loans in the form of a joint group, paying their quotas together. They also receive training to promote responsibility, savings, and other skills. Each one receives a loan of about 900,000 Guarani (about $200 US dollars) that they invest entirely in the purchase of goods and merchandise for their micro-businesses.

They are asking now for a new loan which will help them to acquire: clothing, shoes, meat, fruit, vegetables, flour, oil, dairy products, sweets, creams, perfumes, brushes, combs, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité pertenece a un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras de la ciudad de Minga Guazú, esta ciudad queda a escasos minutos de Ciudad del Este en donde se encuentra unas de las oficinas más grandes de Fundación Paraguaya. En dicha zona ya existía varios comités, por los que las integrantes de este comité tuvieron conocimiento del mismo através de las mujeres de los otros grupos.

El comité esta constituido por 17 señoras y se llama Divina Misericordia, todas poseen actividades distintas que les sirve para generar mayores ingresos a sus familias ya que a pesar de que sus esposos trabajan el dinero no es suficiente para mantener a toda la familia. Entre las diversas actividades existen vendedoras de ropa, cosméticos, peluqueras, otras tienen despensas, modistas, venta de comidas, entre otros.

El programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras desarrollado por la Fundación Paraguaya, les permite a estas mujeres retirar créditos en forma conjunta pagando sus cuotas de forma solidaria, también reciben capacitación para fomentar la responsabilidad, el ahorro entre otras cosas. Cada una lleva un monto aproximado de G. 900.000 que los invierten exclusivamente para la compra de insumos y mercaderías para sus microempresas.

Ellas están solicitando hoy día un nuevo crédito con el que podrán adquirir: ropa, zapatos, carne, frutas, verduras, harina, aceite, productos enlatados, golosinas, cremas, perfumes, cepillos y peines, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, meat, fruit vegetables, flour, oil, dairy products, sweets, creams, perfumes, brushes, combs, etc.

loans.name: Juhudi Youth Group

texts.en:
Roselyne K. is married and is a middle-aged mother of two children. She also houses two other children, whom she has to feed, educate, and clothe. Roselyne is the breadwinner for her family, as her husband is currently a temporary worker in a local hotel and hence has little money to support the family.

Roselyne’s business is fish vending, which she started four years ago. She mainly concentrates on tilapia and omena (fingerlings), which she sells to her regular customers in the neighborhood. With the help of her loan, Roselyne will be able to expand her fish business to increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: To expand her fish business

loans.name: Surma

texts.en: Surma was born in 1967 and is a mother of 3 children. She lives in Khachmaz town. 10 years ago she started a clothing business. Now she requests a loan of $750 to buy more inventory.  She promises to repay the loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy O. is 37 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. Mercy sells baby things. She learned this business in 4 months and started her own business in 2004. She has been a LAPO client for the past 7 years.

She is requesting a loan $875 USD to buy more baby things to sell.

loans.use: To buy more Baby things for sale

loans.name: Agnes Margaret

texts.en: Agnes Margaret E. is 35 years old and married with seven children.  She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria.  She owns a bar where she sells various brands of drinks.  She has been in this business since 2000.  She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more drinks and purified water to sell.  She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO (Kiva’s Field Partner).

loans.use: To buy more drinks and purified water to sell

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida, who is 27 and married with three children aged seven, three, and one, has been selling clothes and other commodities since 2007. Working daily, she can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Wahida is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and other commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero is 60 years old and lives in Benin City with her husband and eight children.  She has been selling firewood since 1988, having learned the business from her mother, and uses all of the profits from her sales to help care for her family.  

Up to this point she has operated with little capital, but with demand for firewood growing, Vero is missing out on business due to a lack of capital to keep a larger stock of firewood on hand.  She is therefore hoping that Kiva lenders can help her with a loan of $525 to enable her to buy more firewood to sell.  With the loan, she will be able to go to the forest and buy the wood in bulk for a lower per-piece rate.  She will thus be able to sell more and make more profit to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Shahnaz Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Akhtar baji is the wife of M. R. and lives in an area named Walton in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room house, where she has lived for the last 22 years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has a decorative embroidery business. Her other sons are in kindergarten. Her elder daughter sews clothes for neighbors at home. Her younger daughter is in the fourth standard.

Shahnaz baji’s husband works for the government. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah. Now she requests a loan to buy colored thread, beads, and sketches of designs for her son’s embroidery business.

Shahnaz baji has several other members in her loan group. Sugran baji requests a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband. Ramzana baji and Ruqaiya baji each request a loan to buy groceries to sell in their grocery shop. Hidayat baji requests a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.use: Buy supplies for embroidery business

loans.name: Oscar Isabel

texts.es:
El señor Oscar M. se dedica al negocio de herrería desde hace 20 años en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica arduamente a esta actividad con el propósito de llevar a cabo su sueño de brindarle un techo digno a su familia ya que a través del  transcurso de los años su vivienda ha sido azotada por lo que ha requerido mejorarla.

Para llevar a cabo esta obra ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta forma continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda para darle a su familia todas las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar M. has been a blacksmith for the past 20 years in the Somotillo area of the city of Chinandega. He puts much effort into his work with the purpose of realizing his dream of putting a proper roof over his family since over the years their home has broken down and requires much to be improved. To carry out this work, he has come to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him to buy construction materials and continue with the improvements on his home so that he can give his family all they need for their development.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Lisette

texts.es: Lisette tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a las labores de la panadería desde hace 5 años, debido a que su esposo se dedica a esta labor, y llevan de manera conjunta el proceso de la preparación de los panes. Luego de terminados son comercializados en las bodegas y también ellos mismos venden directamente en las principales calles de su localidad, esto se da en la mañanas, luego Lisette contabiliza la venta para ver las ganancias. Esta pareja trabaja arduamente que sus pequeños hijos puedan tener lo necesario para su sustento. Es el tercer préstamo que tiene Lisette con MFP, y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará sacos de harina, además una parte la usará para tramitar la titulación de su profesión como docente.
texts.en:
Lisette is 29 years old; she lives with her husband and their 2 children. She has been a baker for 5 years, since that is her husband's profession; they make the bread together.

The bread is sold in shops and they also sell loaves directly in the town's main streets during the morning; later Lisette keeps the books.

The couple work hard to ensure that their young children will have everything they need. This is Lisette's third loan from MFP; she has shown herself to be responsible in meeting her payments.

She will use the loan to buy sacks of flour, and part will be used by Lisette to obtain her qualification as a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour for her bakery

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Rose I. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of 18 and 28.  Rose has been running a  genge (grocery store) since 2004. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood and a tin roof where people can buy general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Rose works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week. She currently earns about $400 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $925 USD to purchase rice, maize, and beans. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. Rose thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This situation leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, maize and beans

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas” del centro poblado D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno; tiene 47 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijos, posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella refiere que posee un negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería y surtir su negocio.
Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo D. S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; con el préstamo ella pretenD. adquirir ganado menor para engorD., principalmente para las fiestas D. carnavales donD. existe mayor demanda D. la carne D. chancho y oveja. Con las ganancias ayuda en la educación D. sus hijos y en el sustento diario D. su hogar. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida por los créditos que viene otorgando Manuela Ramos para el desarrollo D. las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia is a member of the “United Stars” Community Bank in the town of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 47 years old, is married, and has 5 children. She has completed primary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She has a grocery store. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to acquire merchandise and supply her business. At present, she needs a loan for 1200 soles, which she promises to repay in 5 monthly installments. With this loan, she expects that she will acquire young cattle to fatten, mainly for the carnival parties, where there is a large demand for pork and sheep. With the earnings, she will help educate her children and will proviD. sustenance for her family. She is thankful for loan from Manuela Ramos for their development of women.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire young cattle to fatten, mainly for the carnival parties, where there is a large demand for pork and sheep. With the earnings, she will help educate her children and will provide sustenance for her family.

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Абдумажид Хайдаркулов  1968 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей.  С Микроинвест  сотрудничает около года. Бизнес откорм скота, и продажа молока и молочных изделий. Кроме откорма скота он бригадир  в сельском колхозе . В будущем после плодотворной работы и хорошего дохода, планирует продолжить сотрудничать с Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Adbumajid H. is married and has 4 children. He has been working with MicroInvest for about one year. His business is raising livestock and selling milk and dairy products. Besides his livestock business, Adbumajid is a foreman at a collective farm. In the future, after productive work and good profits, he plans to continue working with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru:
Сабоат , клиентка в Микроинвесте третий год. Она пунктуально погашает свои займы.
Её ассортимент состоит из материй. Каждый  свой кредит она использует целенаправленно, для расширения бизнеса, поэтому для закупа весеннего ассортимента 
Сабоат подала очередную заявку.
Её точка продажи расположена на рынке Худжанда, на Паншанбе.
texts.en:
Saboat has been a MicroInvest client for three years. She repays her loans on time. She sells material. She uses each loan purposefully to expand her business. She has submitted a loan request to buy inventory for spring. She sells her goods in Panshanbe market in Khojand.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabrics

loans.name: Jinane

texts.en:
Jinane is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Tripoli in northern Lebanon with her husband and their child. Jinane owns a clothing shop and sells children’s clothes. She requested a loan of 1,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loan helped her improve her shop. Jinane is unique in her work because she sells a large variety of clothes. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. She decided on starting her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans on expanding her shop.

loans.use: Jinane will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small shop (general store) in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Fatma belongs to Tuwe wakweli group loan. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Fatma is 46 years old, married, and has four children: ages 23, 21, 19 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi S. est une jeune femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de poissons au marché d’Avetonou, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise.  la bonne gestion de son commerce lui permis d’accroître considérablement ses ventes au cours de se derniers temps. Pour augmenter la capacité de son commerce, Akuvi souhaite avec ce crédit payer des poissons et des légumes pour la revente.
texts.en:
Akuvi S. is a young woman, 39 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is a fish retailer at the marketplace of Avetonou, a village located northeast of Lomé, the capital of Togo. Good business management has enabled her to increase her sales a great deal most recently. To increase her business capacity, she would like to use this loan to pay for some fish and vegetables for resale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: El

texts.en: El P., 48, lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and two of his children. He is a professional tailor who makes approximately US$4 per day. His wife also work as a tailor and makes US$3 per day. One of their children is a tailor and one other is a student. El P. is asking for a loan to purchase cloth so that they can make more clothes. (El P. is pictured with his wife and his daughter at home).

loans.use: To purchase cloth.

loans.name: Aergash

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Эргаш  Окулов проживает вместе со своей семьей в Ганчинском районе. У Эргаша 5 детей.  20 лет Эргаш занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока.
Эргашу в животноводстве помогают жена Рузигул и сыновья. Дополнительно наш клиент работает мастером по ремонту жилых домов.
Эргаш запрашивает кредит для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Aergash O. lives with his family in the Gonjy district. He has 5 children. Aergash has been involved in livestock feeding and milk processing for 20 years. His wife, Ruzigul, and sons help him with the animal husbandry business. Additionally, our client works as a home repairman. Aergash is requesting this loan for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Blanca Ruth

texts.es: Blanca Ruth C. H. vive en el departamento de Cuscatlán junto a sus dos hermanos y su madre Doña Petrona de 82 años de edad. Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, desodorantes, entre otros. Blanca tiene 12 años de experiencia en su negocio donde la manera de comercializar su mercadería es de forma ambulante es decir de casa en casa, pero también Blanca posee un pequeño inventario en una vitrina de su casa donde los vecinos pueden ir a comprar para uso personal o algún regalo que quiera dar ya que también Blanca posee materiales para hacer regalos. Este crédito lo solicita por que desea comprar mercadería por mayor ya que de esta manera logra conseguir precios más baratos en sus productos y así logra obtener mayores ganancias de los mismos.
texts.en:
Blanca Ruth C. H. lives in the department of Cuscatlán along with her two brothers and her 82-year-old mother, Doña Petrona. Blanca makes a living selling beauty products, such as perfumes, lotions and deodorant, among other items. She has 12 years experience in the business, selling her products door to door, but she also has a small inventory in a display case at her home where her neighbors can come to buy something for themselves or for a gift because she also has gift-wrapping materials. She is requesting the loan because she wishes to purchase her merchandise at wholesale in order to get her products at cheaper prices, and in this way obtain better earnings herself.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase her merchandise at wholesale

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: Janette B. is 42 years old and makes a living by helping her husband run their two-hectare rice farm. She has applied for this loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to increase her farm's yield by buying fertilizers and chemicals. She likes being involved with Community Economic Ventures because it is a way to get training and insurance as well as loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals to increase the yield of her farm

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. operates a family member's business raising pigs for sale. She is 50 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. Lourdes has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month.

In 2004, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock and as additional capital to sell dried fish. This will be her 14th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana Mercedes D. D. F. vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo quien se encuentra ya pensionado por tener 87 años D. edad. Ana posee una tienda ubicada en su casa la cual le permite generar a Ana los ingresos  para ella y su esposo, ahora Ana solicita este crédito para surtir su negocio el cual le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias que son D. gran utilidad para su familia y su le concederá hacer un ahorro para la salud quebrantada D. su esposo.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia manages a general store in the village of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She is a responsible housewife and mother to her children. She hopes that her children will earn college degrees so they can get good jobs and have pleasant living conditions.  Her husband works as a driver in Tabuk, Kalinga Apayao.  To help improve her general store, Rosalia requests a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders.  She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so she can better maintain her store.

loans.use: To improve her general store.

loans.name: We Will Overcome# 2 Group

texts.en:
Jebbeh J. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'We Will Over Come #2'. She is a high school graduate but couldn't continue her education due to poverty. Jebbeh is married  with 2 children, ages 4 and 7 years old, in kindergaten and 2nd grade.

Jebbeh buys fruits and vegetables like peppers, garden eggs (a sort of eggplant), cabbages, etc. wholesale and  sells them retail to the residents of Virginia where she lives. She has been taking care of her family by means of this business for 2 years, since she started this business.

Jebbeh always encourages her customers by adding a few extra vegetables and fruits to what they buy. She has hopes of expanding her business through savings and good management. The loan is needed in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

Jebbeh dreams of improving her own and her family's lives through her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca. She is 49 years-old and married with five children. Francisca is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. Francisca is a native of Cusco.

Francisca sells consumables such as ice cream, eggs, etc. in one of the large plazas in Cusco. With the loan, she will be able to stock more goods to sell.

Franciso appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a food stall.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est composé de cinq femmes, toutes mariées dont trois dans des ménages monogames. Elles sont âgées en moyenne de 28 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et habitent dans le quartier Djaka (Kirango) de  Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, d’amitié, et de voisinage. Elles sont toutes  membres de l’association traditionnelle « Traoré Ton » qui donna son nom  à leur actuelle association. Elles font exclusivement le commerce de poisson, sous toutes ses formes 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, elles décidèrent  d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le groupe Sabali est à son cinquième prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les  quatre précédents prêts
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 30 paniers de poisson frais et 50 barres  de glace (fournies par les transporteurs venant de Bamako). Elles s’approvisionnent  en poissons frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger, qui est trié, une  partie de ce poisson est séchée (soit sur du gravier soit sur de la paille ou sur des « seccos »).Le poisson se vend sous toutes ses formes: les poissons frais se vendent sur place au bord du fleuve Niger,  à Kirango et à Diamarabougou Markala parfois en ambulant dans les quartiers, le frais  conservé dans de la glace se vend à Ségou (au marché château) et  Bamako, le poisson séché dont une partie est conservée jusqu’à la décrue et à l’hivernage où elles gagnent plus d’argent  est surtout vendu à Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango, Boussin et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou, le poisson fumé est essentiellement vendu à Ségou. Les ventes se font généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux et à participer aux évènements sociaux (baptême, mariage et décès). 
Leur ambition est  d’acheter du bétail  dont les mâles seront vendus petit à petit pour construire une concession à usage d’habitation, une façon d’assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Sabali is composed of five women, all married, of whom three are from monogamous households.  The women average 28 years of age and 3 children each and live in the Djaka district (Kirango) of Markala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, friendship, and community.  They are all members of the traditional association "Traoré Ton", which lends its name to their current association.  The group members do commerce exclusively in fish, in all its forms.  In order to satisfy the needs of their customers, the women decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their fifth solidarity loan after having repaid the four previous loans.  This new loan will be used to buy 30 baskets of fresh fish and 50 bars of ice (furnished by transporters coming from Bamako).  Supplies of fresh fish are gotten on the banks of the Niger Rivers.  The fish is sorted, and a portion is dried (either on gravel or on straw or on seccos).  The fish is sold in all forms:  the fresh fish is sold locally on the banks of the Niger River, in Kirango, and in Diamarabougou Markala, sometimes door-to-door in the districts.  The fresh fish kept on ice is sold in Ségou (at the Château Market) and in Bamako.  The dried fish (part of which is reserved until the waters recede and until the off-season when the women earn more money) is sold especially in Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango, Boussin, and at the weekly fair of Ségou.  The smoked fish is essentially sold in Ségou.   Sales are made generally in cash to customers composed of women and men. The group members plan on realizing an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover sundry family needs and to assist with societal events (baptisms, marriages, funerals).  Their ambition is to buy livestock, of which the males will be sold over time in order to build a concession in which to live.  This is a way to ensure the children's future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Siga

texts.fr: Siga D. est mariée, 39 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de haricot et d’oseille. Son objectif est de maintenir son activité afin de mieux aider à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Siga D. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She works selling beans and sorrel. Her goal is to continue this business in order to improve her family's quality of life, health and education.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling beans and sorrel

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle is 35 years old and is married with three children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Bolanle sells clothing and is planning to purchase a variety of clothing that will significantly expand his clothing trade. He believes that having an assortment of clothes of good quality will increase his sales.

Bolanle is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more clothing to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Mr. Chhorn P., 45, is a humble father who has eight children. Three of them are working at different jobs and provide their small incomes to support the family’s food needs. Currently, he owns a car that he uses to supply a taxi service for income (Chhorn P. was busy at his taxi business so his wife is in the photo instead.) His wife stays at home to do housework and also to produce traditional brooms for sale. Since the family’s house is old and too small for them, Chhorn P. has been planning to build a new house for a long time, but he doesn’t have enough money to start the construction. Therefore, he requests a loan of US$1200 from Kiva through HKL to be added to his savings which will enable him to begin building a new house.

loans.use: To begin building a new house

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Elenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
