Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anastasio

texts.es:
Anastasio tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. Nuestro socio trabaja como albañil. El socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. Ya son tres años que es albañil y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su labor. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar tejas, carrizos y adobes (El adobe es una pieza para construcción hecha con una masa de barro (arcilla y arena) mezclada a veces con paja, moldeada en forma de ladrillo) para construir su casa. El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Anastasio pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa.  La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
texts.en:
Anastasio is 32 years old and lives with his partner and his three children. He works as a bricklayer. He is an enterprising father who works hard to get his family ahead. He is been a bricklayer for 3 years and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort that he puts into his work. He needs a loan to buy roof tiles, reeds and adobes (adobe is a construction material made from a mass of mud of clay and sand, sometimes mixed with straw, that is molded into the form of a brick) to build his house. He is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and pledges to make his payments on time. Anastasio belongs to the communal bank "Villa Rayanniyoc," which is part of the Arariwa Association. The city of Rayanniyoc is located some 30 minutes from the city of Cusco, and it is a place where the main economic activities are agriculture and livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, reeds and adobe (sundried bricks) to build his house

loans.name: Sothun's Group

texts.en:
The loan group, which consists of four people, is located in Anlong Romiet Khang Tbou Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sothun L. was selected by the members to be the group leader. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sothun L. is a grocer in local village and her husband, Mr. Vudoeng Roeun, is a construction worker. Although this family tries to work hard in their careers, they earn less money than they need. So, to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Sothun L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell so she can expand her business. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to re-sell

loans.name: Martha Ryder

texts.es: Martha Ryder tiene 36 años, esta mujer es una muy responsable y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de gaseosas, jugos, refrescos naturales. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que ella se esfuerza para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son lo más importantes para ella, pues sus inicios fueron muy difíciles pero esto no la detuvo a seguir adelante con este negocio, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer el servicio de costura pues no le proporcionaba los ingresos necesarios. Ella quiere para un futuro que sus hijos logren obtener estabilidad en sus vidas. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de  jugos en caja, gaseosas y las frutas para la elaboración de refrescos naturales.
texts.en:
Martha Ryder is 36 years old and a responsible woman with two dependent children. She sells sodas, juices, and natural beverages. Martha has been in this business for more than four years and strives to support her two children because they are her most important priority. Starting her business was difficult but this did not deter her from succeeding in her business. Previously she offered sewing services, but this activity did not provide her with sufficient income. In the future, she hopes her children will achieve stability in their lives. The loan she is questing will be used to buy boxed juices, sodas, and fruit for making natural soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boxed juices, sodas, and fruit

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: Satou G. est une dame de 70 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient un commerce en détail de divers articles tels que : sucre, oignon, mil, beurre, riz et café. Elle souhaiterait renforcer son activité et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Satou G. is a 70-year old lady who is married and has two children. She has a retail business selling various items such as: sugar, onions, millet, butter, rice and coffee. She would like to strengthen her business and contribute to her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of various food products

loans.name: Sébastienne

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, O. Sébastienne vit depuis 18 ans environs à PK12, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Sébastienne est mariée à DJOSSOU Paul, un mécanicien auto et est mère de six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Sébastienne a un autre enfant à charge. La famille vit ensemble et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Sébastienne n'a pas féquenté l'école. Depuis près de 15 ans, Sébastienne mène comme activité, la vente de boissons et divers produits cosmétiques au marché Dégakon à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sébastienne s'approvisionne. Sébastienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié auparavant de deux crédits, qu'elle a bien remboursés. Sébastienne sollicite un autre crédit, afin d'agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. O. Sébastienne has been living for about eighteen years in PK12, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin. She is married to Mr. DJOSSOU Paul, an auto mechanic, and is the mother of six children, some of whom are in school. The family lives together, and the couple jointly ensure that house expenses are covered. Sébastienne never attended school. For nearly fifteen years, she has been running a business selling beverages and a variety of cosmetics at the Dégakon market in Cotonou. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having benefited before from two loans, which she has repaid. She's requesting another loan in order to expand her business further and to respond better to the numerous demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying drinks, liquor, and cosmetics

loans.name: Mrs. Nary Pine Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan which consists of eighteen members is located in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. All the members plan to use their loan proceeds for different purpose. Mrs. Nary P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to grow rice to support her family's livelihood and her husband is a palm juice collector. They earn very little income; yet, they try to work hard despite their situation. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Nary P. decide to apply for a loan to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business. The couple supports three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Lucina Paulina

texts.es:
Lucina V. de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua pero los caminos del sector donde vive siguen siendo de tierra. Es viuda pero tiene dos hijas que ya están casadas y ya tienen hijos. 

Lucina empezó con su negocio de costura cuando su esposo murió ya que no tenía ingresos para sostener su hogar. Con sus ahorros compro una pequeña maquina de coser, y empezó a promocionarse a sus vecinos como costurera. 

En la actualidad ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa trabaja desde las 06:30 am hasta terminar su trabajo. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos y botones para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere que su taller sea el mas grande de su sector y que sus hijas trabajen con ella.
texts.en:
Lucina V., 57, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and has electricity and running water but the streets where she lives are still unpaved. She is a widow but has two married daughters with children of their own. Lucina started her sewing business when her husband died because she had no income to support her family. She used some savings to buy a small sewing machine and started to advertise herself in the neighborhood as a seamstress. She currently has a small workshop at home and works from 6:30am until she finishes her work. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and buttons. In the future she would like her workshop to be the largest in the area and that her daughters work with her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, thread.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G. is a 59-year old, married woman who lives in Sto. Comon, Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running her general store, her sewing business, billiard games and her cafeteria.

Evelyn’s husband, Froilan, manages the cafeteria business, and they have 1 child who is 22 years old. The child is currently going to school and also helps out in the business as part of the daily chores.

Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store, sewing business, billiard games and her cafeteria. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities.

Evelyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 18,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and cafeteria business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 16th loan, the amount of Php 19,000, which she intends to use on her general store and her other businesses. Evelyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en: Keo K. is the leaders of a three person group located in Trapeang Roka village, in Takeo province. They will use their share of the loan for different purposes.  Keo K. has two children, one of whom is a laborer and the other helps out at the family farm.  Keo and her husband own two hectare of land to grow crops.  They also breed and sell pigs.  Keo is asking for a loan to hire laborers to harvest sesame.

loans.use: Hire farming laborers to harvest sesame.

loans.name: Saviy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. C. O. is 48 years old and is the leadE. of this group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Kaoh Kaev Leu village in Kandal province. With this group loan, each membE. will use it to support their different purposes. 
Mrs. C. O. is a farmE. who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. She is able to earn a small income to support hE. family's costs of living. In ordE. to support this farm, Mrs. C. O. decided to ask for a loan to pay for laborers to plow hE. farm and to buy vegetable seed to support hE. farming crops. 
Mrs. C. O. is a widow with seven children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a security guard while the othE. five are students in the local school and also support their mothE.'s farming efforts.

loans.use: To pay for laborers to plow her farm and to buy vegetable seed.

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es: Reyna De La Paz R. H. de 41 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijos quienes estudian. Reyna  posee una tortillería, en la cual trabaja desde hace más de 15 años, el cual ha sido un negocio bastante rentable, debido a que la tortilla por ser parte de la dieta básica de los salvadoreños, posee mucha demanda. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria la cual posee la habilidad de poder elaborar muy buenos platillos típicos, por lo que desea ampliar las ventas de su negocio. Reyna  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la venta de pupusas, comprando maíz por mayor para elaborar siempre tortillas y hacer las pupusas, así mismo comprar queso, chicharrón, frijoles, tomates y otros ingredientes más para la elaboración de estas ultimas, así mismo desea poder comprar una cocina más grande llamada plancha, la cual se utiliza especialmente para hacer tortillas y pupusas, de esta manera ella podrá elaborar mayor cantidad de estas y así atender a más clientes. Reyna anhela ver prosperar su negocio y de esta menara contar con una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna De La Paz R. H. is 41 years old and lives in the Sonsonate department. She lives with her working spouse and her two children who are studying. Reyna owns a tortilla shop where she has worked for over 15 years. It has been a very profitable business, in high demand, because the tortilla is part of the basic Salvadoran diet. She is a very hard worker and visionary who has the ability to produce very good traditional dishes, which is why she wants to expand her business sales. Reyna is requesting a loan through which she can have the money to invest for selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran food). She will buy wholesale corn to make her tortillas and pupusas; Likewise she will buy cheese, pork, beans, tomatoes and other ingredients for the development of the latter. She also wants to buy a bigger stove called “plancha”, which is especially used for making tortillas and pupusas, so she can make a large quantity of these and thus serve more customers. Reyna longs to see her business grow and thus have better economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy the main ingredients to make tortillas and pupusas.

loans.name: Santa Maria Jaloxtoc Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA SANTA MARIA JALOXTOC PORQUE ES EL NOMBRE DE LA IGLESIA DEL PUEBLO. ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE JALOXTOC, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN POR SER VECINOS. ESTE ES SU 1er. PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION RALIDAD. 
LA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO MONICA B. J. TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD Y ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6º: GRADO DE PRIMARIA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS, JUAN ANTONIO TIENE 12 AÑOS Y CRISTHIAN JESUS TIENE 8 AÑOS DE EDAD. LA SEÑORA MONICA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS POR CATALAGO DE LA MARCA "JAFRA" Y NECESITA SU PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR PERFUMES, LAPIZ LABIAL, SOMBRAS Y COSMETICOS DE JAFRA. INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 4 AÑOS LE DIERON UN VOLANTE PARA UNA PLATICA Y LE PARECIO BUENO PORQUE LE DA TIEMPO DE CUIDAR  A SUS HIJOS EN ESPECIAL AL MAS PEQUEÑO  QUE ESTA DISCAPACITADO NO PUEDE HABLAR TIENE ATRAZO PSICOMOTOR  ASISTEN A TERAPIAS A LA CD. DE CUAUTLA. SU NEGOCIO ES IMPORTANTE POR QUE ES EL SOSTEN DE SU FAMILIA Y LE PONE ENTUSIASMO A SUS VENTAS PARA QUE EL NEGOCIO NO CAIGA. LAS GANACIA LAS UTILIZA PARA IR PAGANDO EL PRESTAMO Y PARA LAS TERAPIAS DE SU HIJO Y DE ELLA YA QUE LE COBRAN POR CADA TERAPIA Y EL PASAJE PARA TRASLADARSE A CUAUTLA Y A SU DOMICILIO. "TENER UN NIÑO DISCAPACITADO ES VIVIR LA VIDA DIFERENTE A LOS DEMAS" COMENTA MONICA. 
SU NEGOCIO ENFRENTA COMPETENCIA DE MAS PERSONAS QUE VENDEN LOS MISMOS PRODUCTOS. SUS SUEÑOS SON TENER UN LOCAL YA ESTABLECIDO PARA NO CAMINAR DE CASA EN CASA. EN EL PUEBLO DE JALOXTOC SE VE MUY BONITO EL CAMPO, HAY 2 JAGUEY, LA FIESTA DEL PUEBLO ES EL 8 DE DICIEMBRE FESTEJANDO A SANTA MARIA Y ESE DÍA HAY MISA, MARIACHIS Y COMIDA PARA TODA LA GENTE QUE ASISTE. 
LOS OTROS INTERANTES DEL GRUPO SON:
*MARIA DE LOURDES M. B. VA A COMPRAR PERFUMES DE DAMA CABALLERO, LAPIZ LABIAL Y SOMBRAS PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO.
*SABINA H. M. VA A COMPRAR AZUCAR, POPOTES, BOLSAS, SABORES, FRUTAS ETC. PARA ELABORAR SUS PALETAS DE HIELO. 
*RUFINA R. CANUTOVA A COMPRAR CALZADO PARA EMPEZAR CON EL NEGOCIO, 
*CRISTINA C. B. VA A COMPRAR VERDURAS Y FRUTAS PARA INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO 

LA SEÑORA MONICA DICE: “GRACIAS POR CONFIAR EN MI, POR TENDERME LA MANO Y PROMETO NO DEFRAUDARLO Y SEGUIR ADELANTE”.
texts.en:
This united group is called Santa Maria Jaloxtoc because it is the name of the church of the village. It is located in the village of Jaloxtoc, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of 5 members who know each other because they are neighbors. This is their first loan with Fundacion Realidad. The member Monica B. J. is 30, and went to school through the sixth grade. She has 2 sons, Juan Antonio, 12, and Cristhian Jesus, 8. Monica sells perfumes and cosmetics through a catalog of the “Jafra” brand. She needs the loan to buy perfumes, lipsticks, eye shadows and cosmetics from Jafra. She started her business 4 years ago when she was given a flyer to come to a talk and she thought this business was a good idea because she would have time to take care of her children, especially the youngest. He is handicapped. He can’t speak and he is slow physically so they go for therapy in the city of Cuatla. Her business is important because it is what supports the family and she puts a lot of energy into it so that sales don’t fall off. She will use the earnings to pay off the loan and for her son’s therapy and for her since she has to pay for each session and for the transportation to Cuatla from her home. “ To have a handicapped child is to live life differently from other people,” says Monica. Her business has competition from others who sell the same products. Her dream is to set up her own stand so that she doesn’t have to sell from house to house. In the village of Jaloxtoc the countryside is beautiful. There are 2 jagueys (trees). The village feast is the 8th of December honoring Santa Maria and there is a Mass on that day, mariachis, and food for all the people who attend. The other people of the group are: Maria de Lourdes M. B. who is going to buy perfumes for woman and cologne for men, lipsticks and eye shadows to supply her business. Sabina H. M. who will buy sugar, straws, bags, flavorings and fruit, etc to make ice cream popsicles. Rufina R. Canutova who will buy shoes to start a business. Christina C. B. who will buy vegetables and fruit to increase her business. Monica says “thanks for trusting in me, for offering me help and I promise not to be dishonest, and to continue getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cometics from Jafra.

loans.name: Que Teekeh. Group

texts.en:
Philip M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Que Teekeh'. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children whose ages are between 2 to 13 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support. Philip cares for one sibling.   

For 8 years, he has been selling soap, biscuits, milk, soft drinks and tea in Smart Road Community in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more soap, biscuits, milk, soft drinks and tea. 

He describes himself as a devoted family man. His dream is to grow his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, biscuits, milk, soft drinks and tea.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn Q. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Jovelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business preparing and selling snacks to the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she has for sale. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida M. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old and is married with three infant children. Leonida owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 6th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina T. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 58 years old. Rosalina is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Rosalina runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Liston  Kimani

texts.en:
Liston Kimani is 28 years old, a single and hardworking young man, who runs a poultry business in Uthiru, just few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. He supplies eggs to retail kiosks in the neighborhood estates and he earns a monthly profit Kshs.19,800. Additional family income comes through planting of "sukuma wiki" (kale)  which he sells to his neighbors. He has been in this business for one year and three months.

Liston has no history with any other MFI, and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs.20,000 after being introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He intends to use this loan to buy  layer chicks  for more eggs to sell later.

In future Liston plans to venture into rearing broilers and pigs to be able meet the demand for meat in the estate as this is a very good business that generates good income.

loans.use: To buy layer chicks for more eggs for sale later

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 28-year-old married man blessed with a six-year-old child. He sells shoes to earn a living.  He has been in the business for nine years and has one employee. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to improve his business by giving him financial support.  He hopes to have a big business and improve his standard of living in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard explains that he is a hardworking and imaginative man. To provide for his family, he runs a private, primary school. He started the school five years ago. Currently, he is operating the school with 26 employees.

He joined Faulu Kenya through a group called the "Sunshine Self Help Group." With the help of the group, he is better able to save his money. In addition, the group members guarantee each others' loans. With the requested loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500), he plans to buy cement for renovating the classrooms’ floors. In the future, he would like to expand the school into a college.

loans.use: To renovate classroom floors by purchasing cement

loans.name: Los Robles Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Los Robles” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por ocho mujeres.  Los negocios que desempeñan son: tejido y venta de botellas desechables, tienda de barrio surtida, trenzado de manta, tejido de buzos a máquina, venta de ganado, venta de camas y mantillas, tejido de buzos, artesanía en hilo de Vicuña. 

 La señora presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Victoria, madre de dos hijos, comenta que este es su primer ciclo,  indica que forma parte del B.C. “Los Robles” debido a la invitación de sus amigas, quienes le invitaron a formar parte de la banca comunal.  La señora Victoria tiene como negocio la venta de chompas y mantillas de alpaca, inició este negoció gracias al apoyo de su hermana hace 10 años, cuando era muy joven.  Ella realiza la venta de manera ambulante en la zona 12 de Octubre y la Ceja.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta trabajar con las señoras.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Robles” (the oak trees)  began its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the main office in Senkata.  This is a new group that has gotten together to receive financing services, training, and health care.  It is made up of eight women.
The businesses that they are engaged in are: knitting, sales of recycled bottles, a convenience store, braided rugs, machine-knit sweaters, cattle sales, sales of beds and shawls, knitted sweaters, and handicrafts made from Vicuna thread.

The president of the communal bank, Victoria, is the mother of two children.  She tells us that this is her first cycle as part of the communal bank “Los Robles”, thanks to an invitation from her friends, who were themselves invited to be part of the bank.  Victoria sells sweaters and alpaca shawls.  Thanks to her sister she began this business ten years ago when she was very young   She is a street merchant in the 12th of October and la Ceja area.
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she enjoys working with the women.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es:
Jose de 35 años, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Siempre le gusto el comercio y cuando tuvo la oportunidad de tener su negocio con un pequeño capital compro víveres para tener su propia tienda. Por la buena decisión de colocar la tienda en la parte delantera de su casa ahora lo conocen en el sector muchas personas. Trabaja desde las 07h00h hasta las 16h00pm atendiendo la tienda vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas, enlatados, snack etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite ya que son los víveres que más consumen las personas. 

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio para tener más dinero y asegurar su vejez y la de sus padres ya que no tiene hijos y es soltero.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old and has a little grocery store in the front part of his house. He lives in an urban zone called Guasmo, which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are informal merchants.

He has always liked selling, and when he had the opportunity to open his business with a small amount of capital, he bought groceries so that he could have his own store. Thanks to the good decision to open the store in the front part of his house, he is now known by many people in his area. He works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. tending the store, where he sells rice, sugar, soft drinks, canned foods, snacks, etc. With the loan, he wants to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil, since these are the groceries that people consume most. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business to earn more money and save for his old age and that of his parents, since he is single and has no children.

loans.use: Buying rice and canned goods

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim N., 37, is married to Soeurn San, age 35. The couple has been married for years, and they have two children who are still learning in school.

Yim is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few ducks in a stall at their home. To improve her poultry trade, Yim N. is taking out a loan to purchase ducklings to raise and sell.

Yim N. and her husband are pictured in the accompanying photo.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings

loans.name: Wilmer Jaime

texts.es:
Wilmer Jaime O. V. tiene 27 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
  
Wilmer Jaime se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la comercial Olivo.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar una finca 

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Wilmer Jaime O. V. is 27 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner and their children in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Rios. They have one son.

The members of the V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE ("New Horizon communal bank") are located in the recinto of Cachel y Grande, which belongs to the canton Ventanas. This communal bank is involved with short-cycle agricultural work such as the sowing of corn, rice, and pigeon peas, which takes a lot of time to do.

Wilmer Jaime is a farmer who sows corn, rice and pigeon peas. He buys his products in Agro Karlyta and sells his produce at the store Olivo. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers to harvest corn, rice and pigeon peas. The support of the loan will help him meet his needs financially. He is faced with challenges such as insect plagues, crop diseases and variations in the weather. His dream is to be able to buy a farm. He enjoys sports.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sop Caurie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP CAURIE est créé de bientôt 5 ans. Il est composé de 25 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. D'une manière globale elle pratique le petit commerce de fruits

Madame NDEYE ASTOU D. debout en cinquième position à partir de la gauche et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Comme les autres femmes du village elle fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison. Elle maitrise bien cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis son jeune âge.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'intensifier son activité en achetant plus de fruits

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnel tout en participant à la prise en de la famille
texts.en:
The SOP CAURIE solidarity group was created almost 5 years ago. It is made up of 25 women from the same village. Overall, they run businesses selling fruit.
Ndeye Astou D., standing fifth from the left and identified in the inset portrait, is in charge of the group. She is 40 years old, married and mother to 5 dependent children.
Like the other women in the village, she sells seasonal fruit. She runs her business well, having worked at it from a young age.
This new loan will allow her to expand her business by purchasing more fruit. Her goal is to support herself and to help cover her family’s expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie lives in the town of Trento, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is married and has 2 children aged 14 and 6. Vergie and her husband are both farmers. They have been tilling their rice farm for over a decade now. A few years back, Vergie decided to raise pigs to have another source of income. Vergie works hard to improve her small piggery.

Vergie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Reun

texts.en:
Mrs. Reun S. is married with four children. She has been living in a commune located in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband earn a profit by fishing in a local lake and river which provides them with enough fish for their family. Mrs. Reun S. always wakes up early in the morning to go fishing and is back home in the evening time. Mrs. Reun S. then sells the fish that she has caught in the lake from her store located in her house. 

As fishing is the family's core source of income, Mrs. Reun S. is asking for a loan of $400 USD to buy more fishing equipment, such as nets and traps, to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment, such as nets and traps, to expand her fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kasur. Kasur is famous for its tanneries industry. She has been living there in a 3-room brick house with her family for many years. She is 46 years old, married to G. D., and has 3 children. All of them are very young and enrolled in a local high school for getting education. 

Her husband is a goldsmith. He operates his business and has a shop in the market. He is very good at customer relationships and never compromised on quality. He sells through his shop different types of jewelry like gold, silver, and costume jewelry. He always provides quality services to his customers, that’s why his customers trust him and obtain his services regularly. 

Abida herself does sewing. She takes orders from her neighboring clients and fills them on time to earn income for her family. The money she earns is used to pay her children's school fees. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy silver and beads for making jewelry such as bangles, earrings, etc. This will help him provide better quality services to his customers and make more profits. He has been operating this business for the past 30 years and Abida is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy silver and beads for jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Los Gladiolos Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Los gladiolos esta conformado por 8 integrantes,  la presidenta es la Sra. Cecilia, casada tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, trabaja todas las mañanas y cuida a sus hijos por las tardes, es una persona muy trabajadora que realiza el servicio de limpieza en una casa de familia, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar algunos electrodomésticos para su casa como una licuadora y un dvd, etc.   ella vive en la zona de chacacollo , el grupo esta conformado por personas muy humildes y trabajadoras realizan la elaboración de chicharon de pollo , comercio de ladrillos e incluso la elaboración de ladrillos , este banco de emprendimiento este conformado por vecinas de la zona  que viven hace varios años en la misma ,cada una de ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan de lunes a domingo  , se conocen bastante bien entre ellas en el grupo  existe la participación de 1 varón de igual manera son muy conocidos con su respectiva actividad .es un banco muy organizado dinámicos .
texts.en:
The 'Los Gladiolos' (Gladioli) community bank has 8 members.  Its president is Cecilia who is married and has two school-age children.  She works every morning and takes care of her children in the afternoon.  She is a very hard-working person who carries out a cleaning service in a private family home.  She would like to use her loan money to buy some electrical appliances for her own home such as a blender, a DVD player, etc.  She lives in Chacacollo neighborhood.

This group is made up of unassuming and hard-working people whose businesses include making 'chicharón de pollo' (fried chicken), selling bricks and even making bricks.   The group's members are all neighbors who have lived in the same neighborhood for several years.  Each one has their own independent business and they work from Monday to Sunday.  The group's members know each other well and one man participates in their group.  They are all very well known for their respective businesses.  This is a very organized and dynamic community bank.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances such as a blender and a DVD player

loans.name: Safae

texts.en:
Safae is a 28-year-old divorced mother who works hard to fulfill her two children’s needs. She struggles to keep them happy and satisfied with her hard work so that they won't need their dad's help. She lives to keep her children in her warm, loving home and within eyesight.

Safae has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for four years. She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four cycles, and it has been a good experience for her, since the previous loans positively affected her social and financial needs.

Safae is requesting another loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new perfume and cosmetic collections so she will have good and exciting offerings for the summer. She hopes to expand her business and open her own shop instead of going from one place to another to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy new perfume and cosmetic collections

loans.name: Melfe-Ann

texts.en:
Melfe-ann P. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Melfe-ann is married and has five adult children. Melfe-ann owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk food, instant noodles, shampoo, soap, and spices in the local community. Melfe-ann has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2011, Melfe-ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melfe-ann is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food, and beverages. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melfe-ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and four young children who are still attending school. She is from Lebanon. She opened a mini-market in her town in 2009. She sells all types of food products and drinks. She is thankful for her decision to start a new business; it allows her to make a good income. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory. She is intent on further enlarging her business and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with four adult-aged children. She is 51 years old and has had a food-selling business for 20 years.

Monica sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community. She has been in the business for 20 years. Monica is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase more variety of fruits and vegetables like apples, mangoes, cabbages, tomatoes, etc.

In the future, Monica hopes to strengthen her business to make frequent sales and became more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Ronie is 27 years old, married and has one child, an infant. He works on a farm growing corn and earns about PHP 30,000 per season. He is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and seed. His goal is to expand his farm so that he can improve his ability to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for a farm.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La señora Nieves es una señora líder, que trabajo excelente en una banca comunal, ahora trabaja de manera individual ella tiene el negocio de la venta de pantalones de varón en la feria 16 de julio, su puesto es propio , ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos, el mayor de ellos se enfermo de apendicitis y pese a esta situación ella logro salir adelante  con el apoyo de su familia, la señora nieves es muy trabajadora, y solidaria con sus compañeras su meta es sacar profesionales a sus hijos  y tener una casa propia para brindarles mayor comodidad, con el dinero del crédito comprar pantalones al por mayor para esta época de frio, la Sra. Nieves es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nieves is a leader who behaved excellently while in a communal bank.  Now, she’s acting as an individual.  She sells men’s pants at the 16 de Julio market.  She owns her stand.  She lives with her husband and children.  Her eldest got appendicitis and despite this situation she was able to get ahead with help from her family.

Nieves is very hard working and supportive of her companions.  Her goal is to see her children become professionals and to have a house of her own to provide more comfort.  She will use the money from the loan to buy pants at wholesale for this cold season.  Nieves is a hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy pants for the cold season.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 31 years old, is married and has four children: fourteen, twelve, eight and two years old; three go to school. Every month she spends $80 on food, $40 on school fees and $10 on other expenses.

Ny has a motorbike sticker shop with her husband from which they earn $18 a day. She sells her merchandise from home. Ny is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy motorbike stickers and stamps to decorate customers’ motorbikes.

Ny wants to extend her shop and sell at the local market so that she can get more customers. She wants to send her children at least through high school.

loans.use: to buy motorbike stickers and stamps.

loans.name: Esperanza Aurora

texts.es:
Esperanza  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos aúnestudiando y los otros 3 ya son independientes.  Esperanza cuenta con educación primaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos desde  hace ocho años,  su primer préstamo fue  de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de productos de confitería  y panadería.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1300.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de diez sacos de harina, dos cajas de manteca, azúcar, sal y leña, todo ello para la producción de pan.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien también es albañil.  Nos cuenta que vende sus productos en las ferias de la localidad.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the Community Bank “Medalla Milagrosa”, located in the Pomata district, and Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is 53 years old and married with 5 children, two of them are still studying and the other three are independent. Esperanza has a primary education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 8 years.  Her first loan was 300 soles, money that increased business capital from the sale of products in her bakery and cake shop. 

With the new loan of 1300 soles, she will invest in buying ten sacks of flour, two boxes of butter, sugar, salt and firewood, all for the production of bread.
In the business her children help her and her husband who also is a builder.  She tells us that she sells her products in the street market.  

Her dream is to have a good house and for her children to become professionals.  What she likes most about the Community Bank is the ease of the loan and the timeliness.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of flour, two boxes of butter, sugar, salt and firewood

loans.name: Grace Nyabeta

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old, married, and has three children aged between sixteen years old and seven years old. She operates a small retail business selling sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages, kerosene and other items.

Grace has been running this business for two years now. She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil, kerosene and other items to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business into wholesale. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and religious.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and kerosene.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is a determined person and she wants to improve her fish selling business. In the village where she lives, she had numerous competitors in fish vending but according to her, she makes more customers and meets their demand for high quality fish, affordable prices and friendly services.

Basilia is 44 years old and single. She adopted a child whom she is sending to school.

She needs additional capital and that is why she is taking out a loan of P17,000 to buy fish such as milk fish, mud and catfish and chickens to dress and sell in front of her house. In this way she hopes to increase the capacity of sales from her business and boost her profit.

In the future, Basilia would like to obtain enough income to support her adopted child's education. She also wants to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fish and chickens to dress and sell in front of her house.

loans.name: Heidi Jose

texts.es: Heydi José tiene 31 años su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Inicio desde pequeña ya que su mama la llevaba a vender, fue así que ella decidió aprender este medio de vida, tiene un hijo a su cargo de seis años  a quien tiene que proporcionarle educación, alimento y vestimenta. El financiamiento que está solicitando actualmente es para la compra de lápiz labial, brillo, talcos, tratamientos, ropa  interior y perfumes. Heydi tiene varios pedidos por parte de sus clientes por lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Heydi José, age 31, sells cosmetics.  She started when she was little because her mother took Heydi José with her when she went to sell.  That is how she decided to learn this means of making a living.  She has a six year old son under her care, and she has to provide him with an education, food, and clothing.

The loan she is currently requesting is to buy lipstick, lip gloss, powder, treatments, underwear, and perfume.  Heydi has several customer orders, therefore the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, lip gloss, powder, treatments, underwear, and perfume.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 25 y 23 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. meriendas, desD. hace dos años administra el negocio, paga dos empleadas que le ayudan a atenderlo y en ocasiones salen a vender D. forma ambulante.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. carnes, pollo, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal y condimentos, para el negocio, esta compra le ayudara para continuar trabajando y ofreciendo a los clientes ricos menús. 
Su visión es algún día tener un comedor amplio, con capacidad para muchas personas, mejorar su servicio capacitándose en cocina y superarse con su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two children, ages 25 and 23. She sells light meals and has been in business for two years. Maria has two employees who help her and manage the business during those occasions when she goes out to sell on the street.

She is requesting a loan to buy meats, chicken, beans, rice, sugar, salt, and condiments for her business. This purchase will allow her to continue working and offering her rich dishes to her customers. Her vision is to someday have a spacious diner that can accommodate many people. María also hopes to improve her service, take some cooking courses, and excel in her family life.

loans.use: to buy meats, chicken, beans, rice, sugar, salt, and condiments.

loans.name: Gormah

texts.en: Gormah is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is divorced and has seven children between 5 and 18 years old, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past twenty years she has been selling pepper, bitter ball, onion, and soda in the local market. She makes less profit because she has less goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, onion, and soda for her business. She plans to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, onion, and soda for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and blessed with three children all whom attend school. For the last 7 years, she has been practicing poultry farming to earn a living. She has employed four people to help her manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more chicks. Since she decided to join Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access business loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has children.  She works hard to support her family.  Cathy has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from a general store. 

Christine is requesting a loan for 29,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.  This is Christine's fifteenth loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Ericelda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ericelda es un señor de 42 años de edad el cual vive con su esposo e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Ella tiene el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo, que le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Ericelda es un micro crédito de ¢300,000(trescientos mil colones), para comprar productos de limpieza y ropa, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Ericelda es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Ericelda is a 42 year old woman who lives with her husband and children in the community of Osa.  Osa is located in Caña Blancal, in the province of Puntarenas.  The community is known for being a rural area often visited for its beaches.  The major businesses in the area are tourism and agriculture.

Ericleda is supported and helped by her husband, who makes it easier for her to continue with her project.  Besides, he has been very interested in her project since he has seen how, little by little, the business grows, the demand gets greater and greater and the neighbors in the community are quite satisfied with the services Ericleda is offering.

Right now Ericelda is requesting a micro loan of ¢300,000 (USD $600) to purchase cleaning products and clothing and also to maintain her project and give it the most attention possible.

Ericelda is a member of the Caña Blancal Communal Bank, one of the 150 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica.  With this loan, Ericelda hopes to grow on both a personal and financial level.  She also points out that thanks to this type of organizations and aid with the loans, she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to sell cleaning products and clothing.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is married and blessed with one child. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. For the last five years he has been repairing mobile phones and also sells mobile phone spare parts to support his family. In the next five years he wants to expand his business. Gabriel has requested a loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy mobile phone spare parts for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone spare parts.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias al contacto D. una D. las miembros, quien se informó acerca del programa D. la fundación e invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto y quieren seguir con el proyecto.
La Sra. Gladys, es una D. las miembro trabaja en la costura y es confesionista, está casada hace 8 años con  el señor Jorge quien trabaja como Protocolista en el poder judicial. Tienen dos hijos, y nos comenta ella que esos niños son la razón D. ser D. ella y D. su marido, pues es por ellos que trabajan día y noche para darles un futuro mejor al que ellos tuvieron.
La señora Gladys solicita el crédito para la compra D. elementos para su trabajo D. la costura, como ser telas e hijos, cierres, botones y demás. Ella tiene como objetivo ampliar su taller D. costura dentro D. su casa con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members who became aware of the foundation's programs and organized her friends and invited them to be part of the Comite D. Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Enterprising Women]. They are working well and want to continue with their project.

Gladys works as a seamstress. She has been married to Jorge, a Registrar for the justice department, for 8 years. They have 2 children and she says that the children are their reason for being. For them they work day and night, so they can give them a better future than what they had. 

Gladys asks for a loan to buy materials for her sewing work like fabrics, thread, zippers, buttons and other things. Her goal is to increase the size of her workshop insiD. her home so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and other things.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 46 years old with four children aged 14 to 17. She is a widow and she sells foodstuffs in a store that she has run for four years. She would like a loan to buy more cassava, sweet potatoes and beans to sell in her store. Olive would like to use any profits to create savings and solve minor issues for her family. She dreams to have a large stock of inventory and to become a distributor.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Tuzamurane/gknk Group

texts.fr:
Jean Damascène  fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Gknk. Il a 31 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 mois à 5 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de primaire.

Jean Damascène  est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Damascène  voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Damascène belongs to the Tuzamurane/Gknk group.  He is 31 years old and is married with three children ranging from three months to five years of age.  Two children are in school.  He has two years of elementary school education.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.  His strategy to grow his business is to develop selected rice seedlings.  In the coming years, Jean Damascène would like to be the rice supplier in his region.  With the profits, he plans to raise his children and provide them with schooling.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Chepkoech

texts.en:
Chepkoech is a resident and a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya.  She is 20 years old and married with one child, age 3.  

She has been a farmer for 2 years and produces tea and milk for the local market.

Chepkoech has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to venture into poultry farming.  She wants to buy poultry birds.  She adds she will use the income to improve the livelihood of her family buy providing other basic needs.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Juan Camilo a sus 23 años de edad sueña con terminar sus estudios en Tecnología Electrónica, ya que sabe que esta es la herramienta que le permitirá salir adelante,  y superar la difícil situación económica con la que ha crecido.

El trabaja actualmente en el área de mantenimiento en la empresa Ferrinvernaderos en el Carmen de Viboral, y desea mejorar sus ingresos para continuar con sus estudios y más adelante poderse profesionalizar, por lo cual tiene como proyecto comprar una vaca lechera con el préstamo solicitado y sus ahorros personales.

Se destaca por ser una persona muy responsable y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Juan Camilo, who is 23 years old, dreams of finishing his studies in Electronic Technology because he knows this is the tool that will allow him to get ahead and overcome the difficult economic situation in which he has grown up.

He currently works in maintenance for a company called Ferrinvernaderos in Carmen de Viboral, and he wants to increase his income so he can continue his studies and later become a professional. To do this, he will buy a dairy cow with the loan he's asked for and with his personal savings.

Juan Camilo stands out as a very responsible and enterprising person.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Victor; El socio continua con su trabajo como docente en el nivel primario y alternando a esto el socio esta planeando poner una empresa propia en casa y para ello desea tener un capital que le permita montar su empresa por ahora el socio continua con el termino de arreglos de vivienda para lo cual desea el prestamo para concluir con el revestimiento y mejoramiento de sus vivienda.
texts.en: This member is Victor.  He continues working as an elementary school teacher.  He is also planning to set up his own business in his home.  In order to do this, he would like to have some capital which will allow him to set up his business.  For now, he continues repairing his home and would like this loan to finish the refurbishing and improvement of his home.

loans.use: to refurbish and improve his house

loans.name: Kafi's Group

texts.en:
Kafi is a member of this group from Iraq. Kafi is 46 years old widow and has one child. Kafi started her sewing business twenty-five years ago with an old sewing machine to generate enough income to support herself and her child.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy an sewing machine  and renovate her workplace  to help her increase her income.
She aims to open big place for her business and create jobs for other women.
The story of Kafi and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients.
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Kafi's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy sewing machine and renovate her workplace

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
When Jenny was 14 she dropped out of school and started working with plants. She now has her own business that helps her provide for her only son. For more than ten years she has been raising flowers and other plants to sell. She is seeking this loan in order to buy flower pots, fertilizer and seeds. Her dream is to get her highschool degree and begin studying agricultural sciences at a college. She is 25 and is happily married. Her home is currently under construction but should be ready soon.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy flower pots, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta of Alafua makes a beautiful fruit salad which she sells in front of one of the dairies near her home. She is the only one selling vi salad.  Alternatively, she sometimes also makes taro in coconut cream or oka to raise her revenues.  She makes a profit of $250 daily.  This money is used to improve her family’s living standard and conditions as well as pay off her loan from SPBD.

loans.use: The money will go towards purchasing a pot, peeler, bowl, knife, vi, coconuts, and fresh fish.  The loan will also pay for school fees and home improvement.

loans.name: Calasto

texts.en: Calasto is married with two children, both in primary school. He has not undertaken any formal training and is a primary school dropout. His wife is a housewife. He started his business last year in order to sustain his family.  He gets his stock of maize from the cereals board and sells it to the locals at a higher profit. With a loan from PEMCI, he intends to increase his stock of maize. He also grinds all sorts of grain flour at a small fee to the locals. Through his business, he has been able to support his family and buy himself a few goats to keep.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina S. S. is a single mother of four: Emiar de Sanchez (15), Adyes (14), Roselin de Sanchez (13), Samira de Sanchez (11). With this loan she is hoping to open up a chicken farm and restaurant. However, she does not feel that it would be beneficial to her to sell the food in her town and so she is hoping to expand her market to a larger nearby town. She is hoping that in the future she will be able to have her own small restaurant and be able to provide a better life for her four children, because at the current time she is struggling to provide basic care for all of them.

NOTE: Alina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and cooking supplies

loans.name: Tabiah

texts.id:
Living as a widow doesn't discourage Tabiah to work hard to support her life. Her husband died from a sickness 5 years ago. Now she lives with her son, Supianto, a second-year STM (high school with specialization in technician work) student, in a very simple house with cement floor and bamboo wall. Tabiah starts traveling around to sell the merchandise from 5 pm to 2 am. In the morning, she prepares the merchandise to be sold while doing her house work. In the beginning, she had $32 as the initial capital and earned only very little profit of $1.6 per night. The profit also has to be spent for her daily expenses and her son's education. After she receives the loan from DINARI, she can improve her profit to $5 per night. With the increased profit, she can save a little of the profit now.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup tanpa suami tidak menyurutkan semangat Tabiah untuk bekerja memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Suaminya sudah meninggal 5 tahun yang lalu karena sakit. Sekarang dia tinggal dirumahnya yang sangat sederhana dengan lantai semen dan dinding gedek ditemani oleh seoranng anaknya , Supianto, yang sekarang duduk di bangku STM kelas 2. Tabiah menjajakan jualannya mulai pukul 5 sore sampai pukul 2 dini hari, sedangkan paginya ia melakukan persiapan untuk jualannya sambil mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah tangga. Awal mula Tabiah hanya bermodalkan Rp. 300.000.- dan hanya mendapat sedikit keuntungan yakni Rp. 15.000.- per malam. Keuntungan itu pun harus disisihkan untuk biaya hidup dan uang sekolah anaknya. Namun setelah mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI, Tabiah sudah mampu mengembangkan usahanya dengan menambah jumlah dagangannya sehingga Tabiah mampu meningkatkan keuntungannya menjadi Rp. 50.000.- semalam. Dengan keuntungan itu, kini Tabiah dapat menyisihkan sedikit dari keuntungannya untuk ditabung.

loans.use: To buy merchandises such as cigarettes, snacks, beverages, etc

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Sr. Ignacio R., 60, and his wife, Sra. Marcelina Bogado, have three grown children who live with them and help with their father's business. Ignacio is both a merchant and a farmer. He has a farm in Encarnacion, a city 200 kilometers from Ciudad del Este. He cultivates soy beans when conditions allow but it's not an easy business because prices aren't stable and because this area of the country is constantly plagued by drought.

Ignacio decided to open a store to ensure an income for his household but he's still farming. During the planting season, he goes up to Encarnacion, leaving the business in the hands of his wife and children. Ignacio is a dynamic, enterprising man with the drive to get ahead. He's applying for a loan so that he can buy products like flour, milk, fruit, produce, pasta, sugar, etc. for the store at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Ignacio Rodríguez tiene 60 años, casado con la señora Marcelina Bogado, tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que viven con ellos y ayudan con los negocios del padre. El señor Ignacio es comerciante y agricultor a la vez, tiene una finca en Encarnación una ciudad que dista 200 Km. de Ciudad del Este. En esa finca cultiva soja de forma temporal debido a la inestabilidad de los precios y la sequía que azota constantemente en esa zona del país.

Ignacio decidió abrir una despensa, para asegurar los ingresos de la casa, aunque aún sigue cultivando soja en su finca. En las épocas de cosecha, Ignacio viaja hasta Encarnación dejando el negocio a cargo de su esposa e hijos. Ignacio es una persona dinámica, emprendedora y con ganas de superación. El crédito solicitado lo desea invertir en la compra al por mayor de mercaderías para la despensa, tales como harina, leche, frutas, verduras, productos enlatados, fideos, azúcar, etc.

loans.use: Buy flour, milk, fruit, produce, pasta, sugar, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Chjioma

texts.en: Chioma A. is a mother of 3, 35 years of age, and hails from Lagos State. She sells drugs and provisions in her pharmacy. She has been in her business since the year 2002 and needs a loan of $875 to buy more drugs and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy drugs (pharmaceuticals) and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Munnawer's Group

texts.en: I am Munnawer B. from the small town of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I am married and have a daughter who is one and half years old. My husband repairs electronics and I embroider clothes for the women in my neighborhood. My husband would like to expand his business, and we're asking for a loan for that purpose. He has been in this business for many years. My group members are: Shamshad B. runs an embroidery business. Bano B. needs a loan for her son’s electronics store. Suriya B. will buy an electric sewing machine for her embroidery business. Enayat B. needs a loan for their second-hand store. These members are very cooperative and are honest in their dealings.

loans.use: Expand electronics store

loans.name: Gulasmar

texts.en: Gulasmar (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 3 children. She was born in 1968. She has been in this business for 4 years. The Seyidov family needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow to improve their business and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
“I have some unfinished construction on the front of my home which I had to abandon due to health problems and incurred expenses. Now, thank God, I am perfectly healthy and I need to finish expanding my home.” I am asking for $1200 to finish the construction of a room on my home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar enfrente de mi vivienda la cual tuve que detener debido a que tuve problemas de salud y realice algunos gastos, ahora gracias a dios ya estoy perfectamente bien y necesito terminar la ampliación de mi vivienda” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar la ampliación de un cuarto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Finish construction on home expansion

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
In spite of her young age, 31 years old Erica has become a successful micro entrepreneur. For 15 years she has been manufacturing, selling and even exporting bijouterie. She learned the craft as a teenager, helping her uncle elaborate jewelry.

From the beginning she was receiving orders from different clients. When she first got an order from a US client, she decided to start exporting every time she had the chance. She has supplied big jewelry stores and renowned department stores.

She splits her profits between reinvestment in her business and maintenance of her home, as she is the single mother of two small children. She would like to receive training, in order to make her business grow and continue exporting.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

A pesar de ser muy joven, Erica, a sus 31 años, se ha convertido en una exitosa microempresaria. Hace quince años que produce, vende e incluso exporta bijouteria. Para ella todo empezó cuando aún era una adolescente. Ayudando a su tío a confeccionar joyas fue aprendiendo el oficio.

Desde un inicio ella producía para diversos clientes quienes le hacían pedidos. Lo mejor fue cuando recibió un pedido de un cliente norteamericano. A raíz de eso, ella decidió empezar a exportar cada vez que tenía una oportunidad. Ella ha llegado a ser proveedora de tiendas grandes de joyas y de tiendas por departamentos conocidas.

Ella reparte sus ganancias en la reinversión y en el mantenimiento de su hogar, pues debe ser madre y padre de dos hijos menores. Lo que ella quisiera es recibir capacitación para crecer en su empresa y poder seguir exportando.

loans.use: Receive training for her business.

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
Señora Ligia is 38-years-old. She lives in Laureles Sur. She is single and has three children, who are 2, 10, and 15. Her business is a grocery store, and she has 7 years of experience. She started her business with her own funds and with help from her family. Her daughters help her to wait on customers, and together they break barriers and myths to get ahead.

She would like this loan to invest more in her grocery store, to have more to offer her customers, and to satisfy basic needs. In the future, she would like her kids to better themselves and become professionals so they can have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Ligia tiene 38 años de edad, vive el los Laureles Sur, es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 2, 10, y 15 años. El negocio es una pulpería, y tiene siete años de experiencia, y su negocio lo comenzó con sus propios fondo y ayuda familiar, sus hijas le ayudan a despachar y juntas van rompiendo barreras y mitos para salir adelante.

El préstamo lo quiere par invertir mas en la pulpería, y así tener mas que ofrecer a sus clientes y sastifacer las necesidades básicas. A futuro es que sus hijos puedan superarse que sean personas profesionales para que tengan un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Purchase of products for her grocery store

loans.name: Biodun

texts.en: Mrs Biodun M. lives in Shibiri Ekunpa, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, books and drinks, a skill that she acquired over 2 years. She has been in this business since 1993. Biodun is 33 years old and is married with 4 children. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more shoes, clothes, books and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, clothes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Kwanba Martine

texts.fr:
Miss Kwanba Martine S. was born on October 10th, 1975 in Lomé. She is divorced and has three children. Her primary activity is clothing sales in the Adidogomé area of Lomé. She is a traveling saleswoman who sells from one neighborhood to the next, covering on average 10 kilometers per day on foot.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase four clothing bundles.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle S. Kwanba Martine est née le 10 octobre 1975 à Lomé. Elle a trois enfants et est une femme divorcée. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de friperie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé.
