Elle est une revendeuse ambulant qui vend de quartier en quartier et parcourt en moyenne une distance de 10 Km à pieds par jour.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 4 ballots de friperie.

loans.use: Purchase of 4 clothing bundles

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria O. is 41 years old and is married with six children.  She lives in Benin City, in the Edo state of Nigeria.  Maria has been in the business of soap production for over six years, and is now a successful producer and distributor of soaps in her community.  In order to further expand her business and attract more customers, Maria needs a loan of $1,200, which will be used to purchase key ingredients for making soap.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making soap.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou C., age 22, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. In the village, she is one of the vendors selling various kinds of vegetables and groceries at an open-air stall to earn a living. She is able to make around US$ 2 in profit per day. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver since 2000 and can make US$ 3 in profit per day.

Mrs Bou would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to expand her grocery inventory in order to meet her customers' demands. Most poor entrepreneurs especially live in the provinces and they normally earn a living by working as farmers, raising animals, or running a motor-taxi. That is why most of the loans from Credit are agricultural loans.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory for her little stall

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Florinda B. Alfonso tiene 61 años y es soltera. Tiene hijos mayores que ya son independiente, tiene una peluqueria que ella misma atiende.

La sra. Florinda se dedica en el rubro hace 7 años , empezo con un local prestado por una amiga suya, despues de varios cursos y especializaciones logro actualizarse y formar una clientela satisfecha por sus servicios. Cuenta tambien que despues de un tiempo corto logro independizarse y ya alquilar su propio local. Con sus primeras ganancias logro adquirir maquinarias y articulos para equipar su peluqueria.

La sra. Florinda desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de nuevos articulos y maquinarias ya que las que tiene perdieron su vida util, la demanda de clietnes y la competencia les exige dicha inversion para satisfacer al 100% de sus clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Florinda B. Alfonso is 61 years old and single. Her children are older and are now independent. She has a hair salon that she runs herself.

Florinda has been doing this work for seven years. She started with a locale loaned to her by a friend. After several courses and specializations she was up to date and established a clientele that was satisfied by her services. She also tells us that after a short time she was able to become independent and now rents her own space. With her first earnings she was able to buy the equipment needed for the salon.

Florinda wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of new items and equipment because the ones that she has are no longer useful. The demand of her clients and the competition requires that she make this investment to be able to satisfy 100% of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new equipment for a hair salon

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción inició el negocio porque ya no alcanzaba con los ingresos de su esposo para los gastos de la casa, ya que al ir creciendo los hijos los costos para que pudieran estudiar cada vez eran mayores y su esposo solo, no podía solventarlos. Comenzó hace más de un año dedicándose a la venta de productos de limpieza y empezó invirtiendo $300 y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder incrementar sus ventas
texts.en:
Concepción started her business because her husband's income no longer covered the household expenses. As their children are growing, the costs to allow them to study kept increasing and her husband alone could not afford them. She started more than a year ago selling cleaning products. She started by investing $300 and little by little she grew her business.

She needs a loan of $450 that she will repay in 6 months to buy merchandise and, that way, be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rizvan

texts.en: Rizvan lives in Baku city. He was born in 1980. This single man has three years of experience in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fruits and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank. She is 48 years old and married with three children. She travels to different regional markets twice a week to buy grains and animals (such as cows, pigs and goats) to bring to the city of Ayacucho. There, she resells the items at the San Juan Bautista Market.  

Sabina is requesting a loan of 1600 soles to buy animals.  Sabina’s dreams are to increase her investment capital, to improve her business, and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase animals to increase her sales inventory at the San Juan Batista Market

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Madame M. Yawa vend des pagnes et des produits de beauté à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  Elle a commencé ce travail depuis 1999, et le commerce va bien parce qu’il y a toujours une demande pour ces choses.  Avec ce premier crédit,  Madame M. va acheter 11 pièces de pagnes afin de mieux servir ses clients.  

Elle a 38 ans, elle est célibataire et elle a une enfant qui elle soutient avec le revenu de son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Yawa M. sell "pagnes" and beauty products in Agoè, a district north of Lomé. She started this business in 1999, and it is doing well because there is always a demand for these things. With this initial loan, she is going to buy 11 lengths of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to serve her customers better. Ms. M. is 38 years old, unmarried, and has a child who she support with the income from her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza vive  en casa de su tía con su esposo y sus dos hijos pequeños. Se dedica a la venta de quesos y truchas, viaja los días jueves de cada semana a su pueblo natal donde adquiere toda su mercadería para luego ofrecer sus productos a los puestos del mercado o también a sus clientes de forma particular de forma ambulante en el mercado, Maritza utiliza grandes baldes que son sus principales herramientas de trabajo donde transporte sus quesos y pescados. De esta manera garantiza los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, aunque su trabajo es cansado por las largas horas que camina con el peso de sus baldes, ella seguirá con este negocio y tiene miras a seguir creciendo, y este ímpetu de progreso lo demuestra también en la producción de tejidos en estilo crochet, los cuales envía a una de sus tías a la ciudad de Lima para venderlos. Es la segunda vez que Maritza está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, en la primera ocasión demostró ser responsable en sus pagos y luego voluntariamente se retiró, pero regresó para trabajar y fue admitida nuevamente por ser una de las socias de su banco comunal que demuestra ser unida y solidaria. Maritza solicita este dinero para abastecerse de mayor mercadería y aprovechar que en esta época del año presenta mayor cantidad en ventas, con el monto que solicita podrá adquirir 100 quesos que están valorizados en 150 soles y con la otra mitad comprara 18 kilos de trucha.
texts.en:
Maritza lives in her aunt's house with her husband and their two small children. She earns a living by selling cheeses and trout. She travels every Thursday to her home town where she acquires all her goods to then sell to vendors and also to individual clients through street or market sales. Maritza uses large buckets as her principal work tools, and in the buckets she transports her cheeses and fish. Through this work she ensures the necessary income for her home. Although her work is tiring due to the long hours that she walks with the heavy buckets, she will continue with this business and with a view towards continuing to grow. She also demonstrates this drive for progress in her crochet works, which she sends to one of her aunts in the city of Lima to be sold. This is the second time that Maritza is requesting a loan through MFP; the first time she proved herself to be responsible with her payments and then later withdrew [from the program]. But she returned to work and was admitted again as one of the members of her communal bank, showing her unity and solidarity. Maritza is requesting this money to increase her inventory with more goods and take advantage of the greater sales at this time of year. With the funds she is requesting she will be able to acquire 100 cheeses which will cost 150 soles, and with the other half she will buy 18 kilos of trout.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her sales inventory

loans.name: Abdurakip

texts.en:
Abdurakip M. is 40 years old. He is married with four children, and the eldest is in second grade. Abdurakip comes from a very humble family. Starting from a young age, Abdurakip worked with his parents beginning early in the morning, to produce cottonseed oil. Now, Abdurakip works with his children in their oil-producing business.

On average he produces 15-20 liters oil which costs 4 USD per liter. Now Abdurakip hopes to increase their oil sales in order for their business to advance further. He is in need of this loan in order to expand his business and speed up their production and improve the quality of their products.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding the family business

loans.name: Hatanbaatar

texts.en:
Hatanbaatar Tuvshibayar lives with his wife and a three year old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their son goes to kindergarten.  The photo is of his wife, Munhsarnay at their family business.

With his wife, Hatanbaatar took over his parents' small fresh-vegetable retail business, in a food market in Sharhad, one of the most remote areas of Ulaanbaatar.  They have requested a loan to buy more vegetables and other food products.

Hatanbaatar always wanted an apartment with hot running water before his son was born.  Although it did not come true, he hopes to one day be able to afford an apartment for his family.  His wife, Munhsarnay dreams of running a bakery shop to increase the family income.

loans.use: Buy more vegetables and other food products.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia N. is forty-four years old and married with three children. Two of them are currently in senior high school while the others are in junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in their home in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Felicia is a seamstress by profession. She owns a workshop in the market square. She sews ladies’ dresses for sale and also sews for clients who come with their own materials and place an order. She purchases all kinds of fabrics from fashion shops in the big cities. She has apprentices who are in training, a number of whom have graduated and are now running their own businesses. Felicia has been in this business for twenty years and has won many customers over the years. She wants a loan to buy sewing accessories and fabrics in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing accessories

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Madame Antoinette T. est une commerçante Sénégalaise qui sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son entreprise de commerce.  Avec ce crédit elle va acheter sept rouleaux de bassins, de la teinture, et de la couture pour les revendre a Thiès, Sénégal, la ville ou elle habite.  Elle va aussi payer le transport pour acheter la marchandise.  Elle a déjà reçu trois crédits auprès de l’IMCEC depuis 2004, et elle a tout bien remboursé.  Madame T. travaille aussi à la pharmacie, et elle a des revenus supplémentaires avec son entreprise.  Elle est âgée de 37 ans et elle est mariée.  Elle va utiliser les revenus de son entreprise pour aider dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Antoinette T. is a Senegalese merchant who is requesting a loan to bolster her commercial enterprise. With this loan, she's going to buy seven rolls of damask fabrics, dyes, and sewing supplies to resell in Thiès, Senegal, the city in which she lives. She's also going to pay for the transportation for buying her merchandise. She has had three loans from IMCEC since 2004, and she repaid them all. Ms. T. also works at the pharmacy, and she has additional revenues from her enterprise. She is 37 years old and married. She's going to use her revenues to help cover day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, dyes, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Alassane A. est revendeur de vêtements à Womé, un village situé à environ 140 kilomètres de Lomé. Agé de 43 ans, il est marié et père de 2 garçons. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 6 ans. Alassane souhaite avec ce troisième crédit, augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Alassane est n bon client car les emprunts qu’il a contractés sont remboursés à temps sans retard. Il est dans la photo avec une cliente.
texts.en:
Alassane A. resells clothes in Womé, a village located approximately 140 kilometers from Lomé. He's 43 years old, married, and the father of two boys. He's been running his business for 6 years. Alassane wishes to use this third loan to bolster his business. Alassane is a good client since his previous loans were repaid on time. He's seen in the photograph with one customer.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell clothes

loans.name: Rubi Muhammad Shahzad Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches and switchboards) for her electric supplies selling business. 
Kosar baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell.

Rubi baji is the group leader for these above-mentioned ladies. They all are very hardworking ladies. She runs her sewing clothes business to pay off the utilities of her house. Rubi baji is married to M. S. who is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He does not own his rickshaw. That’s why he earns only half of the fare. Rubi baji has saved some money from her sewing clothes business. She is lacking Pak rupees 10,000+/- so she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband so that he can get the whole fare.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: A. David

texts.fr:
K. A. David est né vers 1984 à Avrankou dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Mais David réside avec sa famille dans à Amouloko dans la Commune d'Akpro-Missérété. David est en effet père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. 

David a comme activité principale la couture. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus David fait en plus de l'élevage. Pour mieux servir sa clientèle, David a besoin de plus de matériels de couture. C’est pourquoi David sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. A. David was born around 1984 in Avrankou in Ouémé County. But he resides with his family in Amouloko, in the community of Akpro-Missérété. He is actually a father of two children who are both in school. David is principally a tailor. To diversify his revenue sources, he also raises livestock. To serve his customers better, he has need of more sewing supplies and equipment. This is why he's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an overcasting machine and some sewing supplies

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Luias M. tiene ya más de siete años dedicándose a la venta de comida preparada. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más espacio donde poner mesas y sillas para que los clientes puedan consumir sus alimentos más cómodos. 
Pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el mobiliario y ampliar el negocio, y no quiere descapitalizarse su ingreso, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hijo quien le ayuda atender el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Luias M. has been selling prepared food for over seven years. The business needs more space for tables and chairs so that her customers can eat more comfortably. But, she does not currently have the money that is necessary to be able to buy the furniture and expand her business. She does not want to under capitalize her income. That is why she is asking for this loan. The person in the photo is her son; he helps her take care of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture and expand her business

loans.name: Samit

texts.en: Mrs. Samit Y. lives in Doem Pou village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed to grow on the field, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed.  She would use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer to secure a more productive crop. Her husband, Mr. Nak Phoeun, transports passengers with a horse and cart. Mrs. Samit Y. is thirty-two years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. is from the town of Jimenez. She is 33 years old. Gina is married. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a snack vending business, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Gina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Jose Dario

texts.es: Don Josè Dario, es casado, tiene un niño de 8 años de edad estudiando la primaria, esta solicitando el segundo crèdito con el fondo kiva, para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio pùlperia comprando productos varios y asì poder aumentar su inventario para satisfaser la demanda de los clientes de la comunidad, con su pequeña pulperia ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia pues es con los ingresos que le quedan de esta que les da el sustento diario, ademàs de la pulperia posee un pequeña parcelara donde obtiene otros ingresos de la comercializaciòn de venta de productos de la finca, tambièn se dedica a la actividad de engorde de cerdo; Josè Darìo se caracteriza por ser responsable con los compromisos que adquiere,  ha cumplido siempre con el plan de pago, es un excelente cliente, lider de la comunidad, èl tiene pricipio religioso.
texts.en:
José Dario is married and has an eight year old son who is in elementary school. He is asking for his second loan with Kiva to invest in his small mini market. He will buy various products to increase his inventory to satisfy the demand of the customers in his community. With his small store he has been able to get ahead with his family. The income from the store gives them their daily sustenance. In addition to the mini market, he has a small parcel of land where he gets other income from selling the farm products. Also, he fattens pigs. José Dario is responsible about his commitments. He has always completed his payment plan. He is an excellent client, community leader, and a man who possesses religious principles.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita A. is from the city of Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Amelita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Amelita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Amelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is a 40-year-old man who lives and works in Hebron, Palestine.  He is the father of 6 children.  In order to support himself and his family, Zaki runs a grocery store.  He is requesting a loan of $2500 so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.  He is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es: Lidia Marina C. reside en el departamento de La Paz. Lidia tiene 44 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su dos hijos Wilfredo de 22 años de edad, quien es empleado y Claudia de 19 años de edad, estudiante de bachillerato. Lidia es una persona muy trabajadora y alegre, maneja su negocio con gran entusiasmo, ella posee una venta de tortillas y pupusas desde la cochera de su casa, donde sus ventas son estables, el crédito que solicita ahora Lidia es para poder incrementar la producción de sus productos, pero para ello necesita comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima.
texts.en:
Lidia Marina C. lives in the department of La Paz. She is 44 years old and lives with her two children: Wilfred, 22, is employed, and Claudia, 19, is a student.

Lidia makes and sells tortillas and pupusas in the garage of her home. She is hardworking and cheerful, and manages her business with great enthusiasm. This loan is for the purchase of larger quantities of wholesale foods, which will allow her to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale foods for making tortillas and pupusas

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme  a commencé en 2000 le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante  ce qui lui permet de toucher un plus grand nombre de clients.  La demande actuelle de ses clients est élevée et le peu de stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de pouvoir  les satisfaire  raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de pommades, 5 sachets de chouchoux,  2 petits cartons de rouge à lèvre.
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started doing commerce in cosmetics in 2000.  She sells from place to place, and this enables her to reach a greater number of customers.  The current demand from her customers is high, and the little merchandise she has will not allow her to satisfy it.  And so, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 2 boxes of ointments, 5 packets of scrunchies, and 2 small boxes of lipstick.  She is married and the mother of three children.  With the revenues from her commerce, she helps to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ointments, scrunchies, boxes of lipstick, and various other goods

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia MARITZA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos varones. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una broasteria donde prepara platos como: pollipapas, salchipapas y pollo broaster. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para abrir una cabina de internet va implementarla comprando computadoras, monitores y accesorios,  así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the Llankachinapac Communal Bank. She is 31, in a common law marriage, and has two sons. She and her sons live in the Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She has a restaurant where she makes dishes like “pollipapas” (typical dish made with fried sausage, potatoes, and chicken), “salchipapas” (typical dish made from fried sausage and potatoes), and roasted chicken. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who wants to get her children ahead. She needs a loan to open an Internet cafe. She is going to equip it by purchasing computers, monitors, and accessories. That way she will be able to increase her business capital, have better income, and give her children a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open an Internet cafe and equip it by purchasing computers, monitors, and accessories

loans.name: Jamyikan's Group

texts.en:
Jamyikan is a widow. She is sixty three years old. Jamyikan lives in a city of Balykchi. After her husband’s death, Jamyikan has been living alone as her children are grown-ups and live separately.

Most people of Jamyikan’s age after becoming grandparents prefer to live in their children’s homes. Jamyikan as well, could easily live at her children’s expense. But, Jamyikan has never asked her children for help. She does not depend on her children. Moreover, at many times she helps her daughter financially and always cares about her children.

To make a living Jamyikan trades in dishes. She purchases different kinds of dishes: ceramic dishes, dinner sets and porcelain.

Jamyikan is an experienced businesswoman. She used to trade in various convenience goods as long ago as when she was young. Then she applied for a job and started to work for Government. After the retirement, the pension appeared to be too little to sustain a decent living. So Jamyikan did not hesitate and invested all her early savings, about 70$ in purchasing dishes. She returned to her former occupation of trade.

Now, she cannot afford a big scale trade. Nevertheless, her engagement brings her a stable income of 65-75$ each month. Jamyikan has applied for this loan to invest it in purchasing different kinds of dinner sets, porcelain, etc. as the New Year is approaching, when many people organize grand arrangements, feasts and buy dishes as New Year’s gifts. Jamyikan has three partners:
Mairamkul, 53, is a widow and has a son. She sells women’s clothes and hosiery. Her monthly income is around 45$. Mairamkul needs a loan to purchase winter clothes for sale.

Raisa, 38, has four children. Her husband works as a driver. To support her family, Raisa trades in silver and gold. She hopes to obtain this loan and import silver from Turkey and India.

Anarkan, 46, is divorced. She has a retired mother and an unemployed sister. Anarkan works as a seller in a bookstore. Anarkan’s salary, is just 12$ a month. Her mother's pension is 80$. Anarkan needs a loan to buy a calf.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment).

It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy dinner sets to sell for people for New Year parties

loans.name: Usuese

texts.en:
Usuese K. is 37 and married with 5 children (ages 4 - 17).  She owns a business venture, selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains).  Usuese  has many years of experience in this business.  Usuese  needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Usuese  joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Usuese 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Usuese K. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.6 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD : http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie and jean material

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en: Zinabu I. is married, has two children and has received a junior high school education. For the last several years, she has made a living cooking and selling rice and beans at Elmina. Her husband makes a living as a poultry farmer.  Zinabu uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to buy more beans, rice, oil and other items to sell. With the new profits made possible by this loan, Zinabu plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, oil and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Tomasito

texts.es:
Tomasito tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío San Pablo Escurre, del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga en su moto carguera, usualmente carga fruta, leña o ganado por los diversos caseríos de Olmos. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad, tanto para el como para sus clientes, ya que le provee los ingresos que necesita para solventar sus gastos personales y a la vez ayuda a sus vecinos a solucionar sus problemas de transporte, ya que la mayoría de caseríos del distrito quedan muy alejados uno del otro y no cuentan con movilidad estable.

El contínuo uso brindado a su vehículo y los accidentados caminos que tiene que recorrer a diario han hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Tomasito es un joven trabajador y muy responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos lo estiman mucho y lo consideran una persona que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Tomasito is 30 years old and single. He lives together with his parents in the small village of San Pablo Escurre in the Olmos district which is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For a living, he runs a delivery service. Usually he hauls fruit or wool or livestock to the various villages in Olmos. This business is very useful both for him and for his customers. The business provides the income needed to pay for his personal expenditures and also helps his neighbors solve their shipping problems as the majority of the villages in the district are located far away from each other and are not connected by regular transportation. Regular use on rugged roads has resulted in his only vehicle requiring several urgent repairs. It is for this reason that he has needed to solicit his first loan from Edpyme Alternative. He is asking for 1500 Nuevos soles in order to repair and maintain his vehicle. Tomasito is a hard working, responsible young man. His neighbors and acquaintances admire him greatly and consider him a person who is always there to help when it is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs to repair and maintain a delivery vehicle

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie D. is a 62-year-old, married woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Madame D. sells and resells peanut oil. This loan allows her to buy 300 liters of peanut oil. The revenues from reselling it in the market help her improve the health conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase peanut oil

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly tiene de 53 años,  es casada, y tiene tres hijos, siendo los dos mayores independientes y con familias, quedándose con el último, quien junto a su esposo viven en su casa que es propia. Desde hace mucho años se dedicaba a la venta de pescados  y mariscos, negocio que le ha ido bien, sin embargo cayó enferma, dejando así éste negocio. Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzados en el mercado de su barrio, por lo que ya lleva 7 años en esta actividad. Poco a poco fue ganando clientela,  dando como resultado buena ganancias, debido a la diversidad de prendas que posee. Es así que desde las 11.00am  de la mañana hasta las 3.00pm de la tarde, trabaja sin parar, y en donde su hijo la apoya los fines de semana. Ella está muy contenta con lo que hace, ya que esto le servirá de sostén para su familia y por ello desea en el futuro ampliar su negocio, para generarle más ganancias. Este será su 24 crédito con MFP, a la vez dice sentirse cómoda con los miembros de su grupo comunal por ser personas muy responsables. Entretanto con el crédito que solicita, comprará zapatos para colegiales, por estar en temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Merly, 53, is married and has three children, two of whom are married and independent. She lives with a daughter and son-in-law in a house that she owns. For many years, Merly operated a business selling fish and other seafood, a business that she knows well but had to leave when she became ill. For the past 7 years, she's made a living in her local market selling clothing and footwear. Little by little, she's built a customer base. Her earnings have climbed because she can offer a wide variety of merchandise. She works non-stop from 11:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon. Her son helps her on weekends. She is very happy with the business because it has helped to support her family and, in the future, she wants to expand it and increase her income even more. This will be her 24th MFP loan. She says that she is very comfortable with the other members of her community bank because she considers them responsible. She will use the loan to buy school shoes for the new school year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar P. S. is from the village of Brgy.Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 59 years old. Oscar is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Oscar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP during harvesting season.

In 2007, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Oscar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Nevaditas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal NEVADITAS. Se agruparon hace 4 años aproximadamente, por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita fortalecer sus negocios.

Una de las integrantes es Carmen A. de 29 años desde hace 5 años se dedica a la costura de chamarras tratando siempre de mejorar su productos y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen variaos actividades económicas como la venta de productos lácteos, costura de deportivos, venta de comida (pitzza y salteñas), venta de carne, ropa, masitas yt ienda de ferretería.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Nevaditas” (Light Snowfalls) meets every two weeks at the Exaltación Community Center. This group was started approximately four years ago as a result of the need to acquire capital to strengthen their businesses.

One of the members is Carmen A., who is 29 years old and has been manufacturing jackets for the past five years. She is always trying to improve her products and needs a loan to buy raw materials.

The other members of this group have different business activities such as selling dairy products, manufacturing sportswear, selling food (pizza and turnovers), selling clothing, selling snacks, and managing a hardware store.

They all need this loan to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making jackets

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is 32-year-old lady from a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living in it for the last 15 years. She has given birth to six children, four daughters and two sons. She has enrolled all of her kids into school because she wants to raise them with a good education so they can make their future bright. 

Her husband's name is M. H. and he is a motor mechanic who can repair every type of vehicle. He was just 15 years old when he started learning this work and he became an expert in it. 

Sugran has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for the third time to purchase tools for her husband so he can better perform his work and earn more.

loans.use: Purchase tools to repair vehicles

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak C., 29, (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Yem, 28, have been married for five years and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Vannak has been a tailor since 1998 and runs a tailoring shop at her home. Her husband is a farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller for her husband

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
This loan is requested by a group of nine people located in Veal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sim C. has been selected as the group leader by the other members of the group. While the entire group is responsible for the total loan, each member will use a portion of it for a different purpose. 
 
Mrs. Sim C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds pigs at her home in order to provide for her family. In order to support her pig breeding business, Mrs. Sim C. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. Mrs. Sim C. is a widow with four children; three are laborers and one is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Cloaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”;  El socio vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

El socio es ÉL Sr. Cloaldo;   él tiene 65 años de edad, El socio es casado y es natural de la ciudad blanca de Arequipa; El socio tiene 4 hijos, todos los hijos son independientes y el tiene una tienda de abarrotes junto a su esposa en la cúal ellos trabajan desde hace 6 años, El socio disfruta mucho de atender la tienda de abarrotes mientras la esposa cocina y luego juntos atiende mientras se relajan viendo televisión en su negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos e implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "THREE MARIAS" communal bank. The associate lives in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The associate is Señor Cloaldo. He is 65 years of age. The associate is married and he is a native of the white city of Arequipa. The associate has 4 children. All the children are independent and he has a convenience store that he runs with the help of his wife. They have run the store for 6 years. The associate enjoys tending the convenience store while his wife cooks, and later they tend the store together while they relax watching the television in their business. The associate requests a loan to buy products for his convenience store. The associate very much appreciates the loan offered since this permits him to grow his business and to improve his quality of life. He promises to comply with the payment schedule stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his convenience store

loans.name: Malama

texts.en: Malama F. is 36 and married with three children. She owns a business venture of planting and harvesting taro for sale. Malama has many years of experience in this business. Malama needs a loan of 1,000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or about $208 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2010, Malama joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Malama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Hawa Gull Group.

texts.en:
Hawa G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Hawa G. Group'. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children who range from 16 to 20 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For more than 18 years, she has been selling rice, onions, peppers, palm oil, and beans in Joe Bar Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 20,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 66,250 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of  rice, onions, peppers, palm oil, and beans. She describes herself as a devoted and serviceable woman. Her goal is to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of  rice, onions, peppers, palm oil, and beans

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a member of the Embande Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years. His farm produces maize, milk, tea, beans and sorghum, which he sells to the local market. He is also a driver with a Public Service Vehicle.

Jeremiah has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says that the income derived from this loan will improve the living standards of the family and pay school fees for his children. However, he faces the challenge of animal diseases.

Jeremiah is 48 years old. He is married and has six children who are between the ages of 1 and 15. Four of the children are attending school. 

Jeremiah would like to buy more agricultural land in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Veronica Mbose

texts.en:
Veronica is 32 years old and married with two children. Her spouse is employed. Veronica has been selling charcoal for a period of three years now with a monthly profit of about 32,000 Kenya Shillings.

This is her first loan with Kadet and with the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal for resale. With the profit accumulated she intends to boost the business and pay school fees to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry (truck) for transporting charcoal to small-scale traders.

loans.use: Buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Lemon

texts.en: Lemon Q. is from the village of Lowerdad, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old, married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Lemon owns and operates a business buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Lemon has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Lemon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lemon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Lemon is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lemon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Clariza Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora S. C. anteriormente tenía venta de comida a parte de un taxi que también ella posee y que lo anda su hijo, ella dejo de hacer momentáneamente la comida debido a la situación económica que esta dura y no le resulta por eso ahorita ella está invirtiendo mas en el taxi, con esto logra mantenerse ella y un hijo que tiene que es el que le ayuda, solicita un crédito con CEPRODEL para la compra de llantas y parches para el taxi y de esta forma no perder el único sustento que tiene.
texts.en: Mrs. S. C. used to sell food.  She also owns a taxi that her son drives.  She has temporarily stopped selling food because of the economic situation, which makes it difficult and she is not making sales, so for the time being she is investing more into her taxi.  This way she is able to support herself and her son, who helps her.  She is asking for this loan through CEPRODEL so that she can buy tires and patches for the taxi, so that she will not lose her only means of support.

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "CRISTO CAMPESINO"; la socia vive en el distrito de Huacaytaqui y provincia de Quispicabchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina: ella tiene 40 años de edad ella es separada y tiene 2 menores hijos la socia se dedica a atender su tienda abarrotes, ella trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de abarrotes como por ejemplo, arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceites y otros productos, la socia compra cada cierto tiempo mercadería para implementar su negocio, ella está en espera de un nuevo crédito para comprar los productos de primera necesidad. La socia vive en Huacaytaqui y en esta comunidad, no se tiene mayor número en tiendas abarrotes que solo 4 tiendas en toda la comunidad y ella tiene mayor productos, es por eso que requiere implementar su tienda para abastecer al poblado preciosos en el cual ella a elegido quedarse a vivir y hacer patria como ella misma lo manifiesta.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahinco para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicentina is a member of the community bank "CRISTO CAMPESINO"; she lives in the district of Huacaytaqui, province of Quispicabchis, in the district of Cusco. She is 40 years old and separated with two minor children. She runs her own grocery store, where she sells all kinds of groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oils and other products. From time to time she needs to restock and for this reason she is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies. In Huacaytaqui, where she lives, there are only four grocery stores, and her store in particular has the largest offer; to respond to the demand of the beautiful place where she has chosen to live, as she says, she needs to purchase supplies. 
The member is very grateful for this loan and is committed to continue working very hard to pay back on schedule and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery supplies

loans.name: Sidiki

texts.fr:
Né 13 janvier 1982 à San, SIDIKI T.  n’as pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et a  vite embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus. Il est mariée et vit dans une famille monogame avec son épouse et ses 2 enfants  dans le quartier Santoro I, de la préfecture de San (Région de Ségou).  
SIDIKI fait l’achat et la vente de cola en gros et en détail  qu’il a appris  auprès de son père  il y a plus de 15 ans. 
Il est très sollicité et apprécié surtout lors des foires hebdomadaires de San  ville et environs.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  et diversifier son activité, il décida de faire recours à l’‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il  est à son 3ème  prêt individuel. 
Monsieur SIDIKI T. compte acheter, 50 paniers de cola, il s’approvisionnait auprès des commerçants grossistes de San, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller jusqu’à Bouaké ( en République de Côte d’Ivoire) pour son approvisionnement. 
Il vend tous les jours au grand marché de San et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, à crédit et au comptant. 
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, utiliser  le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, de la nourriture et investir dans d’autres  activités.
texts.en:
Sidiki T. was born on January 13, 1982. He never had the opportunity to go to school and very early on took up income generating activities.  He is married and lives in a monogamous family with his spouse and their two children in the neighborhood of Santoro I, of the San prefecture (Segou Region).

Sidiki purchases and sells kola nuts in bulk and for retail. He learned this activity from his father about 15 years ago. He is very much in demand and appreciated, especially during the weekly fairs in San and its surroundings.

To meet his customers’ demand and to diversify his activity he decided to call on the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom this is his third individual loan. Mr. Sidiki T. would like to buy 50 baskets of kola nuts. He used to get his supply from the San’s wholesalers. However with the increase of his working capital, he would like to go as far as Bouaké (Ivory Coast Republic) to get his supply.

He sells every day at the large San market and at the weekly fairs to a customer base made up of women and men, on credit and for cash. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 22 500 Francs CFA that he plans to use to reimburse his loan and the rest will be used to pay for his children’s school fees, food and other activities.

loans.use: Purchase of baskets of kola nuts

loans.name: Rosinda

texts.es: Rosinda, de 30 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, Darwin, de 6 años y Adriana, de 4. Los tres como una gran familia viven en casa de su madre ubicada en la zona rural de Yaroka. Como mujer luchadora, Rosinda, hace 2 años, abrió un pequeño negocio de granos verdes, los que comercializa al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma, su negocio consiste en comprar al por mayor producciones de arveja, habas, y demás granos, cuando tienen lo suficiente, viaja a la capital del país, para poder comercializarlo a gran escala y a buen precio. Pero desde niña se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene 10 años sembrando en sus propios terrenos, arveja y papa; lo que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en su propio negocio. En adelante ella quiere ampliar su negocio y con las ganancias comprar su casa propia en la ciudad, de esa manera podrá trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Rosinda, es una mujer muy trabajadora y así, lo demuestra en sus pagos puntuales a MFP, de la misma manera está feliz de poder pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que es el primer crédito que tiene con ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá invertir en la compra de flores al por mayor, ya que esté mes tiene gran demanda y buen precio de compra.
texts.en:
Rosinda, 30 years old, is a single mother of two children: Darwin, 6 years old, and Adriana, 4. The three of them as a big family live in her mother’s house located in the rural zone of Yaroka. A determined woman, 2 years ago Rosinda opened a small raw grains business, which she buys from a wholesaler in the city of Tarma. Her business consists of buying peas, broad beans, and other grains from wholesalers. When she has enough, she travels to the country’s capital to sell them on a large scale and at a good price. She has made a living in agriculture since she was a child. She has ten years of experience planting peas and potatoes on her own land, which after each harvest she sells in her own business. 

Looking forward, she wants to expand her business and with the earnings she wants to buy her own house in the city. In this way she will be able to move around with greater ease. Rosinda is a very hard-working woman and she demonstrates this in her punctual payments to MFP. In the same way, she is happy to be able to be a part of her communal bank, as this is the first loan that she has with them. With the loan she is asking for, she will be able to invest in the purchase of flowers from the wholesaler, as this month there is a large demand and a good buying price.

loans.use: To buy flowers from a wholesaler to meet client demands.

loans.name: Aysada

texts.en:
Aysada I. is a 38-year-old widow who has five children. She is a very responsible woman who makes every effort to give her children all they need. After graduating from college, she worked as a nurse, but her wages were too low to cover her family's expenses. So, Aysada started a business breeding cattle and cultivating kidney beans and potatoes. She earned 4,500 Kyrgyz Soms (~$100) a month by selling her harvest and milk products to the local dairy. She worked hard and managed to multiply her livestock to three cows, twenty sheep, and two horses.  

Now Aysada plans to borrow 100,000 Kyryz Soms to purchase milk cows. It will allow her to expand her business by means of breeding. In the future, she wants to build a new barn for her livestock.

About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from the village of Malintuboan Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 42 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. T. es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable en este momento ya esta separada de su esposo pero aun así siempre a deseado mejorar su calidad de vida en la casa donde antes vivía con su familia se la dejaron a un hijo y con dinero propio que poco a poco ha ido juntando con esfuerzo y gracias a su trabajo va levantando una casita la cual quiere que solo sea de ella, anteriormente solicito crédito para colocar una losa la cual ya concluyo y ahora desea elabora un cuarto y el crédito lo pide para levantar las paredes del mismo, desea darles a sus nietos un hogar acogedor para cuando quieran visitarla.
texts.en: Mrs. T. is a hard-working and responsible person who at this moment is separated from her husband. Even so she has always wished to improve her quality of life in the house where she used to live with her family. They left her with a son and her own money which little by little, with effort, she has been saving, and thanks to her work she is building a small house that will be entirely hers. Previously she received a loan to lay a slab foundation which is now finished and she would like to build a room. The loan will be used to build walls. She wishes to give her grandchildren a comfortable home for when they want to visit her.

loans.use: Build walls

loans.name: Rosa Grimaneza

texts.es:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T., tiene 23 años, es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el  cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es terminar de construir la casa.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T. is 23 years old, is married and lives with her husband and children in Cantón Ventanas (an administrative division) in the Los Ríos province. She has one child.

The members of V.R.C Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles compound belonging to Cantón Ventanas. This little window is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work sowing maize and rice.

Rosa is dedicated to farming maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas in commercial Peña  and sells from her house or in the Ventadas market every day.

She is requesting a loan to plant maize, purchase inputs and seeds. With the support of the loan, she would be helped economically to supply her necessities She is facing challenges such as pests and illness and weather changes. Her dream is to finish building her house. She enjoys watching TV.

loans.use: Purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane T. is from the town of Trento. She is 45 years old. Jane is married and has 4 children aged 21, 20, 16 and 6. To make a living, Jane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jane is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizers. Jane wishes to have her own money for capital so that she would not need to borrow anymore.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Buna

texts.en:
Buna B. is from the village of Cabalantian, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Buna owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling wood and coconut charcoal in the local community. Buna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Buna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Buna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional wood and coconut for charcoal. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Buna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood and coconut for charcoal

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en: Artyom Avdalyan lives in the Shirak region of Armenia, in the city of Gyumri.  He is happily married with two children (a six year old daughter and a ten year old son).  He has been running his own business for the past ten years.  It is located in the center of the city, on a lively street with many entrepreneurs providing a variety of goods.  He believes his hard work has enabled him to be relatively successful.  He would like a loan to purchase additional inventory and expand sales.  He appreciates the flexibility and service of microfinance loans and expects his business income to increase by around thirty percent.  He hopes to expand his business to a second location and renovate the family apartment.  He is a native of Gyumri and proud to live there.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory

loans.name: Chance Group

texts.fr: Suzana M.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Chance, âgée de 60 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants.  Son conjoint est l’autorité de base d’une avenue (chef d’avenue). La  cliente  Suzana M. est vendeuse des braises. Elle s’installe au marché sectoriel Afia Bora. Depuis sa jeunesse,  Suzana M. exerce cette activité.  Vers 2008, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter une moto pour faire le taxi urbain (trans-ville)  et accroitre à plus ses revenus. Elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise. La cliente Suzana M. confirme avoir réalisé tant des projets avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. La cliente Suzana M.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Chance est constitué de 15 membres.
texts.en:
Suzana M., age 60, is married and the mother of ten children. She's an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Chance group. Her husband is "chef d'avenue" (exercising authority over his neighborhood). Suzana M. sells charcoal at the sectorial market Afia Bora.

She's been running this business since her youth. Around 2008, she got her first loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima MFI, in order to bolster her capital. This new loan will be used to buy a motorcycle, to provide passenger transportation services across the city and increase her income. She ambitions to ensure the future of her business.

Suzana M. confirms having carried out many projects thanks to Hekima's loan. She thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. The Chance group comprises 15 members.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia S. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  

Jalia has a business of selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jalia sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail.  

Jalia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand shoes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Jalia include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.   

Jalia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Mrs. Nang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nang, born in 1962, was selected to be village bank president by the nine members that make up this group loan. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Nang is a widow with one child who is studying in the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice crop and keeps the rest to support her family. In addition to farM., she also sells clothes and mosquito nets. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Mrs. Nang is applying for a loan to buy more clothes and mosquito nets for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and mosquito nets for sale

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah N. W. is a young man of twenty two years and is married. He lives in the Kamukuji area in Eldoret town. He runs a motorcycle transport business in Eldoret and has been in this business for two years now. His monthly income is five thousand shillings.

This will be Elijah's first loan from KADET LTD, he plans to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle to make his transportation business reliable.

With the income that he will get he wants to diversify his business and open a retail shop so that he can increase his income. In future he wants to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A. is 56 years old, married, has one child and makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store. In addition to this store, which she has run for the past three years, she also rents out karaoke machines for special occasions and runs a “carinderia” (or food stall). She has two employees and earns about PHP 10,000 a month.

She is applying for a loan for PHP 12,000 from CCT* to add additional items to the menu at her food stall and to buy new items such as ice cream to sell in her sari-sari store. In particular, she would like to make halo-halo, a Filipino dessert made of crushed ice, sweet beans, cut sweetened plantain, sweet yam, leche flan, pounded dried rice and coconut milk. Varieties include versions with slices of jackfruit on top or ice cream. Halo-halo is a bestseller in many communities, especially during the summer.

Nenita is determined to succeed at both businesses, despite challenges such as a fall-off in business when schools close for the summer. Her dream is to turn her store into a supermarket.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to expand a small variety store and a food stand.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид житель района Хамадони. Ему 74 года. Он женат, имеет 9 детей. Его дети живут отдельно. А жена, работает учительницей в средней школе. Сам Саид пенсионер. У него имеется высшее образование. По профессии он педагог. В этой области проработал 35 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается животноводством. В основном он закупает скот с других местностей и разводит у себя дома. Через несколько дней или месяцев он вывозит скот на рынок и продает по более выгодной цене. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Said lives in Hamadoni. He is 74 years old, married, and has nine children. His children live separately. His wife works as high school teacher. Said is on a pension. He has a higher education. He is a teacher by profession.  He taught for 35 years.  Now he works in animal husbandry.  Basically he buys cattle from other districts and raises them at home. After a few days or months he takes the cattle to the market and sells them for a profit. He has been doing this work for two years.  He is taking out a loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Manh Tan-1-1 Group

texts.en:
Thom is 30 years old with 2 children. He is a leader of group including 4 members. All of them have different businesses. Mr Thom has been a taxi driver for two years. For the first cycle, he used the loan to pay for his fee to attend a drivers training course. After one year, he found a job as a taxi driver and began to get a stable salary. Since he started participating in the credit program, he has had a good repayment history. Now, he needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy a sewing machine for his wife.

Huong is 26 year old with 1 child. She manages a small restaurant in her village. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy some equipment for her restaurant.

Quyen is 30 years old with a small child. Being retail merchant , he focuses on selling chicken for meat in the local market. He wants a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more chicken to meet the demand of customers.

Ngan is 41 years old with 2 children. She is raising 5 pigs for meat. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

Thiet is 26 years old. She manages a wood work shop and needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, vive con su esposa, es agricultor y también trabaja como motorista de un bus urbano, tiene tres años de ser motorista, y la agricultura la practica desde hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente está iniciando sus labores en la siembra de maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abono y fertilizantes, esta compra es muy importante para él, pues contara con lo necesario para sembrar.
Su aspiración es algún día a través de su trabajo poder construir su casa y tener mejores posibilidades económicas.
texts.en:
Florentín lives with his wife.  He is a farmer, and he also works as an urban bus driver.  He has been a driver for three years, and he has been a farmer for ten years.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00p.m.  He is currently starting his work planting corn.  

That is why he is requesting a loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.  This purchase, to have what he needs in order to plant, is very important to him.
