His aspiration is to one day, through his work, be able to build his house.  He also aspires to have better financial options.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny, age 38, has been living in the province of Siem Reap. To make a living, she and her husband both work as firewood sellers in and around their community. They always buy firewood in bulk from their wholesale suppliers at a low price and then they sell the firewood to gain a net income. From this, the couple can earn about $6 per day to support their family expenses. Besides their current job, they have been planting rice crops as an annual activity. Mrs. Ny is requesting a Kiva loan to buy two cows to assist her on the farm, as her old cow doesn’t support her during the plowing process. Mrs. Ny is blessed with four single children. A few of the children help her sell firewood.

loans.use: to buy two cows to use on her farm

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Del Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las Sras del comité Las Tejedoras de Ñanduti, son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que día a día luchan por procurar el sustento de sus familias.
La Sra. Blanca vive con su marido e hijos, en su casa propia, ella se dedica a tejer Ñanduti. Por medio de este oficio y también con la ayuda de su marido ella logra mantener a su familia e hijos. Esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que no solo es una profesión sino que también logra fomentar la cultura del país enseñando a sus hijos como tejer. El sueño de ella, y el motivo de su sacrificio con sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, telas y demás artículos necesarios para hacer el Ñanduti.
texts.en:
The women of the "Las Tejedoras de Ñanduti" committee (The Ñanduti Weavers) come from the city of Caacupé. They are very hardworking and determined, fighing day by day to provide sustenance for their families.

Blanca lives with her husband and children in their own home and works weaving Ñanduti, a traditional Paraguayan embroidered lace. Through this work and with the support of her husband, Blanca has been able to keep her family and her children together. She is very proud of what she does as it is not only a profession but a way of keeping her country's culture alive by teaching her children to weave. It is her dream and and her sacrifice to her children.

Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase thread, needles, cloth and other necessary items to weave the Ñanduti.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, needles and other items.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena se dedica al negocio de una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 20 años, primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a su hijo. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, enlatados, papel higiénico, detergentes y sopas. La señora posee el sueño de seguir creciendo con su negocio hasta convertirlo en una distribuidora.
texts.en: Doña Maria Elena runs a grocery store out of her home.  She started this business 20 years ago, initially selling sweets to children and then little by little reinvesting in her business so that she could sell bulk grains, which is what people buy most.  She says that her goal in establishing this business was to find an alternative means of supporting her son.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy bulk grains, sweets, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent and soup.  She dreams of continuing to expand her business until she has converted to selling bulk goods.

loans.use:
to buy bulk grains, sweets, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent and
soup.

loans.name: Makoti

texts.en:
Makoti is a 22-year-old hard-working man, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been selling motorcycle spare parts for two years, and with the proceeds, he has been able to build a house and also support his parents. 

His hardship is accidents at work, and his vision is a big garage plus a good residential house.

Makoti intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Christitin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CHRISTITIN est composé de trois personnes qui habitent ensemble dans la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houtou Bernadette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Houtou Bernadette est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Houtou Bernadette est mariée à un couturier du nom de Zogbé. Le couple a huit enfants dont trois restent encore à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Houtou Bernadette n’a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Houtou Bernadette  prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend à son domicile. Houtou Bernadette mène cette activité depuis une vingtaine année. Houtou Bernadette s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu Houtou Bernadette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe CHRISTITIN, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group CHRISTITIN is composed of three persons who live together in the same house. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Houtou Bernadette, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a clothier by the name of Zogbé. They have eight children, of whom three are still in their care. Some of the children are in school. 

Houtou Bernadette never attended school. To support herself and her children, she has been making meals that she sells out of her home. She has been in this business for about twenty years. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Houtou Bernadette and the other members of the group CHRISTITIN are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments, cassava flour, and corn

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, es empleada y comercializa con comida rápida como lo es: hamburguesas, tortas mexicanas y panes con pollo, ella vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus hijos, todos trabajan en el hogar; Reina inicio con el negocio con el apoyo D. una D. sus hijas, trabajan por las tardes en su propia casa.
Actualmente necesita comprar ingredientes para realizar la venta, específicamente, pan normal, para tortas y  para hamburguesas, pollo, jamón, mortadela, aceite, condimentos y gaseosas. La inversión será muy provechosa para el negocio y para ella, ya que contara con lo necesario para atender la demanda.
Su aspiración es ser una microempresaria estable, contar con la ayuda D. préstamos para el desarrollo del negocio y apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Reina is employed and sells fast food such as hamburgers, Mexican-style sandwiches, and Salvadoran chicken sandwiches. She lives with her husband and children, all of whom work at home. Reina started her business with the help of one of her daughters. They work in the afternoons at her home.

At the moment, she needs to buy ingredients for selling her food, specifically regular bread, buns for Mexican-style sandwiches and hamburgers, chicken, ham, mortadella, oil, condiments, and sodas. This investment will be advantageous for her and her business because she will have what she needs to meet the demand.

Her aspiration is to have a stable microenterprise. With the help of these loans, Reina will be able to develop her business and proviD. her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy regular bread, buns for Mexican-style sandwiches and hamburgers, chicken, ham, mortadella, oil, condiments, and sodas.

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. He has built good experience working in floor covering for the past 10 years. And in 2004, he started working independently, taking private projects. This man represents the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a new engine for his car in order to facilitate his transportation to projects where he works. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a new engine for his car in order to facilitate his transportation to projects where he works.

loans.name: Alondra

texts.es: La mujer de la actualidad lucha mas por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja a diario y se hace cargo de su hogar es el caso de Alondra que desde muy jovencita se caso y ha luchado con su esposo por darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ella es originaria de una localidad donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican al cultivo de Aguacate ya que la tierra es muy prolifera para ese tipo de fruto. Alondra tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian la primaria, comenta que tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace años y dice que emprendió ese negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para surtir su tienda, comprara, aceite, huevo, leche, arroz, frijol, shampoo, papel higiénico, pañales etc., y también un poco de verduras como cebolla, jitomate y chiles que es lo que mas se le vende. La meta que tiene Alondra para su negocio es hacer un local de cemento ya que donde tiene sus productos es de madera y en temporada de lluvias abecés se le mojan sus productos y se le echan a perder. Comenta que esta agradecida con las personas que hacen realidad los créditos por que así las personas pueden tener un negocio con el cual pueden mantener a sus familias.
texts.en:
Today’s woman struggles more for her family’s wellbeing; she works every day and takes care of her home.  This is Alondra’s case.  She married very young and she and her husband have worked hard to provide their children with a better quality of life.  She’s from a location where most of the residents are avocado farmers since the soil there is very apt for this type of fruit.  Alondra has two children going to elementary school.  She comments that she has had a grocery store for several years now and she says that she started the business in order to help her husband meet household expenses.

She is asking for the loan to buy stock merchandise for her store.  She will buy oil, eggs, milk, rice, beans, shampoo, toilet paper, diapers, etc. and also a few vegetables like onions, tomatoes and chilies which are the best sellers.  Alondra’s goal is to build a cement store because the place she currently has her merchandise in is wood and during the rainy season it get wet sometimes and some of the products are ruined.  She comments that she’s grateful to all the people who make the loans a reality because people are able to have a business that they can support their families with that way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Alma is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy feeds and medicines for her chickens.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicines for her chickens.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La vida de la socia Alicia, no ha cambiado mucho, ella sigue vendiendo frutas y verduras, pero ahora no viaja tan seguido, la socia las envía y allá recogen la mercadería los clientes directos de la socia, un pariente, o un encargado, ella viaja las veces que puede pero ya no con tanta frecuencia, ella va en especial a cobrar y aqui en Cusco se encarga de la compra al por mayor de las verduras y frutas para el envio, la socia a mejorado sus ingresos economicos significativamente y esta muy feliz de continuar creciendo motivo por el cual la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de verduras, frutas y en el  pago del envio de los productos. La socia desea convertirse en una prospera empresaria y dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Life for Alicia hasn’t changed much. She continues to sell fruits and vegetables, but now she doesn’t travel so often. She ships merchandise, and later her customer, a relative, or a manager receives them. She travels when she can, but no longer with such frequency. She goes specifically to collect payment, and, here in Cusco, she is responsible for purchase of bulk fruits and vegetables which will be shipped out.  She has improved her income significantly, and she is very happy to continue growing which is why she wants to invest her loan into the purchase of fruits, vegetables, and the cost of shipping products. Alicia would like to become a successful businesswoman and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables and to cover shipping costs.

loans.name: Demur

texts.en:
Demur is 69 years old. He lives in the village Dzevri, Imereti Region, West Georgia. Demur is married and lives with his family: his wife, Rusiko, and his 32-year-old son. Demur is a blacksmith. He has a small workshop and performs different orders for the villagers. His son is a worker-constructor; Rusiko is actively involved in family agriculture. 

The family has two milk cows; they sell dairy products in the village. Also the family owns 0.8 hectares of land, where maize is grown. Demur and Rusiko use part of the harvested maize to feed the cows and the other part is sold locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. 

Demur has requested credit to purchase additional agricultural land. He will cultivate it and sow additional maize. The family will get more corn for sale and thus increase their income. Demur and Rusiko will use the additional income to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Amil

texts.en: Amil is a 43-year-old man who engages in farming and has four years of experience in this field. Amil is married and has two sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He raises and sells fruits and vegetables, and his monthly income from this business is 100 AZN. Amil applied for this 1,000 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  est âgée  de 44 ans. Elle vit au  Sénégal.  Elle est mariée et mère 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 16 ans. Elle évolue  dans le secteur du petit commerce et pratique la vente de légumes et poissons depuis  3 mois.  C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion mais  aussi dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle vit depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100, 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de légumes et de poissons a revendre  dans le but de renforcer son activité de commerce. Elle souhaite  accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux assister ses enfants dans leurs besoins vitaux.
texts.en:
Mrs Ndeye, age 44, lives in Senegal. She's married and the mother of three children, whose ages range from 2 to 16. She's a merchant, and has been selling vegetables and fish for three months. 

She chose this business out of passion, but also in order to earn a living. She's been a member of the local branch of Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, since August 2011.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 intended to buy vegetables and fish to resell, in order to bolster his business. She would like to increase her profits to better provide for her children and their vital needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish to resell

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Evarista;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 4 hijos de 17, 12, 10, 1 año; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y vendiendo frutas, todo tipo de fruta; La socia tiene un pequeño stand informal a un extremo de la plaza principal del poblado en el cual se ubica todos los días y vende la fruta que previamente compra al por mayor en la ciudad de Cusco de un muy conocido mercado de venta de abastos y ella trae en cajas y los vende al por menor en este su espacio. La socia desea poder invertir el préstamo en la compra de frutas y aumentar su mercadería, también pagara el transporte desde Cusco hasta Urcos que está ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas y transporte.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Evarista belongs to the "Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru" communal bank, located in the district of Urcos, in Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco. She is 37 years old. She lives with her partner, and has four children, ages 17, 12, 10, and 1. 

She works buying and selling small animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, and also fruit; all kinds of fruit. 

She has a small informal stand, at one end of the main town plaza, where she is found every day. She sells fruit that she buys at wholesale in the city of Cusco, from a very well-known produce market. She brings it home in boxes, and sells it at retail from her stand.  

She wants to use the loan to buy fruit, and increase her supply of merchandise. She will also pay for transportation from Cusco to Urcos, which is located one hour and ten minutes away. 

Evarista is applying for the loan to buy fruit, and pay for transportation. She is grateful for the loan, and is committed to making her scheduled instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy fruit, and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 54 years old. He lives in the village of Chagan-Chkvishi, West Georgia. Mamuka is married and lives with his family: wife – Leila, a 14-year-old daughter, mother (retired) and younger sister. Leila works as teacher in the village. Mamuka is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have five milk cows and ten calves. The family sells dairy products at the local market. Also they have two pigs and sell, on average, 20 piglets per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the pension of Mamuka’s mother.

Mamuka requested credit for construction of a new cattle-shed, as the old one is almost ruined, as it was old. The new cattle-shed will be bigger and Mamuka will be able to raise more calves instead of selling them, in order to increase the amount of milk cows in the farm. The family will get more milk and sell more dairy products. It will help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed construction.

loans.name: Kay

texts.es:
Kay, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y luchadora, es casada con Alfonso, vive con su esposo y sus  03 hijos, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante,  tiene su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo de su esposo. Kay se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su bodega, la cual está instalada en su propia casa, siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos y extraños que pasan por la zona, por lo que a todos atiende con amabilidad. Su bodega lleva ya 02 años de funcionamiento tiempo en el cual ha llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo de su esposo para la atención al público. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos la quienes les da una buena atención, ya que sabe que con sus compras a ella le brinda un ingreso económico, la cual le da la tranquilidad de darles lo mejor a sus hijos, tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y surtir  su negocio con más productos. Este será su préstamo numero 06 con la institución MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo por que siente que son responsables, está agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad y el apoyo que le brinda.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 nuevos  soles comprará abarrotes  en general al por mayor a menor  costo para  surtir su bodega, ya que así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Kay is 44 years old; she is a happy and hardworking woman, and is married to Alfonso. Kay lives with her husband and 3 children for whom she works very hard to give them a good start in life, she has her own home that she bought with the help of her husband. Kay sells groceries in her home; she is visited often by neighbors and strangers that pass through the area which is why she treats each person with kindness. Her store has been open for 2 years and is well known and frequented. Kay has her husband’s support when taking care of the customers. What Kay enjoys about her work is that she is well recognized in the area since the majority of her customers are her neighbors and she takes good care of them since she knows that with their purchases she is able to have an income which gives her the piece of mind to provide the best for her children. Kay has a lot of motivation to keep growing in her field and to stock her business with more merchandize. This will be Kay’s sixth loan with MFP and likes her group very much since she feels they are responsible and is grateful with the institution for the opportunity and the support that they provide.

With the amount of 1500 nuevos soles, Kay will buy mostly groceries wholesale, at a lesser cost to stock her business since this will allow her to have greater earnings.

loans.use: buy basic household goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo, de 31 años, soltero, vive en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Nueva Esperanza Alta del distrito de Llochegua. Cirilo es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura, Él cultiva cacao desde hace mÁs de 10 años. En un inicio empezó con una hectárea de terreno que le cedió su padre con media cuadra de plantaciones de cacao, que con el ingreso de este poco producto que tenía empezó en expandir mas su plantaciones, inclusive a comprar mas terrenos donde también cultivó cacao. Generalmente trabaja solo, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre requiere de peones para que le puedan facilitar en la extracción de sus productos que finalmente los expende a los grandes acopiadores en el distrito de Llochegua. Él esta contento con su trabajo porque le genera buen ingreso económico, y en un futuro desea adquirir un terreno en el distrito de Llochegua para que luego pueda construir su vivienda. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abono para fertilizar su predio agrícola.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 31 years old and single.  He lives in his own house in the central village of Nueva Esperanza Alta in the Llochegua district.  Cirilo is a farmer.  He has been growing cacao for over ten years.  In the beginning he started with one hectare of land, which his father gave him.  It had half a “cuadra” (a cuadra is 6,400 meters) of cacao plants.  With the income from this small amount that he had he started to expand his fields. This includes buying more land where cacao was grown.  

He generally works alone, but during harvest season he always needs field workers so they can help with the harvest of his products.  He then sells the crops at the large collection sites in the Llochegua district.

He is happy with his work because it generates good income.  In the future he wishes to get land in the Llochegua district where he would later be able to build his home.

This will be his first loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 1,000 soles to buy manure to fertilize his agricultural property.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is 40 years old, married, and has three children (ages 12, 10 and 8). His wife works as a pharmacist.

Enrique is a gasoline retailer. He has had this business for three years. Enrique works hard to support his family. He requested this loan to buy more oil and gasoline to sell. Enrique hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more oil and gasoline to sell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la venta de cebolla en un mercado mayorista de la localidad donde reside, tiene varios años de trabajar en este negocio y se ha hecho  de mucha experiencia en las ventas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre vende producto de calidad a buenos precios pero sobre todo el servicio es excelente siempre atiende a las personas muy amable;  Manuel es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre dispuesto a aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presenten porque sabe que solo con esfuerzo alcanzara el éxito; desde hace algún tiempo quiere aumentar las ventas en su negocio pero necesita invertir en insumos y no posee el suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cebollas al por mayor. Manuel de Jesús es responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: cebolla por mayor

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married with four children and two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She sales green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas  She works seven days a week.  Her goal is to build rental houses to supplement her income.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and does not have access to  piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is an honest, hardworking and friendly person. She was born in Chiapas, Oaxaca but at the moment lives in Garcia, Nuevo Leon. Blanca is working in the food sales business. Her business is located near a refinery company very far from the city. Her clients are workers from this company, and they are accustomed to having their lunches in the company, which means that nobody go home to eat. For that reason Blanca receives every day more clients and her sales are increasing. She wants to offer a better service and a better quality of her meals.

Blanca needs a loan of $1,375 USD to increase the quantity of her products that she offers in her small business, like snacks and a bigger variety of foods. She hopes for your support and she plans to return the loan in a term of 6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Blanca es una persona honesta, trabajadora y amigable, ella nació en Chiapas Oaxaca pero actualmente vive en G. Nuevo León. Blanca se dedica a comercio de comidas, particularmente su negocio se encuentra afuera de una empresa de refinería afuera de la cuidad y sus clientes son los trabajadores que pertenecen a esta empresa. Ellos están acostumbrados a comer en la misma empresa por lo que a Blanca cada día percibe mas clientes y sus ventas se están incrementando. Ella quiere brindar un mejor servicio y una mejor calidad de sus comidas.

Blanca necesita de un préstamo de $1375 USD para aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece en su pequeño negocio, como botanas y una mayor variedad de comidas. Ella espera tu apoyo y planea regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of her products

loans.name: Ombiyah

texts.en:
Ombiyah is a member of MBK who has requested her second loan of $100. Selling variety of fried delicacies is her daily business. She sells her food in front of one of the schools in her village. Before becoming a member of MBK, she had to borrow money to buy ingredients, which had to be repaid the following afternoon. But now Ombiyah has secured her own capital, and can buy more ingredients so as to increase her income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her fried delicacies

loans.name: Claudia Verónica

texts.en:
Claudia is married and has two children, a girl age 10 and a boy age 6. She started her business because of the economic situation which was causing difficulty for her and her husband. As she is a homemaker, she was not able to find work easily, so she opted to develop her own business doing what she already knew well: making pastries. Seven years ago she started selling her products to her neighbors and little by little her business grew, until today she has an employee helping her with the business.

Claudia is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 to buy a cooler to keep her products fresh. They are made basically of dairy products, and because of the heat in this region they go bad quickly. The temperature in this place fluctuates between 38 and 42 degrees centigrade. Claudia offers to pay off this loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. She and her family thank you for your support and they await your help in order to improve their quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Claudia es casada y tiene dos hijos, una niña de 10 años y un niño de 6 años de edad, ella empezó con su trabajo debido a la situación económica por la que estaba atravesando junto con su esposo y como ella es ama de casa no podía encontrar empleo fácilmente, por lo que optó por desarrollar su propio negocio haciendo lo que sabe hacer bien que es la repostería, así hace siete años atrás empezó vendiendo sus productos entre sus vecinos y poco a poco fue creciendo en su negocio, que a la fecha tiene una persona que la ayuda con el negocio.

Claudia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para la compra de un enfriador y así poder mantener sus productos frescos, los cuales son elaborados básicamente de lácteos y por el calor de la zona se echan a perder, en su localidad el calor fluctúa entre 38 y 42 grados centígrados, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, ella y su familia agradecen tu apoyo y esperan de tu ayuda para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Acquisition of a cooler

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: “My husband and I work together where I embroider clothes and he sews them in his tailoring shop. We need a loan to purchase sewing machines and some raw material for our business in a village located in the heart of Punjab, the most populous province. With the additional profits, we hope we can give our children a proper education that they deserve.”

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: A woman who is proud of being a member of LAPO, Nkechi has a business that gives her and her family joy. Nkechi sells fairly-used electronics in her shop. She is 50 years old ,a widow, and mother of four children. She has been in this business for over 5 years and needs a loan of US$ 1,175 to boost her business and provide more easily for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fairly-used electronics for resale

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila owns a small market business selling clothing and undergarments at the busy Central Market in Nikopol, Ukraine. Hard-working, consistent and honest, Ludmila has many qualities that have contributed to the success of her business. By selling reasonably priced, quality products that are always in demand, she is able to make a good profit – typically about $400 a month. As a single adult, her business is an important source of income for her. Ludmila has been in business for four years now and would like to grow her enterprise further as she is able. She has requested a loan of $1000 to help purchase new clothing inventory so that she can continue to make good profits, provide for herself, and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Justo Rufino

texts.es:
Justo Rufino P. has been a small business owner for more than thirty years.  He has two shops selling clothing in busy parts of Guatemala City.  He is very hard working and rises early each morning to tend one of the shops while one of his sons tends the other.  With income from the two shops he supports his wife and four children.  This is a busy time of year for clothing sales and Justo wants to increase the quantity and quality of his inventory.    Translated by a Kiva volunteer.  


El señor Justo Rufino P.,  es un micro comerciante guatemalteco, que por mas de 30 años, se ha
dedicado a la venta de ropa nueva, en la actualidad tiene dos puestos de venta, los dos ubicadados en areas populares de la ciudad capital de Guatemala.

Todos los dias desde muy temprano por las mañanas,  deja a uno de sus cuatro hijos en uno de los dos puestos de venta, y el se va al otro puesto de venta que tiene.

El señor Justo Rufino P., es una persona muy trabajadora.

En la actualidad sus ventas se han incrementado por la epoca de fin de año, y el desea mejorar considerablemente, gracias a su dedicacion y esfuerzo.

Con los ingresos de sus dos locales comerciales y de sus ventas, el mantiene a sus esposa y a sus 4 hijos.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Namsifu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 32-year-old Namsifu M.. She is married with two children, aged 4 and 13, and has two other dependents, who are her niece and nephew.

In 2007, Namsifu established a retail business. Namsifu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $550 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Kul

texts.en:
Mrs. N. married in 1992 and has six children ( all in school) . She has worked in the garment factory for two years and her husband is a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh. Her family lives in Takmao Commune, about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They are friendly, loyal and hard-working.

She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Lucinda Esther

texts.en:
Lucinda Esther R. S. has a business selling clothing door to door in the region of San Martin. Lucinda lives in the city of Morales, where she and her husband started the business 3 years ago. They’ve experienced success because they travel to remote towns in the region and sell clothes to people that usually wouldn’t have the opportunity to buy these clothes.

Lucinda is 33 years old, happily married and has 4 children (pictured here). Her family is very close and supportive. She is proud of her accomplishments and business. Education is very important in her family and she is motivated to succeed so she can send all of her children to University.

A member of Manuela R. and the community bank Las Moralinas, Lucinda is requesting a loan of $700 to repay over 6 months. She plans to use the loan to increase her inventory of clothes to sell.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Monico

texts.es:
Mónico P. is married and has 4 children, who are 28, 27, 25, and 18. Previously, he was an employee at a tortilla factory, until he decided to start his own business to improve his economic situation, which was very unstable at that time. His tortilla factory became a family business since it started 10 years ago since Don Mónico and his children made them and delivered them themselves.

Currently, he needs a credit of $1,125, which he will repay in 6 months, to remodel his location and to fix up a sales area to better attend to his clients. With your help, Mónico will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mónico P. es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 27, 25 y 18 años. El anteriormente fue empleado de una tortillería, hasta que decidió poner su propio negocio para mejorar la situación económica que en ese tiempo era muy precaria. La tortillería se volvió un negocio familiar desde que inicio hace 10 años ya que Don Monico y sus hijos las fabricaban y ellos mismos repartían las tortillas.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $1,125 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y acondicionar una área de ventas para mejor la atención a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Mónico prosperara.

loans.use: To remodel his business

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Juan lives in Caralampio. He is 44 years old and married. His wife works in the retail business and helps out with the home's expenses. They have three children - one of them works and the other two are in school. Juan's business is an auto shop specialized in electrical repairs that he started with his own money. This venture has grown steadily and he wishes to apply the loan to make improvements and buy replacement parts for the shop so that he can better serve his customers. He plans on keep expanding his auto shop because his family's survival depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Juan, habita en San Caralampio, es casado de 44 años de edad, su esposa es comerciante y aporta en los gasto del hogar, le tienen tres hijos, uno ya trabaja y los otros estudian. El negocio del Sr. Juan es un taller de electricidad automotriz que comenzó con fondos propios, su negocio ha venido creciendo y con el préstamo desea mejorar las condiciones del taller y comprar repuestos para sastifacer a los clientes, a futuro es seguir mejorando el taller ya que es su fuente de vida y la de su familia

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for auto shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: During the visit to Grace A., it was observed that her shop was arranged with attractive fabrics and tailoring materials. She has three sewing machines, and this made her shop stand out from every other fashion designer's. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She is very optimistic and enthusiastic to lift her family above poverty. Grace lives at Akensan in Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $700 to buy one weaving machine so that she can meet and satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy one weaving machine

loans.name: Roci

texts.es:
Roci worked in a clothes hanger factory, where she learned to make them. The procedure is not complex, since it is all done by hand. It was thus that, since 1 year ago, she decided to become independent and put her own workshop in her house. Her husband helps to contact clients and to distribute the hangers.

The loans that she has received served for the purchase of the materials that she needs to manufacture the hangers.

Roci wants her business to grow and to move the workshop to another place.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Roci trabajaba en una fábrica de ganchos colgadores de ropa, por lo que aprendió a hacerlos. El procedimiento no es complejo, ya que todo se hace a mano. Fue así, que desde hace 1 año decidió independizarse y puso su propio taller en su casa. Su esposo le ayuda a contactar los clientes y a repartir los ganchos.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para la compra de los materiales que necesita para fabricar los ganchos.

Roci quiere que su negocio crezca y poner el taller en otro lugar.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes hangers.

loans.name: Ekatte

texts.en: Ekatte "Mama" Uche is a retired teacher, who is married and has five older children.  She sells lubricant in wholesale and retail quantities in Lagos, Nigeria, and has managed her own business since 2002.  Mama Uche also supplies eggs to local retailers, which provides her with an even greater income.  In order to expand her business and increase her inventory, Mama Uche is requesting a loan of $850.

loans.use: To purchase more lubricant.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam C., who is 43 years old, grows vegetable crops for sale and typically earns around US $2.4 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chhour Phalla, who is 38 years old, is a construction worker. Sam has three children, all of whom are students, living in Ampil Commune, Siem Reap Province. Because of increasing family expenses due to her husband traveling to work, she wants to purchase a motorcycle. This will both decrease family expenses and help her transport her vegetables to the market. Hence, she now requests a loan of US $300 to add her savings in order to purchase a second hand motorcycle.

loans.use: Purchasing a second hand motorcycle

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia Q.   se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche), también le sirve para la elaboración de queso 
 
Natalia vive en la comunidad Vilaque de la Provincia  Pucarani del departamento de La Paz, ubicada  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Es casada, su esposo trabaja recolectando piedras y arena para venderlas a los transportistas  cómo material de construcción. La pareja tiene 4 hijos de 13, 11, 7 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. 
 
El monto del  crédito le servirá para la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto, sus ingresos..
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y el segundo via KIVA. La evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Natalia Q. works raising cattle and the milk production is sold by PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant), which also works in cheese production. Natalia lives in the Vilaque community of the Pucarani province in the department of La Paz, located three hours from the city of La Paz. She is married and her husband works collecting stones and sand to sell them to the transportistas as construction material. The couple has 4 children, 13, 11, 7 and 2 years old respectively. This loan amount will help her to purchase cattle of an improved variety and in his way increase their milk production, and therefore, their earnings. It is the second loan with Impro and the second through KIVA. The evaluation carried out qualifies her for the granting of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle livestock

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reina R. es una dama el cual se dedica a la venta de verduras específicamente a la venta de tomates los cuales son comercializados en su tramo en el mercado central de Chinandega donde labora arduamente.

Es muy visitada por los clientes por la razón de que ella vende hermosos tomates y por esto se ha destacado grandemente. El motivo por el cual hoy en dia ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar los tomates y de esta forma ofertarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Reya Escalante is a lady whose business is the sale of perishable goods and vegetables in the central market of Chinandega where she has worked for the past five years.

It is important to point out that she is has worked very hard and for this reason she has doubled her efforts to continue supplying her home’s necessities that need her support so much. The reason why she is waiting for Ceprodel is to obtain the money for the purchase of the perishable goods in order to offer them to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run U. is a 54 year-old widow and lives in Ang Prasath village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Run U. has three children. Two of them are employed in garment factory while the third stays at home to do housework and help with the business.

Mrs. Run U. is a duck breeder. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She would like a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Alondras (“Larks”) Village Bank. Lucia is 29 years old and married with three children. Lucia travels to regional fairs to buy livestock - such as cattle, pigs and hens. She sells the animals at the San Juan Sunday Market. Sometimes, she kills the animals herself and sells the meat wholesale to butcher shops. 

Lucia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy rams. Lucia’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build a house on and to support her children until they become working professionals.

loans.use: To buy rams so she can resell them to butcher shops at fairs across the city.

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.en: Bismarck N. is married and has 2 children. He has received schooling through junior high. Bismarck is a carpenter who is specialized in making room furniture at Elmina, which he has done since 2003. His wife has a small business as a trader. Bismarck uses his income to pay for housekeeping and other family expenses. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of wood, tools and equipment to enhance efficiency in his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Bismarck plans to reinvest back into the business to increase his capital base.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of wood, tools and equipment to enhance efficiency in his work.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad,   tiene a su cuidado 3 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, posee un negocio de venta de repuestos; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería (mas repuestos) para su negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2800.00 nuevos soles el mismo que lo pagará en 06 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para poder incrementar mercadería en su negocio y de esta manera incrementar la capacidad de su tienda; con ello piensa obtener mejores ganancias las que piensa invertir aún más en su negocio y en la educación de sus hijos, puesto que están en edad escolar.
 Ella se compromete a pagar su préstamo, tal como lo hizo anteriormente y agradece de sobremanera a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “La Julenita” in the district of Juli in the province of Chuchito. She is 33 years old, has three children, and has a high school education. She has worked with the Manuel Ramos Movement for 6 years, and has her own business selling spare parts. Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she used it to purchase merchandize for her business. With this loan of 2,800 new soles, which Rosa will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase and sell more products with the purpose of expanding her business. She hopes to increase her income, and with that invest back into her business and the education of her children. Rosa promises to repay her loan, just like she did with her last one, and she sends her thanks to the Manuela Rosa movement for their support of women.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandize (spare parts) for retail

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат женщина 34 лет, замужем имеет четырёх детей. Дети учатся в школе. Она уже много лет занимается продажей детских одежд. Рохат выходит торговать каждый день на рынок «Рохи Охан» города Душанбе. У нее очень большой и разнообразный ассортимент. Закупает она товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. В весенний сезон Рохат хочет получить займ в сумме 10000 сомони сроком на 9 месяцев и закупить еще детских одежд.
texts.en:
Rohat is a 34 year old woman with a husband and four children. The children are in school. She has been in the business of selling children's clothing for many years. She goes to the Rohi Ohan market in Dushanbe every day to sell. Her inventory is large and varied. She buys the goods at the Korvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. Rohat would like a loan of 10000 somoni for a term of 9 months to buy more children's clothing for the spring season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing for spring

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Sanata D. est âgée de  23 ans, célibataire sans enfant,  elle vit  avec ses parents dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de koutiala. Sanata n’a pas fréquenté l’école, elle aidait sa mère à faire la fabrication du Sounbala (un des condiments les plus importants pour les femmes dans la préparation des sauces en Afrique de l’ouest). Après 10 ans passés aux services de sa mère,  elle a commencé à évoluer à son propre compte dans le domaine de l’achat vente du Sounbala. Elle est très sollicitée dans le secteur et peut vendre plus de 5 gros paniers dans la semaine.  
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, Sanata a décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans.   Après 4 prêts dans le groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés correctement   elle est à son premier prêt  individuel. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 10 gros paniers de Sounbala avec des villageoises lors des foires hebdomadaires de la ville de koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente à Bamako à une clientèle  composée essentiellement de revendeurs,  comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement des intérêts  du prêt et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa maman.
texts.en:
Miss Sanata D., 23, single and without children, lives with her parents in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala. Sanata never attended school; instead, she helped her mother prepare "soumbala" (one of the most important condiments used by women in the preparation of West African stews). After 10 years spent apprenticed to her mother, she began to develop her own business, buying and selling "soumbala". She is very much in demand in this sector and can sell more than 5 big baskets per week.

To increase her working capital so as to expand her business, Sanata decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. After 4 group loans (solidarity loans), all correctly reimbursed, she is now on her first individual loan.

With this loan, she intends to buy 10 big baskets of "soumbala" from village women at the weekly markets of the town of Koutiala. She sells her merchandise in Bamako, to a clientele composed essentially of retailers, for cash and on credit. She expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000 F CFA which she expects to use in repaying the interest on the loan and contributing to improving her mother's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of Soumbala for re-sale

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou G. est âgée  de 47 ans mariée et mère de 8 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier  Médina coura de la ville de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso)
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge  apprises auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle finit par opter pour  la vente de bois du bois de chauffe  il y a 10 ans. Cette activité lui procure de revenus car elle peut vendre 2 chargements de camion de bois de chauffe dans la semaine. 
Pour  l’agrandissement de son activité, elle a fait  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a  3 ans.  Après  3 prêts  solidaires ( prêt de groupe ), tous payés correctement, elle est à son deuxième prêt  individuel dont le précédent à été payé sans difficulté. 
 Avec ce financement elle compte acheter un  chargement  de camion  remorque en bois de chauffe dans les différents villages environnants de Koutiala et effectuera sa vente devant sa porte à Médine Coura  à une clientèle de femmes à crédit ou au comptant.  
Avec l’augmentation de son fonds de commerce, elle compte sur un bénéfice de 80.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera  pour le remboursement de l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux petites dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou G., 47, is married and the mother of 8 children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse and their children in the Médina Coura neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region). <> Not having had a chance to perform well at school, she began at a young age to earn money, learning from her mother. After having tried out several money-earning activities, she finally opted for selling firewood, 10 years ago. This business brings in revenue for her since she often manages to sell two truckloads of firewood per week.

To expand her business she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After 3 solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, she is on her second individual loan, the preceding having been repaid without difficulty.

With this capital she intends to buy a truckload of firewood in the various villages surrounding Koutiala and she will sell the merchandise in front of her home in Médine Coura to a clientele composed of women, for credit and on a cash basis.

With the increase in her working capital, she expects to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA per month, which she will use to reimburse the loan and contribute to the ongoing expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing of loads of firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar E. lives with his wife and two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest son is a second-grader at a local high school and the youngest son goes to a local kindergarten.

Ulambayar would like to start a small business making blocks and bricks for construction. Three years ago, Ulambayar's family moved from the Hentii province, one of the eastern provinces of Mongolia, to Ulaanbaatar. When he arrived, he worked in his cousin's firm producing blocks and bricks for construction. Now, based on his experience, he would like to start his own brick business.

As the construction industry booms in Mongolia, there is an ever-increasing demand for construction materials including blocks and bricks. He requests a loan to purchase the necessary equipment to make blocks and bricks for construction.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary equipment to make blocks and bricks

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Leizel is 22 years old.  She is married to Norlito L.. Her husband is a driver. They have two children, Christopher Joshua who is 4 years old and Christian Jade who is 2 years old. Though her two children have not started school, Leizel manages her store well to provide for her family’s needs, helping her husband earn income for their children’s future. The Larzaro live happily in Barangay Del Pilar Cabatuan Isabela. 

Leizel operates a typical general store, that is only a few months old, in their village. Her weekly net income from her business is PHP 700 --just enough to cover their daily basic necessities. Leizel decided to request a loan for PHP 8,000 from ASKI. She will use this loan to purchase additional working capital for her general store. She hopes to see her business prosper through the help of the loan. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for selling.

loans.name: Razia Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy plastic beans to sell.
Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy timbers to sell.
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Asia baji wants a loan to buy an iron for making iron rods to sell.
Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

Razia baji is a wife of M. I.. She has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 7 years. Borewala is a city famous for its shrines. She is the group leader of the ladies listed above. Razia baji is a very hardworking and mature lady. She knows that economic conditions are not so good nowadays, and it’s difficult to rely on a single person’s income. She prepares embroidered dresses in order to ease her husband's tension from being solely responsible for their finances. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband because he currently drives a rented rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: B. H. is a 40-year-old mother from Pursat Province. She has three children, all of whom are single and attend school. B. H. works with her husband as a vegetable grower. She runs the business on her own farmland, growing different kinds of vegetables, such as cabbages and potatoes, and morning glories. She has been in this line of work for more than four years and currently earns an average of $2 a day.  B. H. will use her loan to buy a cart to connect to her existing oxen, so that she can use it to transport her mature vegetables to market.

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: Wipala Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Wipala” es parte del Centro Focal “Los Andes”, con 11 integrantes, su presidenta es Basillia C. que organiza a su grupo para llevar adelante su reunión bajo un orden del día.

La mayoría de las integrantes de “Wipala” se dedican a la venta de remedios caseros, es decir, venden hierbas naturales que ayuda aliviar alguna dolencia, comúnmente se conoce con el nombre de CHIFLERAS, ellas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir más productos, ya que generalmente viajan a las provincias o pueblos para adquirir los productos.
texts.en:
The communal association "Wipala" is part of the "Los Andes" center, which has 11 members. The president is Basillia C., who organizes the group to move ahead. The majority of the "Wipala" members sell homemade remedies - a.k.a. natural herbs - to relieve pain. Communally, it's known as Chifleras. The members need a loan to acquire more products, as they generally travel to the provinces or towns to get their products.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Saivali

texts.ru: Сайвали Сулаймонов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сайвали имеет высшее образование. Он более 4 лет работал "бухгалтером". В данный момент он занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает пшеницу. Кредит просит для покупки удобрения.
texts.en:
Saivali S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Saivali has a higher education. He spent over 4 years working as an accountant. Currently, he is involved in agriculture. He mainly grows wheat. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Dodoma road D in kihesa,Iringa.She is 43 years old woman,she is married and mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 27,25,22,20,17,15,and 8 years.she also cares for other 4 dependents.

 Anna started her own shop business selling sugar,salts,banana, 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

 This is Anna`s first loan from BRAC-Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business,

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Anna hopes to pay school fees,save more money ,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar,wheat,banan,

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 47years old she is married and mother of three children. Currently two of her children are schooling in the community where they live.  She works very hard to support the husband in taking care of the home. Currently she trades in tambourine. Tambourine is mostly used by the churches for praising God. She makes market mostly on Sundays and hawks through various churches both near and wide to make sales. She has been in the business for the last three years with lots of experienced. She is requesting the support of the loan to buy bulk supply of the tambourine to meet the high demand of her customers.  She hopes to repay the loan in time. She again dreams to use her profit to provide quality education for the children.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of tambourine.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. B. is a rice grower. She currently manages a two-hectare farm that she hopes will support the needs of her three children. She started helping her husband grow rice in 2002. Now she is focusing her attention on how to grow their business, especially as her eldest child is now a teenager and has many needs.

Jocelyn would like a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her farm so that she will be able to obtain a better harvest. She has always been earning from her rice farm but her wish is to have a better harvest so that she can buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: To finance her farm

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.en: Xiomara is a new borrower with Esperanza International. She lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic, with her husband, Pablo, and children ages 12, 10, and 6. Xiomara runs a small pharmacy called "D’Xioma Pruducto Natural" (Xiomara’s Natural Products) where she sells medicine to her neighbors. With the flu season upon us, Xiomara will be quite busy in the next couple of months. With this loan, she will focus her sales on flu remedies and antibiotics. Xiomara believes that this loan will bring in enough additional profits to greatly benefit her family. She wants to send her children to university and, with an expanding business, she will be able to do just that. Thank you for your loan to Xiomara!

loans.use: To buy antibiotics and flu medicines

loans.name: Solange

texts.es:
El Sra. S. R. Solange es cliente antigua vive en El Torno aproximadamente 24 años y cuenta con su negocio propio hace dos años.
La cliente es propietaria de casa ella es casada, la cliente es oriunda de Guijarro tiene dos hijos un hombre y una mujer; a los cuales los hacen estudiar, el sueño de la pareja es verlos profesionales a sus dos hijos, por ello, ambos esposos mantienen el negocio. La actividad economica que realizan es la de venta de ropa de mujer, en ambientes de su propio domicilio; requieren el credito para comprar ropa para fin de año.
texts.en:
S. R. Solange is a long time client; she has lived in El Torno for approximately 24 years, and has run her own business for the past two years. The client is a homeowner, married, and a native of Guijarro. She has two children, a son and a daughter, and she makes sure that they both study. The couple’s dream is that their two children become professionals, and because of this, both she and her husband run the business. They sell women’s clothing from their house and require the loan to purchase clothing for the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase clothing).

loans.name: Achwak

texts.en: Achwak is a 25-year-old married woman with 3 young children. In 2005, she decided to open an evening dresses shop in her town. Today, Achwak is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional dresses. She is well known by the neighboring villages, so, with this loan, she can increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional dresses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 28 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia. Desde que se formó su propia familia se ha dedicado únicamente al cultivo de café y plátanos en sus chacras de sus suegros, pero hace un año ha empezado a vender verduras. Para ello, todos los viernes por la madruga viaja la zona sierra de su ciudad para comprar verduras como: lechugas, espinacas, zanahorias, cebollas etc., y el sábado realiza la comercialización en su localidad, y esta actividad le es muy rentable porque por ser la única que vende estos productos en su zona. Elizabeth está muy contenta con su negocio, así tenga que viajar durante 4 horas siente no importarle mientras le sea muy rentable, ya que gracias a estas ganancias sus hijos no sufren de necesidades económicas.

Ella está muy agradecida, ya que con su primer préstamo con MFP, obtuvo capital para su negocio de verduras, por ello se compromete e inculca a sus compañeros de banco comunal ser muy puntuales en los pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y para el incremento de las verduras que vende.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old and lives with her partner, father, and two children in her own home. Ever since starting her own family she had been only in the farming of coffee and bananas on the farms of her in-laws, but in the last year she has also started to sell vegetables. For that, every Friday before dawn she travels to the mountain area of her city to buy vegetables such as: lettuce, spinach, carrots, onions, etc., and on Saturday she sells them in her area. This business is very profitable because she is the only person selling these products in her area. Elizabeth is very happy with her business, and even though she has to travel for four hours she doesn’t mind as it is profitable and, thanks to these profits, her children do not suffer from a lack of necessities.

She is very grateful that with her first loan from MFP she was able to use the capital for her vegetable business, for which she committed and fulfilled to her fellow members of the communal bank to be punctual in the payments. The loan that she asks for now will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers and to increase the amount of vegetables that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 35 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a plumber and they both contribute to supporting the family.

Alice sells clothing and underwear. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase a variety of clothing and to expand her clothing trade. She believes that having an assortment of good quality clothing this festive period will increase her sales. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marynoel

texts.en: Marynoel B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marynoel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marynoel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marynoel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mercy Gaturi

texts.en:
Mercy is a single mother aged 34 years old. She has one daughter named Grace who is 12 years old. Mercy has been operating a tailoring and dress making business for the past four years. She also supplies polythene paper and rice to schools within the area.

She was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client and she plans to purchase more stock like polythene paper and rice for supplies. She also intends to expand her tailoring business with the extra profit generated from the supply business.

Mercy is a single mother and is educating her daughter with the income she makes from her business. She also loves to sing and is in the process of recording gospel music. Her hopes and dreams are to be a polythene paper distributor and to join the music industry. Mercy describes herself as a hardworking lady, a visionary and a risk taker.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 62 years old. She is married with five children. Currently her children are independent but she lives with two of her grandkids. She sells cocoa drinks, meat pies and spring rolls in a community school around her neighborhood. Schoolchildren in Ghana enjoy cocoa drinks and meat pie as a snack. Cocoa drinks are prepared with cocoa powder, mixed with water, sugar and milk and put into a refrigerator in sachets. The schoolchildren enjoy ithe drinks with meat pies and spring rolls. It is the main source of income for her to support her household. She makes a profit of GHS 5 – GHS 7 a day. With the loan, she wants to buy cocoa powder, sugar, vegetable oil and flour in bulk. She believes the loan would enable her to increase her profits and save more to support her grandkids in school. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi sells cooking oil at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Cooking oil is used in the preparation of Nigerian foods and soup and the demand for cooking oil is high in Nigeria.

Ngozi hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She is married without children. She is 41 years old and hopes to have children some day. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to excel in her business and family life. She is thankful in anticipation of your support.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro”  de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 23 años, es soltera: Ella estudia actualmente la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto superior “Antonio Lorena” del Cusco y esta cursando el cuarto semestre. Ella es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su carrera profesional. 
Karina nos cuenta que viaja los días lunes a la frontera de Perú con el país de Bolivia a traer mercadería como casacas, chompas y pantalones y después lo vende en el centro comercial de la calle Trinitarias los días martes y sábados, Karina requiere el crédito para comprar uniformes escolars y mochilas para esta campaña escolar que se acerca. Ya son varios ciclos que participa de los bancos comunales de la Asociación de Arariwa. 

La socia Maria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (La socia Karina en la fotografía esta acompañada de su enamorado).
texts.en:
Karina belongs to the Sol de Oro Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She is 23 years old and single. She is currently studying the professional career of tourism in Antonio Lorena, an institute for higher learning in Cusco. She is in her fourth semester. She is a hard-working and enterprising young woman who is getting ahead in her professional career. Karina tells us that on Mondays she travels to Peru’s border with Bolivia to get merchandise like jackets, sweaters, and pants. Later, she sells them on Tuesday through Saturday in a commercial center on Trinitarias street. Karina needs the loan to buy school uniforms and backpacks for the approaching school season. She has participated in communal banks with the Arariwa Association for several cycles. Maria is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. (Karina is in the photograph with her sweetheart.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school uniforms and backpacks

loans.name: One Day Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'One Day Group' from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

On the right in the photo is Hawa S. who is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 33-year-old is married to a civil servant and they have 2 children. A native of Bo city in southern Sierra Leone, Hawa is now a resident of Waterloo where she has been selling firewood and charcoal for over 6 years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying piles of firewood and bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: Buy piles of firewood and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: A. Agnès est née le 23 Janvier 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DJOUDA Francis, un enseignant, Agnès est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Agnès vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis sept ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Agnès a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Agnès mène comme activité la vente de boissons alcoolisées et de sucreries à Sèkandji. Agnès s'approvisionne à Cotonou. Agnès avait obtenu un prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Agnès envisage rehausser le niveau de son activité et reconstituer son stock de produits, afin d'accroître sa clientèle et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est pourquoi Agnès sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Agnès A. was born on 23rd January 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Francis DJOUDA, a teacher, Agnes is mother to two children, one of whom is at school. Agnès has lived together with her children and her husband in Sèkandi in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji for the past seven years. The couple covers the various family expenses between them. Agnès left school at secondary level. For almost five years she has been running a business selling alcoholic drinks and sweets in Sèkandji. She gets her supplies in Cotonou. Having had a loan which she repaid without incident, Agnès is planning to increase her level of activity and to rebuild her stock of products, in order to expand her customer base and increase her turnover. It is for this reason that she is applying for a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic drinks and sweets

loans.name: Mrs. Pech Saom Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pech S. lives in Kampeaeng Tboung village in Takeo province. She is 37 years old and serves as president of an eight-member loan group. Each member of this group will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Pech S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she makes a living by growing rice.  Her husband, Mr. Sambo Sok, earns a small income in construction. Mrs. Pech S. will use her portion of this loan to buy some piglets to breed. She hopes that this new business will allow her to improve her family's life. The couple has four children, three of whom are students. Their youngest child is not yet old enough to go to school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to breed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying teak seeds

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech H. is a 60-year-old local farmer and the mother of a school-aged child, as well as another five children who are employed and help with the family responsibilities. Every day in the early morning, Pech H. and her husband go to their field where they plant a variety crops, such as rice and watermelon crops. They will harvest and sell crops when they come to maturity. 

Pech H. faces a problem: she has already been growing her crops since a month ago but they are not growing well and may need fertilizer. Therefore, Pech H. decided to request a loan of $1050 which she will use to purchase many sacks of fertilizers to improve her crop yields, as well as to buy an ox to help with plowing the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fertilizers to improve her crops.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad S. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Natividad is married. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.
