The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. She also cooks snack foods like "binignit," a kind of porridge mixed with different kind of root crops like sweet potatoes, ube, and banana. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Natividad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Natividad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old and married with 2 children aged 5 and 7 both of whom currently attend school. He is a farmer from Western Kenya near Nyamira town. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has employed 3 people from the community on a temporary basis. His main products are tea, milk, coffee, maize, beans and vegetables which he sells locally. He is also employed as a teacher and earns Kes.6,000 per month.

His biggest challenges in farming are poor markets and unpredictable weather conditions. He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of Kes.45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the family's living standard. In the future, he hopes to increase the number of dairy cows and expand his poultry farm and buy farming materials to enhance productivity.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Exaltación se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Sartawi que significa Levantar, ésta Asociación esta integrado por 8 miembros las mismas son alegres dinámicas y carismáticas. Una de las integrantes es Juana de 35 años, casada y con tres hijos. Hace dos años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos, según la temporada. Juana se organiza bien para atender tanto a sus hijos como a su negocio. Con el préstamo tiene planificado adquirir mayor mercadería ya que ella viaja a Perú para adquirir diversos productos  para luego venderlos en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
Juana se siente complacida con la atención en el consultorio.
Sus demás compañeras también necesitan el préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
At one of the Communal Associations of Pro Mujer Exaltación, the Sartawi Communal Association which means "to lift" meets every two weeks. This Association is made up of 8 members who are happy, dynamic and charismatic. One of the members is Juana who is 35 years old, married and has three children. For the past two years she has worked selling diverse products according to the season. Juana is well organized in order to take care of her children as well as her business. She plans to acquire more merchandise with the loan. She travels to Perú to acquire diverse products to later sell them at different fairs in the city of El Alto. Juana is pleased with the attention at the office. Her fellow workers also need the loan to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Peola

texts.en:
Peola P. is 34 and married with 4 children. She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Peola has many years of experience in this business. Peola needs a loan of WST$2950 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas per week) to improve/expand her business.

This is her Peola's fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Peola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El señor Gonzalo vive en casa propia en la zona las lomas de la ciudad de la paz, esta casado tiene tres hijos de 18,14 y 12 años de edad, trabaja fabricando botas para damas en su taller que esta dentro del domicilio, la esposa trabaja como empleada en una galería de ropa. Con este crédito ya son dos veces que es cliente de Impro y por primera vez de Kiva. El crédito lo destinará a la compra de cuero, cola, tacos de goma, etc., para su negocio de zapateria.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Gonzalo lives in his own home in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children ages 18, 14 and 12. He works making boots for women in his workshop which is in his home. His wife works as an employee at a clothing store. This is his second loan with Impro and the first through Kiva. He will use this loan for the purchase of leather, glue, rubber heels, etc., for his shoe business. Due to his social character, he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: leather, glue, rubber heels, etc., for his shoe store

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie T. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 50 years old. Tessie is married. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en: Consolacion A. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. She is 61 years old and is married with six adult children. Consolacion owns and operates a furniture-making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Consolacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn S. (pictured here), is a widow with four sons and two daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home. One son attends university and another daughter is also a widow living with her. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Sarorn S. is a silk weaver and a tailor. She is old, but still strong and works hard. She hopes to support her son's further education, so she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to pay school fees for her son who is attending university. She will use a part of her loan to buy silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who is attending university and buy silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.name: Reyna María

texts.es: La Señora Reyna A. tiene un negocio de refresquería ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene siete años de experiencia, su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas en el que incluyen a sus dos hijos pero ellos ya están casados, así que prácticamente solo es ella y su esposo, solicita crédito en CEPRODEL para el mejoramiento de vivienda, y ahorita en la época de invierno no mojarse y poder tener una mejor condición.
texts.en: Reyna A. has a refreshments business located within his home.  She’s been doing this for six years and has a family of four that includes her two children.  They are married, so it’s basically just she and her husband.  She is asking for this loan, through CEPRODEL, so that she can make improvements to her house, so that it will not leak this winter and they will have better living conditions.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en: Deogratius is a young lad of 25 years married to a farmer and together they have two children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda in a family of four people in a rented house. He operates a motorcycle transport business and has been in it for three years now. He is currently riding someone else’s motorcycle but he is finally buying his own. The purpose of the loan facility is to enable Deogratius to make the final payment on the purchase of his  motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Titus Mbau

texts.en:
Titus Mbau N. is 42 years old and married to Miriam Nyambura. They have three children age 18, 15 and 13 years respectively. They live in Thika, which is also where their business is located. Thika is an up-and-coming town that is very busy with many people engaged in different kinds of business. Many of these people happen to be customers of Titus.

N. has been working as a tailor for one year and earns a monthly profit of Kshs.14,000. He has no history with any other MFI (micro-finance institution) and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs.50,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to add more clothing material for making dresses for sale as the festive season approaches.

The anticipated profit he wants to save and plough back into the business in hope of growing his business to improve his standard of living. He would like to open additional branches of business and in the future, to buy a plot and settle his family. He is very happy and has much interest in his work.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for making dresses for sale on the coming festive season

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo, de 57 años. Hace 5 años que se separó de su esposa, con la que tiene 3 hijos, todos ellos mayores. Pero como padre responsable siempre vela por ellos. Él vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Centro Huachirik. En estos años, de desavenencias, él se siente reconfortado por su trabajo. Ya tienen 30 años dedicándose a la agricultura; sus principales productos son: café, cacao y una variedad de cítricos, los que constantemente cuida, cultiva y riega. Desde las primeras horas del día se dirige muy entusiasta al campo; donde sabe que podrá sentirse tranquilo y en paz con la naturaleza. Para obtener buenos frutos, procura siempre en darle el cuidado suficiente en el siembra y durante su desarrollo y eso lo demuestra en cada cosecha que tiene, donde sus productos son muy bien comprados en el mercado central de Pichanaki. Por eso está invirtiendo, cada vez más en la mejora de sus frutos; para obtener buena calidad de producción. Ricardo, es un hombre alegre y siempre en las reuniones de su banco comunal, llama la atención por su buen ánimo. Esa es la manera de agradecer el apoyo de MFP, ya es el tercer crédito que tiene y está seguro que podrá salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá contratar peones para el cuidado de sus plantaciones de café, ya que  la maleza del campo lo está estropeando.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 57 years old.  Five years ago he separated from his wife with whom he has 3 grown-up children.  However, as a responsible father he is always looking out for them.  He lives in his own home which is in the native community of Centro Huachirik.  In these years of tension, he feels comfort in his work.  He has been a farmer for 30 years.  His main products are coffee, cacao and a variety of citrus fruits which he constantly tends to, cultivates and irrigates.  Very early in the morning he heads off enthusiastically to his fields where he knows that he can feel relaxed and in peace with nature.  To obtain good fruit, he always tries to provide enough care when he is sowing and also during the fruit's development.  This is clear in every harvest that he has as his products sell very well in the central market in Pichanaki.  For this reason, he is investing more and more in improving his fruit trees, in order to obtain a good production quality.

Ricardo is a happy man and he draws attention in his community bank's meetings with his good mood.  This is his way of showing thanks for MFP's support.  This is his third loan and he is certain that he will be able to succeed.  He will use his loan to hire laborers to look after his coffee plantations since the weeds are damaging them.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help him clear weeds from his coffee plantations

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem S. is a 49-year-old married man who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is a security guard who works in the private bank. He started his job more than four year ago. Hem S. is blessed with two young kids who are enrolled in school. He has a life partner in his wife who sells items from a small kiosk in front her house. She sells products such as fast food, cooking ingredient and plastic products.

Hem S.’s wife hopes to enlarge her business, but Hem S. does not have enough capital  to adequately support her business. He is applying for a US$1000 loan to be used by for his wife to purchase a large number of necessary grocery items to sell. Hem S. was not available at that day, so his wife was photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of necessary grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor B. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 40 years old. Melchor is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melchor owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Melchor has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melchor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melchor is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Melchor from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to maintain transport service

loans.name: Lida Mercedes

texts.es:
Lida Mercedes Q. S. tiene 40 años de edad, Es casada, vive con la esposa  y con los hijos,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Lida Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta la música.
texts.en:
Lida is 40 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their children. She lives in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  She has 5 children.

The members of the “Señor de la Salud” (Lord of Health) Communal Bank are located in the Saloma area of Echeandia canton. The bank is dedicated to agricultural laborers on the short crop cycle, who sow corn, rice, and passion fruit. They have been doing this for a long time.

Lida is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn, rice, and passion fruit. She buys her products at Comercial Viscarra and sells the products in Comercial Escudero. Lida is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and passion fruit. The loan will help her economically to supply her necessities. She confronts challenges such as plant plagues and diseases as well as climate variations.

Her dream is to buy more agricultural land.  She loves music.

loans.use: TO BUY AGRICULTURAL SUPPLIES AND FERTILIZERS FOR HER CROPS

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz P. G., tiene 32 años, es soltera, vive con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un solar.

Le gusta cocinar los platos típicos.
texts.en:
Maria Luz P. G., age 32 años, is single. She lives with her children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Maria works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in stalls in the Peña shopping center and also sells them at home or in the market every day.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.
She enjoys cooking traditional dishes.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Ma. Junoise

texts.en:
Ma. Junoise J. is engaged in a fishing business. She also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various kinds of products. She does her best to sustain her sources of livelihood and be able to provide her family with an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a loan of PhP 15,000. This loan will help her buy fishing materials and additional merchandise to sell at her store. She believes that by investing in her business, she will be able to increase her income.

Ma. Junoise J. is 46 years old and a married woman.

loans.use: buy fishing materials and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva P. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Eva is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling hypo(disinfectant) products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Eva is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients in making hypo(disinfectants). This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients in making hypo(disinfectants)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy addional millet to supply to her customers

loans.name: Dat

texts.en: Dat ThiV. is 42 years old and has two children who attend school. She has a shop that provides motor bike repair services.  She has been in this business for four years and was able to expand it when she borrowed from the SEDA credit program.  Her business provides a stable income for her  family and allows her to pay school fees.  She is requesting a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy a motor bike washing machine to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike washing machine

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.en:
Aracely is 23 years old, married and has three children. She and her family live in their own home in the village of Guaraguaos Alto in the Tambogrande district, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Unlike many other residents of the area, Aracely and her family are fortunate to have access to electricity; however they do not have access to potable water. 

For the last three years, Aracely has earned a living by raising poultry and pigs. She raises her animals on land near her house in pens that are spacious and appropriately built. When the animals are full-grown, she sells them to merchants and the general public in the local market. Aracely generates additional income by selling clothes to members of her community and surrounding towns. 

Aracely plans to buy balanced feed to fatten her livestock. She hopes that her animals will gain weight in less time so she can sell them for a higher price in the market. To achieve her goals, she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 500 nuevos soles. Aracely is a hard-working woman. With her businesses she is able to supplement her husband’s income and help pay for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Eng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Each of the thirteen people who have selected Mrs. Eng to be the village bank president will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, in order to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Eng is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow crops to sell to earn some money to support her family. Besides farming, she is a chicken and pig breeder. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. 

So improve her situation, Mrs. Eng is requesting a loan to buy more chickens, piglets and pig and chicken food. Her husband, Mr. Sovan, is a construction worker. She is the mother of two children whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet F. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 41 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Janet owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling vegetables such as string beans and squash in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Janet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Janet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables such as eggplants and squash. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Janet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables.

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mbanga Lucas

texts.en:
Mbanga Lucas N. was born on the 10th of March 1945. He is married to Sophina Nato and he is the father of eight children, with only one child below fifteen years of age. He lives in a five-bedroom apartment with his family. He lives in Tudig, a village in Momo division in the North West Region of Cameroon.

Poverty has been his major setback in life. Due to encouragement from a friend who is a GHAPE member, he joined GHAPE in 2008. The first loan he received was used to buy pigs. He used the profit from that project to sponsor two of his children in the university and one in technical high school. He needs a loan this time which he intends to use to buy pigs, goats, and feed for his animal farm. He is convinced this business will succeed because he is very well versed in the business and knows that they reproduce very fast. He intends to use his proceeds to expand his farm, buy medicine for his children, and to continue to sponsor them in school.

Lucas confesses that ever since he joined GHAPE, his life has never been the same again. The poverty he used to suffer is gradually going away and his children’s school fees have never been a problem again.

He prefers a loan from GHAPE because the time for reimbursement is longer and the interest rate is relatively lower.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy pigs, goats, and feed.

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Rolina is from the village of Tuburan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City.  She is 27 years old, married and has one adult-aged children.  To make a living, Rolina runs a general store. 

Rolina has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.  Rolina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Rolina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP with which she will purchase more products such as home chores need for her general store business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rolina from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchased more products such as home chores needed for her general store business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years and married to David. For the past six years, she has been running a green grocer business. She is a very hardworking woman who makes a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her second loan. She buys greens from the Gikomba Market and sells them in her community in Kibera. Margaret is requesting a loan to buy vegetables in large quantities to sell and increase her profit.

In the future, Margaret would like to open her own stall and start supplying all of Kibera with greens.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of greens to sell

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dorotea, vive con sus hijos D. 16 y 6 años D. edad, administra una tienda y venta D. ropa, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia hace 4 años, está ubicado en un local del mercado municipal, su horario es D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella quiere un préstamo para invertirlo en prendas D. vestir como blusas, faldas, jeans, ropa interior, pues su deseo D. fortalecer el negocio solo se pueD. realiza a través D. un financiamiento, que le permita tener a los clientes nuevas prendas para sus exigencias.
La principal aspiración D. Dorotea es desarrollarse como comerciante, mantener un negocio con suficiente mercadería que le genere mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dorotea lives with her children who are 16 and 6.  She runs a clothes store.  This business came about through her own initiative four years ago.  It is located in premises in the town market.  She works from 6.00am to 5.00pm.

Dorotea would like this loan to invest in clothes such as blouses, skirts, jeans and underwear as she can only achieve her desire to strengthen her business through taking a loan.  This will allow her to have new clothes with which to meet her customers' demands.

Dorotea's main aspiration is to make progress as a saleswoman and maintain a business with enough merchandise that makes her better profits.

loans.use: to invest in clothes such as blouses, skirts, jeans and underwear

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 53 years old, married with three children and lives in the Philippines.

For the past ten years Lucresia has had a shop where she sells tasty dishes such as pancit bihon and chicken adobo. She also sell snacks and beverages.

Lucresia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 PHP to buy the ingredients to make her dishes to sell.

In the future, Lucresia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make her dishes to sell.

loans.name: Juana Margarita Lopez

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos aún estudiando.  Estudió hasta 3ro D. educación secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace seis años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comidas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D.  S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará insumos como papa, chuño, trucha, queso, carne D. cordero, etc.   En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en el norte es militar.
Su sueño es tener un restaurant con comida D. la región diversa para la atención a turistas.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el buen trato D. las promotoras.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medallion) which is located in the District of Pomata, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Juana completed her education through the third year of high school.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan, which was in the amount of 300 PEN, was invested in her business of selling food.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, Juana will buy supplies such as potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), trout, cheese, lamb, and other items. Her children help with operating the business. Juana’s husband is in the military and works in the north.

Her dream is to open a restaurant that serves different regional foods to tourists. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the good service provided by the staff.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), trout, cheese, lamb, and other items.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has a child. Her husband is a security man. She has junior high educational background. Rose sells rice, sugar, Super Glue and soft drinks at Takoradi in the western region of Ghana, which she has done for 15 years. She uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses. 

Rose will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks and other items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks and other items for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 57 years old and married. She has four children.

Eunice works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. She has been running the business for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits. 

She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Eunice has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Eunice aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres D. la Ciudad D. Pilar se unieron con el propósito D. generar un mejor porvenir para sus familias e hijos. Por medio del trabajo conjunto desean ir progresando y volverse unas buenas micro empresarias. El grupo ya está en el 1 ciclo. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas.
La señor Rosalba se dedica a la compra y venta D. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas, calzados y demás. Por medio D. este trabajo ella ha logrado salir adelante y paliar todo los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Uno D. sus proyectos es tener un local donD. pueda ofrecer sus productos y D. esa forma atraer a más clientes, lo que le generará más ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los artículos que venD., como ser frazadas, sabanas, y demás ya que por medio D. esto podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que si obtiene el crédito le será D. gran ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Twelve women from the city of Pilar joined together with the intention of generating a better future for their families and children.  By working collectively they hope to progress so as to become good micro entrepreneurs. The group is in their first loan cycle.  The women describe themselves as hard working, self sacrificing and fighters. 

Rosalba buys and sells all kinds of goods, such as blankets, sheets, shoes and other items.  As a result of this she has been able to get ahead and ease the pressure on all her daily household expenditures.  One of her plans is to have a store where she can sell her goods and as such attract more customers, which will generate more income.  

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy the goods she sells, such as blankets, sheets and more. With this she will be able to meet her customers' demand.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity this gives her, for if she is granted a loan it will be of great benefit to her business.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, sheets and other items to stock her shop.

loans.name: Edis Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Edis Maribel se dedica a la elaboración de golosinas como ser Tacos, enchiladas, pollo con tajadas, baleadas, y refrescos naturales, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona estratégica, por ese lugar pasan las personas que van hacia el hospital y muchas compran sus golosinas, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo por las mañanas y la tardes.
Edis utilizara el credito ya que desea ampliar su negocio, necesita comprar una mesa con sillas y hacer una pequeña glorieta para vender todo el día y parte de la noche.
texts.en:
Señora Edis Maribel makes goodies to eat such as tacos, enchiladas, fried chicken with plantains, tortillas filled with refried beans and cheese and soft drinks. Her business is located in a strategic place. People on their way to the hospital pass by and many buy her goodies. She sells Mondays to Sundays in the mornings and afternoons. 

Edis will use the loan she is asking for to expand her business. She needs to buy a table and chairs and make a small kiosk to be able to sell all day and into the night.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs, zinc sheeting, wood, nails and screws.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon.  He is living with one parent and three siblings.  He has owned a curtain store in his town since 2009.  He gained advantages from his first Kiva loan and was very satisfied with the results.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase drapes of different shapes, designs, and sizes.  In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: to purchase drapes from different shapes, designs and sizes.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a widow and has four children. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. 
Angela buys sacks of raw rice and retails them in her community of Elmina in Cape Coast. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice to keep to retail  later as the price of rice keeps increasing. She wishes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to retail.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, who works hard to support her family, is married and has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for five years. Now requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, she would like  to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Pablo Lorenzo

texts.es:
El Señor. Pablo es socio del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, vive  en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad desde diciembre de 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy amable, gentil y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

El Señor. Pablo tiene 41 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

El trabaja como empleado privado, labora de lunes a sábado todo el día y en las noches recorre la ciudad vendiendo todo tipo de ropa a sus amigos y conocidos, esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir  la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otro tipo de prendas de vestir para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su sueño es de conservar su salud y llegar a tener un local donde vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Pablo is a member of the Emprendedores del Futuro Communal Bank.  He lives in the city of Cuenca, which was named a World Heritage Trust site in December of 1999.  The city has great architectural and natural beauty, and its friendly, kind, and warmhearted people preserve the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Pablo is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 13 and who go to school in the city.  His wife sells Yanbal brand cosmetics for a living.  They own the home they live in.

He works full time as a private employee Mondays through Saturdays and at night he goes all over the city selling different kinds of clothes to his friends and acquaintances.  He has been doing this for two years.

This is the third loan he is taking out through the communal bank and he is going to use it to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and other kinds of clothing to stock his business.

His dream is to maintain his health and to have a place to sell his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and other clothing items

loans.name: Twongerumusaruro / Bgrm Group

texts.fr:
Zachée fait partie du groupe Twongerumusaruro/Bgrm. Le nom du groupe signifie «augmentons la production». Il a 52 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 8 à 22 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Zachée est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées du riz et agrandir la surface de culture du riz en achetant d’autres champs. Avec les profits, Zachée prévoit de soigner et scolarises ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zachée is a member of the Twongerumusaruro/Bgrm group, which means "increasing production". He is 52 years old, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 8 and 22 years old. 6 of these children attend school, and Zachée attended 6 years of school, until the end of primary school.

Zachée is a rice farmer. This is the second loan he is asking for from ACB, and will use it to purchase chemical fertilizers that can aid him in growing rice. In order to grow his business he plans to use selected rice grains and purchase more fields. Zachée hopes to use these profits to provide for the education and health of his children.

loans.use: purchase chemical fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 35 años de edad, esta acompañado con la Sra. Gladys de 28 años de edad, juntos tienen un hijo de 7 años, el cual es la razón de ser de ellos.
Don Juan tiene un taller en el cual se dedica a la reparación de partes eléctricas de automóviles. Hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo, por lo que experiencia tiene. Anteriormente era empleado de una empresa, pero con el correr del tiempo pudo ir juntando para su pequeño capital con el cual se independizo y pudo salir adelante. Juan actualmente ya cuenta con su propio taller empleando a 2 jóvenes que están aprendiendo con él ese oficio. Además de eso manifiesta que su esposa también lo ayuda mucho con los gastos.
Juan solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda y desea ir a ampliando su clientela y por ende su trabajo y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, is partnered with Gladys, 28, and together they have a 7 year-old son who is their reason for living.  Juan has a workshop where he repairs the electrical parts of automobiles.  He has been doing this kind of work for more than 20 years, and so he has quite a bit of experience.  Before, he worked as an employee in a company, but over time he gathered together a small amount of capital which he used to become independent, so that he could get ahead.  Now Juan has his own workshop and employs 2 young people who are learning this trade from him.  In addition, he states that his wife also helps a lot with the expenses.  

Juan is requesting a loan to buy spare parts since there is strong demand for his business, and he wants to expand his customer base and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to later sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Kator, South Sudan, for four years.

Anna requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón, necesita invertir un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería e instalar su negocio en la feria de su pueblo ya que llega mucha gente y él quiere tener una entrada de dinero para su familia, comprará productos como gaciosas, jugos, agua en bolsa y otros para venderlos en la feria.
Simón ha tenido una buena experiencia en el manejo de estos préstamos gracias a Dios sus familiares se encuentran bien y también han sido beneficiados con este progreso en el comercio.
texts.en:
Simón needs to invest a new loan in buying merchandise and installing his business in his village market as there are a lot of people who visit the market and he would like to make money for his family.  He will buy products such as soda, juice, bagged water, etc. to sell in the market.

Simón has good experience in managing these loans.  Thanks to God, his family members are well and they have benefited from the progress he has made in his business.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice and bags of water
